I have so much faith that you too will see the value in these alarms, that I have opted for an all or nothing campaign. You are my test market and ultimately decide if these alarms will come to market.
Knob Sentry will install on door knobs and handles anywhere in the world! They are self-contained and powered by a 9 volt battery. Nothing drains the battery until the siren is sounding.
Best of all, there are NO MONTHLY MONITORING FEES and can be purchased one piece at a time until you have the amount of security you desire. After that, there are no more expenses.
I was born on a small farm in Pennsylvania. During college I earned an Associate's Degree in Electronic Systems Technology and gained 40+ years experience in prototyping, troubleshooting and repair. The need for these alarms surfaced when my mother developed dementia and we worried that she would wander off. When dad started using these alarms, mom resented the idea. When we explained that it was a home security system, she liked the idea.
I am at the beginning of this start up business (they are still made on my diningroom table). With sales starting to increase, I need to move into a facility, add employees, purchase some equipment and really start the sales momentum by purchasing infomercials. That is where I need your support. At a minimum that will cost $35,000.
The manufacturing process is flowcharted, the labor force is ready, vendors are waiting for our order and the distribution channels are thought out. I believe all problems that could delay this project have been addressed and I am confident that we can deliver in a timely manner.
Now I don't expect you to do this for nothing. The perks are designed so you get something out of the deal too. What better gift can I give than your safety and security.

story:
Plug in your phone or tablet and control it on TableConnect’s 60″ inch surface. TableConnect unlocks a new dimension that allows for the use of millions of available apps on a larger scale touch device. Enjoy your personal smartphone or tablet experience on the big surface and share it together with friends, colleagues and family.


  • TableConnect is the first large scale multi-touch that offers direct connectivity to smartphones and tablets.

  • It takes advantage of existing software ecosystems like iOS and Android using the connected smartphone or tablet device as a host.

  • TableConnect therefore unlocks a new dimension that allows for the use of millions of available apps by transferring them to a larger display

  • It enables you to share your personal app experience with friends, colleagues and family on a oversized multi-touch surface.



WORK
Enhance your demonstrations and put your customers right into the center of your brand. Show off the uniqueness of your solutions at a size that leaves an impression and let your audience be part of an interactive presentation experience with TableConnect.


SOCIALIZE
The first truly social touch screen device ever. People gather around their PCs and phones all the time but the devices are simply not made to be used by several people at once.  With its appealing cutting edge design, the table attracts the attention of those nearby and convinces them to get involved. Multi-touch, in literal terms, has never been as true as what is offered with TableConnect


PLAY
Select from millions of games or entertainment applications and share the experience with family and friends! TableConnect offers a new and distinctive experience of interactive social gaming & entertainment. Regardless of whether you enjoy a game of Chess or Pinball HD, get together and be ready for some real multi-user interaction like never seen before on a touch device.


1. True multi-user experience
Direct interaction with content is just more intuitive. While multi-touch so far has mostly been associated with two-finger operation, multi-touch on TableConnect really opens up new ways of interaction. Keyboard and mouse are a thing of the past. Through TableConnect's huge size, multitouch operation becomes a multiuser experience.

2. No learning curve
We envisioned TableConnect. A giant multi-touch table that allows you to plug in your smartphone or tablet and use all the apps as if they were on the original device. You don’t need to learn new software, instead you can enjoy the familiar surface of your personal device on a big screen. Simply just Plug & Play

3. Save on development costs
There are many multi-touch solutions already in use around the world, you might say. But let´s take a closer look here. Most of these solutions rely on proprietary software (and sometimes hardware) that need custom apps, specifically created for their systems. Due to the naturally low infiltration of such devices, the number of available developers is sparse, resulting in more expensive app development costs for apps.
TableConnect on the other hand directly connects to the extensive ecosystem of iOS and Android apps. As a result we believe that custom app development very often will not be necessary at all. And even if you do need a custom app, the development process will definitely be less expensive considering the amount of gifted iOS and Android developers available worldwide.
This circumstance will also be key to see innovative solutions specifically designed for TableConnect in the future.

4. A real table after all
And last but not least, let´s talk about the design. While almost any other multitouch “table” out there really is just a tv with bolt-on legs and an ugly bezel, TableConnect in contrast is a piece of luxury furniture. Use it as you would use any other table. Sit on it if you want, get work done or eat lunch with your family and colleagues. Because of it´s seamless design there will also be no dust or breadcrumbs trapped in the corners of the screen.



We are a team of creative brains working hard to make this dream of our´s come true. Naturally there has been some heavy lifting involved with this project and it took a lot of time to find the right partners who genuinely share our vision with the same passion and care for all the little details.

At this stage of the project, we need money to produce the 60 inch prototype. This is what the sum of this Indiegogo campaign will be used for.

With the full-size-prototype we can perfect all the software, hardware, design and production details, to get TableConnect ready for the market.

By funding our project, you are not only helping a bunch of highly dedicated designers and developers realize their vision, but you also have the chance to receive one of many beautiful pledges if you support us!



Inspired by the monolith in Stanley Kubrik’s 2001: A Space Odyssey, TableConnect follows a reduced but sophisticated design language. We wanted to achieve a product that is more than a technical device. We invested countless hours which led to a timeless, reduced body seamlessly covered with ultra-sturdy glass that secretly contains all the functional buttons and a beautiful 60 inch screen.

The anodized black aluminum legs make TableConnect a one-of-a-kind crafted piece of artwork with considerable thought on practicality. Take off one leg to use TableConnect in a vertical position, for example as an interactive display. Put TableConnect on its side to use it in landscape mode, for interactive presentations. Remove all legs to mount TableConnect on every surface.

TableConnect’s timeless monolithic design and precise craftsmanship makes it a device built to last.




Here are the key features we are working on for TableConnect:


We have taken some extra effort to make TableConnect’s surface look good in any surrounding. An extra anti-glare layer attached to the panels heavy-duty glass, minimizes reflections so you can enjoy the full TableConnect experience without distractions.

To achieve a seamless and intuitive experience while using TableConnect we made the decision to implement active touch-sensor areas on the surface of the device. With the home button located on all four corners and the orientation buttons at the edges, we made sure that the most frequently used controls are easily accessible.

Use over 1,5 million readily available apps. Create new apps made for TableConnect’s big surface and true multi-user performance. TableConnect simply adds a new dimension to app interaction.


Several backlit sensor buttons provide access to the most used controls of TableConnect, also avoiding complicated menu structures.


To transfer all the necessary data between the host device and TableConnect, we use state of the art technology like HDMI (display signal), Bluetooth (touch signals) and WiFi. TableConnect will offer full iOS & Android connectivity.


One remarkable feature of TableConnect that separates it from all touch devices out there is it’s incredibly beautiful seamless surface. There are no edges that would stop your fingers while swiping and no chance for dirt getting trapped inside the device.


Frequent visitors have an easy life with TableConnect since it’s app provides easy one-touch-pairing making sure you’re ready to touch within seconds.



Since we started this project, we've put a lot of time and money into the development of TableConnect. We developed a fully functional 32 inch proof-of-concept of TableConnect which already assisted in testing new iterations of the software will aid in further development.

To bring TableConnect to the next stage we need your support via this Indiegogo campaign to enable us to progress further and construct a full size 60 inch prototype that will include all the features planned for the final product.

This prototype will also help us to iron out all the hardware and design features and thereby build a platform that will allow us to fine-tune all the software features (like better response time, quick pairing recognition, Smart Areas implementation, etc.) and finally get TableConnect ready for the market.




When we first envisioned TableConnect, we made a YouTube demonstration video but didn’t tell anyone that it was an elaborate visual effects fake. News outlets from around the world jumped onto it - Forbes, The Sun, Engadget, Gizmodo - to name only a few. The video jumped to 2 million views within three days and became the most viewed YouTube video in the world on one day. It was crazy.

And so was the demand. We received hundreds of buying requests for a product that didn’t exist …people really like what we did here and that was the perfect motivation to start development and team up with some ingenious brains to bring TableConnect to life.

We developed the proof-of-concept and came up with a very distinct design for the final product. Now we are at a stage where we are looking for funding to build the 60 inch prototype, our last step before we can enter production and start taking orders for TableConnect.



58-inch Table Connect for iPhone multitouch surface easily dwarfs your iPad
engadget.com

People said the iPad was just a giant iPhone – so what would they have made of this? Three technology whizzes from Austria have been tinkering on a sleek, 52-inch table with a working iPhone interface, including all the multi-touch capabilities.
Forbes

THESE gadget boffins have taken their love of iPhones to a new level – by turning theirs into a TABLE.
The Sun

The iPhone’s 3.5-inch display is, at least to Apple, big enough for normal every day usage. And there’s probably hundreds of thousands of folks out there who would agree with that (even if larger screen devices are becomingly increasingly popular), but sometimes you just want to do your photo viewing on something bigger. And not just bigger, but something you can still interact with in the same way you would with your iPhone. Luckily, the 58-inch multitouch table exists, and it’s the real deal.
slashgear.com

The Apple iPhone 4 may be a contender for the Greatest Gadget of the 21st Century, but you can't eat your dinner off it. That's where Table Connect comes in, a convergence of furniture and phone that lets you control your apps and games on its surface -- if it's really real, that is.
tuaw.com

Despite the fact that we can’t offer you TableConnect at this stage we have some amazing goodies ready for you! For more details have look at the pledges to the right sidebar. 

Click to open large images in new window:



Our additional pledges:


TC Wallpaper included in Supporter, Super Supporter, Honored Supporter, Honored Supporter Bundle and All-In pledges.



Origami included in Super Supporter, Honored Supporter, Honored Supporter Bundle and All-In pledges.

Buttons included in TC-Coaster, TC-T-Shirt, TC-Sleeve, TableConnect Micro, Honored Supporter Bundle and All-In Pledge.



I contributed to a perk but I forgot to add the extra costs for shipping. How can I increase the amount?
No problem! If you'd like to add funds for shipping, just make another contribution, select "No Perk, Just a Contribution.” and type in the shipping fee.

I can't get my payment to work in Paypal, what should I do?
Email the Indiegogo Customer Happiness Team at support@indiegogo.com.
They'll be able to track your transaction and help with any issues.

When will it be available?
Our plan is to get the full-sized prototype built within the next 6 months. After that, we will gear up for production and at the same time sales start. We expect to ship the first orders within 12 - 18 months from now.

How much will it cost?
This is a tough one to answer because it really depends on the demand and costs of production. We expect the 60 inch TableConnect to cost around € 25.000. TableConnect 32 is expected to cost around €15.000.

So even if you are not able to afford one for your private entertainment this does not mean you´ll never be able to use one. If everything works out, you´ll enjoy using TableConnect in shopping malls, restaurants, museums, shops and trade fairs around the world.

Will it work with every iOS device?
TableConnect will be shipped with a fully pre-configured iOS-Device (iPhone or iPad). The minimum hardware requirement for TableConnect host devices will be an iPhone 4, from the current state of production. All iOS devices need a jailbreak at this stage of development. The availability of jailbreaks for different iOS devices and versions of iOS varies greatly. In general it can be said that as long as a jailbreak is applied, an iOS device will be able to be used with TableConnect. We will provide a detailed list of compatible devices and a manual for configuration.

What if you fail to reach the funding target?
In addition we worked out alternative plans to find investors and make our vision a reality.

What if you raise more that EUR 40.000?
With additional money we can speed up the development process and bring TableConnect to the market earlier.

Why can’t you offer TableConnect for sale right away?
Since we cannot guarantee delivery dates we don’t want to make promises we can’t keep. This is also the main reason we decided to take smaller steps toward our goal and reduce legal risks.

If you have any other questions, don’t hesitate and ask away: indiegogo@tableconnect.net
We aim to reply to all enquiries within 24 hours.



Embed our beautiful banners on your website and receive some extra props from the TableConnect Team! Thank you!


Footnotes for the "Be among the 1st to own it" pledge:

* Technical specifications are subject to change. Order has to be made within 2 weeks after our written notice that TableConnect 60” starts shipping (you will receive a personal email).

** Shipping expected to start in about 12-18 months, subject to change.

*** If for any reason TableConnect 60” does not come into existence, your pledge is non-refundable. In case the campaign does not reach its goal, you will however of course NOT be charged!

**** Subject to change.

story:
[PSSST! Never heard of Decal CMS before? Check out the tour I mention in the intro video here: http://www.decalcms.com/tour/]

There is not a single CMS today which adequately handles the task of editing structured data.... which is the only thing a CMS is supposed to do!

Why is that such a problem?

One word: mobile

When you deploy a website these days you need it to look beautiful on any device.

You need to make sure that the structure of the document is maintained ... 

... that "formatting instructions" (like font styles and element positioning) are kept out of the content and in the stylesheets where they belong.

To deal with the problem of editing structured data (which is basically what HTML is), today's content management systems do one of two things:

  1. Limit the type of content someone can edit (ie. they can only update blog posts or "body text" -- this seriously restricts the design process)
  2. Use HTML forms to provide structured input so that content can be saved in a highly structured database (this is either very unusable, very expensive or both)

At the other end of the spectrum we have DIY editing tools which allow people to do things like change font sizes, colours and position of elements on the screen via a "drag 'n' drop" interface.

They might get it looking okay on their own screen, but it will break when they try to view it on a mobile phone.

How can we cost effectively allow highly structured websites to be edited, hassle free, by non-technical people ... without giving them enough rope to hang themselves?

This is where Decal CMS comes in. Decal provides a simple way for frontend web developers to make their HTML editable, without any backend coding or database work.

By adding a few simple attributes to your static HTML documents, you can take a chunk of a page and, for example, allow the user to edit the heading, image and body text, right on the page and optionally repeat this "component" one or more times down the page.

For the content editor, this means they can always see EXACTLY what their page will look like as they type. No more "previews"!

As the developer, you have complete control over how much or how little they can deviate from the structure you've provided.

The content manager makes no design decisions.

  • They can't change font styles, sizes or colours
  • They can't change spacing
  • They can't hit enter a bunch of times to add space below a heading
  • They can't drag things around
  • They can't paste in random HTML (unless you specifically allow it)

As the developer, you can provide "custom classes" which give the content editor the ability to select from pre-defined styles you have included in your CSS.

You can see how that works in this short video from our "Decal Extended Tour":

The result?

  • A CMS that's intuitive and easy to use with no instruction manual or external style guide
  • A website that looks just as beautiful on any device as it did the day you handed it over (no matter how many people are editing it)
  • Faster, cheaper deployments with no hosting hassles or coding/database work

What about plugins?

Decal is a hosted CMS.

We take care of all the hosting woes, security issues and scalability/performance problems that usually plague your typical self-hosted CMS (*cough* wordpress *cough*).

In order to provide a rich plugin architecture we have developed a concept called "filters".

You can write your plugins in ANY language and host them ANYWHERE.

You heard that right ... don't believe me? Take a look at this video (from our "Decal Extended Tour"):

So if this thing already exists... why are you looking for crowd funding?

Firstly, allow me to introduce myself. I'm Iain Dooley and I run a little software business in Australia called Working Software.

We started work on Decal CMS many, many moons ago.

In fact, it began life as a drop in replacement for existing WYSIWYG tools called Richie Rich: the poor little rich text editor way back in 2006!

I was working as a freelance web developer and my pet hate was WYSIWYG tools and the way they allowed the user to utterly destroy the look and feel of their website.

Decal CMS began with a question:

Why can't we just allow people to edit the DOM directly?
Why bother with "word style" editing tools at all?

The whole paradigm seemed fundamentally broken.

Richie Rich was my first attempt at this, and it was completely horrible.

Several iterations and a couple of new team members later at the end of 2009, we discovered that something new had arrived in modern browsers: it was called contenteditable.

It was the piece that was always missing from Richie Rich, most notably allowing native keypress handling and cursor positioning in the browser.

We were excited, and we dedicated the next 6 months of our lives to launching Decal to the world.

We got it done and we started using it with our own clients but failed to gain traction with others in the web development community.

It was a hard sell.

The world had changed and everyone loved Wordpress now.

New browsers had arrived so the fact that our editing tool only worked in Firefox was a show stopper -- everyone loved Webkit.

The deployment process (one of the main selling points) gets cumbersome when your site gets large and the error reporting that tells you if something is misconfigured is cryptic so it's very easy to get completely stuck.

There were bugs in several of the more complex features.

The system was slow....

.... but .... DECAL WORKED.

At a fundamental level we could see that this was something truly incredible.

It just wasn't quite there yet.

Then we ran out of money. Although we kept building Decal CMS on the side we had to focus on other work to get cash.

At the end of 2011 I was lamenting the tale of Decal to a friend.

I didn't want to keep sinking time and money into Decal unless we really KNEW that we had a market for it -- unless we knew we were solving a problem that people WANTED SOLVED, and that they were WILLING TO PAY FOR (guess who'd read the Lean Startup?) .... 

.... but how could we gain traction with web developers?

Decal is a real "show me" product. The points of difference are not easily communicated, even through video.

I knew that Decal wasn't ready for prime time.

We couldn't expect people to start using it in real world deployments for real clients. 

How could we possibly find out if this is something people would use and pay for if we couldn't even explain what it was and people couldn't find out for themselves?

My friend told me something very important ... he said:

"You don't need people to be able to use it on real world projects, you just need them to be able to use it enough to understand it".

This was a turning point.

We immediately sprung into action building a "tour" for Decal that would demonstrate the value succinctly and effectively enough that people would get why it was great, without having to actually have used it for a real world project.

It wasn't easy.

It took us a year.

But we came up with the Decal tour and it's worked WONDERS.

People love it. Great.

Still, whilst getting email addresses at the end of the tour is fantastic, I'm not going to base a decision to spend another 6 - 8 months and a bunch of cash building this thing unless we get people to make a commitment....

.... and that's why we're crowd funding.

The fact is that, if we wanted to we could finish Decal under our own steam financially, but it's going to be a LOT of work.

Sure it's great to get an extra $20,000 towards the project, but it's not essential: what is essential is knowing that we are solving a REAL PROBLEM that people will PAY FOR.

So ... are we?

Your pledge will provide the answer.

What you will get for your money, and when

We only have one "perk", and only one funding level: $200.

It's set deliberately high enough to dissuade the window shoppers.

We only want people who build websites for a living, for whom we're solving a genuine problem to fund this campaign. Not friends and well-wishers.

If that's you, then $200 is not prohibitively high.

Your initial $200 investment will buy you 1 year's access to Decal for up to 10 websites. 

If one of these sites is storing an unusually large amount of data (images/video) or has an unusually large amount of traffic and it's costing us a tonne of money we reserve the right to request you pay a monthly charge over and above your initial investment, but we'll be reasonable about it.

We just need to make sure we don't spend all our money on hosting costs and drive outselves out of business.

Long term, we haven't really figured out pricing yet, but it won't be dissimilar to something like LightCMS or WPEngine.

We plan on using our initial customers to verify what our typical hosting costs are and then determine what we need to charge in order to stay profitable.

Getting this project fully funded will allow us to dedicate much more time to building Decal than we would if we were self-funding, and we estimate we'll have v1 launched by about June 2014.

What will Decal CMS v1 include?

Decal CMS is a hosted product. We will launch with hosting in the USA, Western Europe and Australia.

The version we launch with will feature the ability to deploy a full CMS (including the ability to add multiple pages, edit menus etc.) by adding attributes to your HTML. This is demonstrated in the Decal Tour.

The deployment will be via Dropbox or git commit hooks (with github and bitbucket integration).

Content migration will allow you to modify the structure of your site and have the data automatically mapped from the old structure, into the new site seamlessly.

The editor will work in the latest Firefox, Safari and Chrome with IE10 potentially being supported (although we can't guarantee that).

We will offer a set of basic "filters" (our version of plugins) for free such as menu editors, SEO and social media tools.

The system will be fully documented with thorough error reporting, slick tutorial and on-boarding process and training tools for clients.

The "filters" system will be fully documented for people to being development their own filters.

The API will be documented and published, delivering content in either XML or JSON formats.

Risks and challenges

As mentioned above we already have Decal built.

We also already have a version of the editor which works in all modern browsers (no IE yet, sorry) which is what we use for the Decal Tour.

Basically what we're going to do is combine this updated frontend with the backend, rip out a bunch of unnecessarily complex features, improve the deployment process and dramatically speed up performance.

We already know precisely how we'll do all these things so whilst it's hard to guarantee precisely how long it will take (probably between 6 and 8 months) we can guarantee we won't run out of money doing it and that we have the skills and expertise to make it the project happen.

You've mentioned an "Extended Tour" ... can I check it out?

You sure can! The Decal Extended Tour is setup to give you a really comprehensive understanding of how everything works. The final version will be slightly different but the fundamental features will be as demonstrated in the extended tour.

If you'd like to try it out email team@workingsoftware.com.au with "Extended tour request" in the subject line.

More questions?

Email team@workingsoftware.com.au. We'd love to hear from you and we're here to help.
story_txt:
[PSSST! Never heard of Decal CMS before? Check out the tour I mention in the intro video here: http://www.decalcms.com/tour/]
There is not a single CMS today which adequately handles the task of editing structured data.... which is the only thing a CMS is supposed to do!
Why is that such a problem?One word: mobileWhen you deploy a website these days you need it to look beautiful on any device.You need to make sure that the structure of the document is maintained ... ... that "formatting instructions" (like font styles and element positioning) are kept out of the content and in the stylesheets where they belong.To deal with the problem of editing structured data (which is basically what HTML is), today's content management systems do one of two things:

Limit the type of content someone can edit (ie. they can only update blog posts or "body text" -- this seriously restricts the design process)


Use HTML forms to provide structured input so that content can be saved in a highly structured database (this is either very unusable, very expensive or both)

At the other end of the spectrum we have DIY editing tools which allow people to do things like change font sizes, colours and position of elements on the screen via a "drag 'n' drop" interface.They might get it looking okay on their own screen, but it will break when they try to view it on a mobile phone.How can we cost effectively allow highly structured websites to be edited, hassle free, by non-technical people ... without giving them enough rope to hang themselves?This is where Decal CMS comes in. Decal provides a simple way for frontend web developers to make their HTML editable, without any backend coding or database work.
By adding a few simple attributes to your static HTML documents, you can take a chunk of a page and, for example, allow the user to edit the heading, image and body text, right on the page and optionally repeat this "component" one or more times down the page.

For the content editor, this means they can always see EXACTLY what their page will look like as they type. No more "previews"!

As the developer, you have complete control over how much or how little they can deviate from the structure you've provided.

The content manager makes no design decisions.


They can't change font styles, sizes or colours


They can't change spacing


They can't hit enter a bunch of times to add space below a heading


They can't drag things around


They can't paste in random HTML (unless you specifically allow it)



As the developer, you can provide "custom classes" which give the content editor the ability to select from pre-defined styles you have included in your CSS.

You can see how that works in this short video from our "Decal Extended Tour":





The result?



A CMS that's intuitive and easy to use with no instruction manual or external style guide


A website that looks just as beautiful on any device as it did the day you handed it over (no matter how many people are editing it)


Faster, cheaper deployments with no hosting hassles or coding/database work



What about plugins?
Decal is a hosted CMS.
We take care of all the hosting woes, security issues and scalability/performance problems that usually plague your typical self-hosted CMS (*cough* wordpress *cough*).
In order to provide a rich plugin architecture we have developed a concept called "filters".
You can write your plugins in ANY language and host them ANYWHERE.
You heard that right ... don't believe me? Take a look at this video (from our "Decal Extended Tour"):


So if this thing already exists... why are you looking for crowd funding?
Firstly, allow me to introduce myself. I'm Iain Dooley and I run a little software business in Australia called Working Software.
We started work on Decal CMS many, many moons ago.
In fact, it began life as a drop in replacement for existing WYSIWYG tools called Richie Rich: the poor little rich text editor way back in 2006!
I was working as a freelance web developer and my pet hate was WYSIWYG tools and the way they allowed the user to utterly destroy the look and feel of their website.
Decal CMS began with a question:
Why can't we just allow people to edit the DOM directly?Why bother with "word style" editing tools at all?
The whole paradigm seemed fundamentally broken.
Richie Rich was my first attempt at this, and it was completely horrible.
Several iterations and a couple of new team members later at the end of 2009, we discovered that something new had arrived in modern browsers: it was called contenteditable.
It was the piece that was always missing from Richie Rich, most notably allowing native keypress handling and cursor positioning in the browser.
We were excited, and we dedicated the next 6 months of our lives to launching Decal to the world.
We got it done and we started using it with our own clients but failed to gain traction with others in the web development community.
It was a hard sell.
The world had changed and everyone loved Wordpress now.
New browsers had arrived so the fact that our editing tool only worked in Firefox was a show stopper -- everyone loved Webkit.
The deployment process (one of the main selling points) gets cumbersome when your site gets large and the error reporting that tells you if something is misconfigured is cryptic so it's very easy to get completely stuck.
There were bugs in several of the more complex features.
The system was slow....
.... but .... DECAL WORKED.
At a fundamental level we could see that this was something truly incredible.
It just wasn't quite there yet.
Then we ran out of money. Although we kept building Decal CMS on the side we had to focus on other work to get cash.
At the end of 2011 I was lamenting the tale of Decal to a friend.
I didn't want to keep sinking time and money into Decal unless we really KNEW that we had a market for it -- unless we knew we were solving a problem that people WANTED SOLVED, and that they were WILLING TO PAY FOR (guess who'd read the Lean Startup?) .... 
.... but how could we gain traction with web developers?
Decal is a real "show me" product. The points of difference are not easily communicated, even through video.
I knew that Decal wasn't ready for prime time.
We couldn't expect people to start using it in real world deployments for real clients. 
How could we possibly find out if this is something people would use and pay for if we couldn't even explain what it was and people couldn't find out for themselves?
My friend told me something very important ... he said:
"You don't need people to be able to use it on real world projects, you just need them to be able to use it enough to understand it".
This was a turning point.
We immediately sprung into action building a "tour" for Decal that would demonstrate the value succinctly and effectively enough that people would get why it was great, without having to actually have used it for a real world project.
It wasn't easy.
It took us a year.
But we came up with the Decal tour and it's worked WONDERS.
People love it. Great.
Still, whilst getting email addresses at the end of the tour is fantastic, I'm not going to base a decision to spend another 6 - 8 months and a bunch of cash building this thing unless we get people to make a commitment....
.... and that's why we're crowd funding.
The fact is that, if we wanted to we could finish Decal under our own steam financially, but it's going to be a LOT of work.
Sure it's great to get an extra $20,000 towards the project, but it's not essential: what is essential is knowing that we are solving a REAL PROBLEM that people will PAY FOR.
So ... are we?
Your pledge will provide the answer.
What you will get for your money, and when
We only have one "perk", and only one funding level: $200.
It's set deliberately high enough to dissuade the window shoppers.
We only want people who build websites for a living, for whom we're solving a genuine problem to fund this campaign. Not friends and well-wishers.
If that's you, then $200 is not prohibitively high.
Your initial $200 investment will buy you 1 year's access to Decal for up to 10 websites. 
If one of these sites is storing an unusually large amount of data (images/video) or has an unusually large amount of traffic and it's costing us a tonne of money we reserve the right to request you pay a monthly charge over and above your initial investment, but we'll be reasonable about it.
We just need to make sure we don't spend all our money on hosting costs and drive outselves out of business.

We plan on using our initial customers to verify what our typical hosting costs are and then determine what we need to charge in order to stay profitable.

The deployment will be via Dropbox or git commit hooks (with github and bitbucket integration).
Content migration will allow you to modify the structure of your site and have the data automatically mapped from the old structure, into the new site seamlessly.
The editor will work in the latest Firefox, Safari and Chrome with IE10 potentially being supported (although we can't guarantee that).
We will offer a set of basic "filters" (our version of plugins) for free such as menu editors, SEO and social media tools.
The system will be fully documented with thorough error reporting, slick tutorial and on-boarding process and training tools for clients.
The "filters" system will be fully documented for people to being development their own filters.

Risks and challenges

Basically what we're going to do is combine this updated frontend with the backend, rip out a bunch of unnecessarily complex features, improve the deployment process and dramatically speed up performance.
We already know precisely how we'll do all these things so whilst it's hard to guarantee precisely how long it will take (probably between 6 and 8 months) we can guarantee we won't run out of money doing it and that we have the skills and expertise to make it the project happen.
You've mentioned an "Extended Tour" ... can I check it out?
You sure can! The Decal Extended Tour is setup to give you a really comprehensive understanding of how everything works. The final version will be slightly different but the fundamental features will be as demonstrated in the extended tour.
If you'd like to try it out email team@workingsoftware.com.au with "Extended tour request" in the subject line.
More questions?
Email team@workingsoftware.com.au. We'd love to hear from you and we're here to help.

story:
Thunder UnderBass is an Ultra- HiFi Digital Audio Media Center and subwoofer with USB 2 connectivity and loaded with killer Digital Signal Processing - DSP.  Thunder UnderBass turns any pair of active speakers you already own (that includes the soundbar you bought for your TV) into 192kHz/ 24bit digital dynamos.  

Thunder UnderBass fits nicely ON your desktop, UNDER your TV, on a bookshelf, and slides nicely into a component rack.  Now you can watch TV, movies, play video games, and listen to music the way it's meant to be heard!  Want to stream music from your smartphone?  Do it!  Bluetooth is built in.


Any of the following devices connect to Thunder UnderBass either as a source component or output device via the appropriate cable or via Bluetooth.  With the exception of traditional passive speakers, Thunder UnderBass is universally compatible with virtually any audio equipment.



Finally!  Put deep accurate bass ON your desktop or UNDER your TV... where it is unquestionably most effective.  We designed the subwoofer to move you and not your neighbors or your desk. Now you can take your powered desktop or computer speakers and TV soundbar from zero to hero instantly (active speakers only).


Digital Signal Processing

As is true of most great innovations we asked ourselves, “What if?”  What if we took the best digital elements of our professional-grade studio monitors, build it for the consumer market and designed it to work with anyone’s existing equipment? The answer to that question was Thunder UnderBass.  More about this later, but our DSP reaches into your analog speakers and "makes them digital."  We make drivers perform the way they are supposed to. 


Digital to Analog & Analog to Digital

You'll appreciate the ultra-low jitter high-resolution digital audio you'll be listening to up to 192 kHz/ 24 bit.  We use advanced Analog Devices DSP and Cirrus Logic & Burr Brown CODECs for all the A-D and D-A, because they kick ass and we know you want to rock.

Some people ask us why all the DSP though?  Because the best DACs on Earth cost thousands of dollars and even a perfect digital signal converted to perfection sounds ordinary on an ordinary set of speakers.  We write our own killer DSP to make even average speakers sound amazing. So now you don't have to run out and buy a $3K pair of monitors to appreciate high resolution audio.


USB from Your Computer & Optical from Your TV

    We use the super-fast XMOS USB 2.0/ Audio Class 2.0 solution to get sound to and from the computer.  Use Thunder UnderBass' optical input/output to connect your TV and soundbar. No need to worry about any special cables to buy we're including the USB and optical cables with your Thunder UnderBass.


    Dolby Digital Decoding & The Works!

    Really into gaming?  Looking for the latest in Dolby Digital decoding?  Need an ultra-versatile system for the entire family?  You need The Works! This is our top of the line, no holds barred everything included super-system.  For movies, games, and sports The Works delivers a sound experience rarely heard on anything less than a $3K home-theater system.

    To do this right though we had to design custom matching front Right, Left and Center channel speakers to play nice with Dolby.  These cutie-pies are tuned and precision matched to Thunder UnderBass and produce an expressive sound stage that will surprise you.


    The Awesome JRiver Media Center

    You also get the super-deluxe JRiver Media Center.  It will already be provisioned with the best settings for plug and play awesomeness. And JRiver Media Center automatically finds and syncs all the music on your computer, iTunes, or NAS.

    Audio File Types We Support & Play

    There are a lot of audio file types out there and while most of these formats you will probably never play, it's always better to have it and not need it than to need it and not have it.

    While we're here we should talk about DSD for a moment.  Most of the digital audio world  (including Digital Signal Processing) currently runs on PCM or Pulse Code Modulation.  

    In the PCM world, faster speeds and more bits are both better, and 192 kHz (speed) with 24 bits (depth) is as good as most downloads get.  DSD (or Direct Stream Digital) is a format which some argue is more "listenable" than PCM, and is also the archive format of choice for many producers.  

    The problem with it is that any manipulation of it, even volume control, requires that the data be turned into analog first.  Still, buying music in the DSD format might be a good idea if the tracks sold are in the same format as they are archived in. 

    Bottom line is JRiver Media Center will  decode your DSD files and hand them over to Thunder UnderBass at 192 kHz/ 24 bit PCM for playback.


    Bluetooth Built In

    Of course Thunder UnderBass has Bluetooth built in so you're ready to go any time from any Bluetooth capable device; computer, smartphone, or tablet for example. Even though Bluetooth isn't high-resolution (yet) the convenience is definitely a bonus!


    Killer Headphone Amps 

    If you like headphones, great!  We do too, so we included EIGHT stellar HiFi headphone amplifiers with two headphone jacks.  So if you're a gamer like some of us here, you and your friends will hear in high resolution through the cans too.


    Geek Out With iOS & Android Smart Apps

    If you like to get techie, good news, we've been thinking about you.  We partnered with a savvy app developer to assist with our custom tool sets.  Above is a screenshot that is similar to what the analyzer will look like.  We're including some advanced user utilities in the form of iOS & Android friendly smart APPs. You will appreciate the suite of parametric equalizers, high & low level balance, Q control, room EQ and crossover optimization.



    WOOFERS
    (2) 5.25” High Excursion Woofers
    Xmax: 6mm 1 way
    (2) 60 Watts Peak/ 50 Watts Continuous
    30 Hz – 300 Hz +/- 1 dB
    Adjustable Crossover 40 Hz – 250 Hz 48 dB/ Octave (Preset at 150 Hz)
    106 dB Peak
    100 dB Continuous
    8 ohms

    WOOFER AMPLIFIERS
    (2) Custom Class D TI Based Amplifiers
    300 Watts Capable, Deployed at 100 Watts

    HEADPHONE AMPLIFIERS
    (8) Burr Brown OP-Amps
    High Current & Low Distortion
    Universal Compatibility with any Modern Headphone
    Individual Volume Control via Smart Apps

    DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSING
    Analog Devices Sigma and SHARC Processors
    Cirrus Logic and Burr Brown CODECs

    USB 2.0
    XMOS Based Asynchronous USB Audio
    Stereo – 2 Channels Input/ 2 Channels Output
    Supports up to 192 kHz/ 24 bit
    MAC and Linux Compatible (Windows w/ Driver Download – Included)
    DSD 128 over PCM Capable

    INPUT
    SPDIF Switchable; COAX or Toslink (All standard bit rates and bit depths supported via asynchronous rate converter - 32kHz/16 bit to 192 kHz/24 bit)
    Stereo 3.5 mm AUX Input (Front Panel)
    USB 2.0 Input (Computer Input)
    USB Input (Firmware Update – Uses USB Memory Stick)

    OUTPUT
    Toslink Optical PCM, 32kHz/16 bit - 192 kHz/24 bit (Preset @ 48 kHz/ 24 bit)
    Line Level  L/R RCA Outputs
    Stereo 3.5mm AUX Output
    (2) Stereo 3.5mm Headphone Outputs (Front Panel)

    ADVANCED USER UTILITIES (iOS & Android app usable)
    Crossover Frequency 40 Hz – 250 Hz
    Crossover Depth; Choose 12/ 24/ 48 dB/Octave
    High/ Low Speaker Level Balance
    Parametric EQ for Driver Correction
    (6) APP Controlled Fully Parametric Equalizers Including Q Control For Powered Speaker Correction
    (6) APP Controlled Fully Parametric Equalizers for Room Correction
    Pink Noise Generator
    Sweep Generator
    Sine Wave Generator (Adjustable 20 Hz – 20 kHz)

    AC POWER
    External Power Supply
    Universal AC Compatible
    110 VAC – 240 VAC & 50 Hz – 60 Hz
    Adapters for UK, EU, China, Russia, and Australia Available Upon Request

    SPECIFICATIONS SUBJECT TO CHANGE WITHOUT NOTICE




    All perks are accessible in the right sidebar above. 


    We REALLY want to make Thunder UnderBass absolutely incredible.  In harmony with our wishes we REALLY want to deliver it to ALL of you with a deluxe PHANTOM GRAPHICS package.

    For this to be possible at the price point we are offering here we need to sell a lot of Thunder UnderBass units; 5,000 minimum.  And if you were able to help us get us beyond 15,000 units we will also be able to include a killer LCD touchscreen on ALL units delivered AND wireless Left, Right, and Center channel speakers for all The Works systems that deliver.

    As things shape up here we will share more details about how you can help us make this happen faster.  Regardless, Thank you so much for supporting our dream.  We only want to give you the best!


    We make professional studio monitors and control systems for the desktop.  Our products give the power back to the recording artist, where it belongs.  We are based in Apopka, Florida and our company is run by its two founders that lead our team of engineers, musicians, artists and designers.

    Thank you for coming. It's so nice to meet you!


    Why We Chose Indiegogo.

    We don't just make speakers, we craft products that have a voice.  We design holistic works of art that enrich and excite.  We chose Indiegogo because this is an atmosphere that resonates with that voice and our passion for living and creating.

    This project is much more about who we are and how we want to get to know you, our loyal customers.  This is a premier environment to engage each other without any middlemen to mess it up for everybody.  It's between us, and that's just the way we like it.

    We've been spoiled with awesome audio on our desktops for a long time with our professional studio monitors.  We needed the stars to align to create a desktop audio solution that was affordable AND sounded great.  We also needed a platform to launch Thunder UnderBass.  Indiegogo is crowd funding at its best, what more can we say?

    Let's not forget this isn't just about entertainment, it's about entertaining.  When you hear THAT song you want to FEEL it, especially when you're sharing it with a friend for the first time.  The average desktop speaker or TV soundbar alone just doesn't cut it. Now if you already own a $1000 + pair of monitors or if you spent car money on a soundbar this might not be for you.  Then again, awesome bass ON the desktop and right UNDER your TV is really sweet... just saying.



    We have fully functional hand-made prototypes already built, but they are just that; prototypes. We aren't a billion dollar company and we can only afford to do modest runs at best with our manufacturing and logistics partners.  

    With your help we can finalize the hardware and software aspects of Thunder UnderBass and finance legitimate pre-production and pilot runs required to bring any new product to market successfully.

    In a nutshell you're making it possible for us to bring Thunder UnderBass to you, our customer's.  Your contributions are also having a dramatic positive impact on the big picture.  This affords us the ability to focus on the countless details and possible challenges in the months ahead.


    When does Thunder UnderBass deliver?

    We are shipping Thunder UnderBass in April with deliveries expected the first week of May, 2015.  We need time to process all the orders, finalize some of the hardware and software elements, refine packaging and shipping and fine-tune the fulfillment logistics with our partners and ramp up final production.  
    While we have a first-class production and fulfillment chain in place and waiting on our call, the work is yet to be done.

    • NOVEMBER:  Spread the word and fund our dream!
    • DECEMBER:  Tooling 1 and 2 are already complete but we need to finalize some of the hardware specifications and assembly protocols 
    • JANUARY:  Software development has already taken place but we still have to finalize and test the software for the DSP tools and smart apps once we have finalized all the hardware specs.
    • FEBRUARY:  We begin pre-production.  This enables us to define the packaging and shipping details as well as perform final inspections and testing before actually conducting the pilot run.
    • MARCH:  The pilot run helps us fine-tune the production chain, fulfillment and logistics operations, and garner reviews and testimonials for future marketing efforts.
    • April:  April marks the beginning of full production AND shipping.  Our manufacturing partner is well equipped to handle intense volume on the order of thousands of units/ day.  Thunder UnderBass will be on the water for roughly 30 days marking our first deliveries in May.
    • MAY:  Deliveries begin the first week of May, 2015!



    So what's inside?

    When you receive your new Thunder UnderBass, open it slowly because good things come to those who wait.  Seriously though, here's whats inside:

    • Thunder UnderBass Nucleus or Thunder UnderBass The Works
    • (2) Powered satellite speakers and (1) powered center channel speaker (The Works model only)
    • Wireless remote control
    • 6' USB 2.0 cable
    • (2) 6' optical cables
    • 6' 4.1 HDMI cable (The Works Model)
    • (4) Screw in feet (metal)
    • (4) Screw in feet (rubber)
    • Owner's manual
    • Product registration card
    • Thunder UnderBass stickers


    It’s easy to help.  Just share this page with your friends and family via email and social media. Every time one of your referrals buys Thunder UnderBass here on Indiegogo we’ll give you a campaign credit of $30 or $50 depending on which system they choose; Nucleus or The Works.  The amount of credit you can earn is unlimited!  

    Once the campaign is over, we apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund on your purchase or credit toward the purchase of a new Thunder UnderBass.  If you earn more than the purchase price of Thunder UnderBass we will write you a check for the difference!

    For example, when a referral purchases                  

    You receive                               

    Thunder UnderBass Nucleus

    $30 campaign credit

    Thunder UnderBass the Works

    $50 campaign credit

    How to use the referral program:

    It’s simple. Log in to your Indiegogo account. Be sure to use the same account you used when you claimed your Thunder UnderBass. Then, look below our main video at the top of this page for social media buttons to share and copy your unique URL. Start sharing!

    We made a webpage on our website that illustrates exactly how the referral program works in case you need more information.  Go here.

Digital to Analog & Analog to Digital







You'll appreciate the ultra-low jitter high-resolution digital audio you'll be listening to up to 192 kHz/ 24 bit.  We use advanced Analog Devices DSP and Cirrus Logic & Burr Brown CODECs for all the A-D and D-A, because they kick ass and we know you want to rock.

Some people ask us why all the DSP though?  Because the best DACs on Earth cost thousands of dollars and even a perfect digital signal converted to perfection sounds ordinary on an ordinary set of speakers.  We write our own killer DSP to make even average speakers sound amazing. So now you don't have to run out and buy a $3K pair of monitors to appreciate high resolution audio.


USB from Your Computer & Optical from Your TV









We use the super-fast XMOS USB 2.0/ Audio Class 2.0 solution to get sound to and from the computer.  Use Thunder UnderBass' optical input/output to connect your TV and soundbar. No need to worry about any special cables to buy we're including the USB and optical cables with your Thunder UnderBass.



Dolby Digital Decoding & The Works!


Really into gaming?  Looking for the latest in Dolby Digital decoding?  Need an ultra-versatile system for the entire family?  You need The Works! This is our top of the line, no holds barred everything included super-system.  For movies, games, and sports The Works delivers a sound experience rarely heard on anything less than a $3K home-theater system.To do this right though we had to design custom matching front Right, Left and Center channel speakers to play nice with Dolby.  These cutie-pies are tuned and precision matched to Thunder UnderBass and produce an expressive sound stage that will surprise you.

The Awesome JRiver Media Center




You also get the super-deluxe JRiver Media Center.  It will already be provisioned with the best settings for plug and play awesomeness. And JRiver Media Center automatically finds and syncs all the music on your computer, iTunes, or NAS.


Audio File Types We Support & Play
There are a lot of audio file types out there and while most of these formats you will probably never play, it's always better to have it and not need it than to need it and not have it.


While we're here we should talk about DSD for a moment.  Most of the digital audio world  (including Digital Signal Processing) currently runs on PCM or Pulse Code Modulation.  
In the PCM world, faster speeds and more bits are both better, and 192 kHz (speed) with 24 bits (depth) is as good as most downloads get.  DSD (or Direct Stream Digital) is a format which some argue is more "listenable" than PCM, and is also the archive format of choice for many producers.  
The problem with it is that any manipulation of it, even volume control, requires that the data be turned into analog first.  Still, buying music in the DSD format might be a good idea if the tracks sold are in the same format as they are archived in. 
Bottom line is JRiver Media Center will  decode your DSD files and hand them over to Thunder UnderBass at 192 kHz/ 24 bit PCM for playback.

Bluetooth Built In










Of course Thunder UnderBass has Bluetooth built in so you're ready to go any time from any Bluetooth capable device; computer, smartphone, or tablet for example. Even though Bluetooth isn't high-resolution (yet) the convenience is definitely a bonus!



Killer Headphone Amps 

If you like headphones, great!  We do too, so we included EIGHT stellar HiFi headphone amplifiers with two headphone jacks.  So if you're a gamer like some of us here, you and your friends will hear in high resolution through the cans too.


Geek Out With iOS & Android Smart Apps



If you like to get techie, good news, we've been thinking about you.
 We partnered with a savvy app developer to assist with our custom tool
sets.  Above is a screenshot that is similar to what the analyzer will
look like.  We're including some advanced user utilities in the form of
iOS & Android friendly smart APPs. You will appreciate the suite of
parametric equalizers, high & low level balance, Q control, room EQ and
crossover optimization.

WOOFERS
(2) 5.25” High Excursion Woofers
Xmax: 6mm 1 way
(2) 60 Watts Peak/ 50 Watts Continuous
30 Hz – 300 Hz +/- 1 dB
Adjustable Crossover 40 Hz – 250 Hz 48 dB/ Octave (Preset at 150 Hz)
106 dB Peak
100 dB Continuous
8 ohms

WOOFER AMPLIFIERS
(2) Custom Class D TI Based Amplifiers
300 Watts Capable, Deployed at 100 Watts

HEADPHONE AMPLIFIERS
(8) Burr Brown OP-Amps
High Current & Low Distortion
Universal Compatibility with any Modern Headphone 
Individual Volume Control via Smart Apps
DIGITAL SIGNAL
PROCESSING
Analog Devices Sigma and SHARC Processors
Cirrus Logic and Burr Brown CODECs

USB 2.0
XMOS Based Asynchronous USB Audio
Stereo – 2 Channels Input/ 2 Channels Output
Supports up to 192 kHz/ 24 bit
MAC and Linux Compatible (Windows w/ Driver Download – Included)
DSD 128 over PCM Capable
INPUTSPDIF Switchable; COAX or Toslink (All standard bit rates and bit depths
supported via asynchronous rate converter - 32kHz/16 bit to 192 kHz/24 bit)
Stereo 3.5 mm AUX Input (Front Panel)
USB 2.0 Input (Computer Input)
USB Input (Firmware Update – Uses USB Memory Stick)

OUTPUT
Toslink Optical PCM, 32kHz/16 bit - 192 kHz/24 bit (Preset @ 48 kHz/
24 bit)Line Level  L/R RCA OutputsStereo 3.5mm AUX Output
(2) Stereo 3.5mm Headphone Outputs (Front Panel)

ADVANCED USER UTILITIES (iOS & Android app usable)
Crossover Frequency 40 Hz – 250 Hz
Crossover Depth; Choose 12/ 24/ 48 dB/Octave
High/ Low Speaker Level Balance
Parametric EQ for Driver Correction
(6) APP Controlled Fully Parametric Equalizers Including Q Control For Powered
Speaker Correction
(6) APP Controlled Fully Parametric Equalizers for Room Correction
Pink Noise Generator
Sweep Generator
Sine Wave Generator (Adjustable 20 Hz – 20 kHz)

AC POWER
External Power Supply
Universal AC Compatible
110 VAC – 240 VAC & 50 Hz – 60 Hz
Adapters for UK, EU, China, Russia, and Australia Available Upon Request
SPECIFICATIONS SUBJECT TO CHANGE WITHOUT NOTICE














All perks are accessible in the right sidebar above. 
We REALLY want to make Thunder UnderBass absolutely incredible.  In harmony with our wishes we REALLY want to deliver it to ALL of you with a deluxe PHANTOM GRAPHICS package.For this to be possible at the price point we are offering here we need to sell a lot of Thunder UnderBass units; 5,000 minimum.  And if you were able to help us get us beyond 15,000 units we will also be able to include a killer LCD touchscreen on ALL units delivered AND wireless Left, Right, and Center channel speakers for all The Works systems that deliver.
As things shape up here we will share more details about how you can help us make this happen faster.  Regardless, Thank you so much for supporting our dream.  We only want to give you the best!





We make professional studio monitors and control systems for the desktop.  Our products give the power back to the recording artist, where it belongs.  We are based in Apopka, Florida and our company is run by its two founders that lead our team of engineers, musicians, artists and designers.


Thank you for coming. It's so nice to meet you!








Why We Chose Indiegogo.
We don't just make speakers, we craft products that have a voice.  We design holistic works of art that enrich and excite.  We chose Indiegogo because this is
an atmosphere that resonates with that voice and our passion for living and creating.
This project is much more about who we are and how we want to get to know you, our loyal customers.  This is a premier environment to engage each other without any middlemen to mess it up for everybody.  It's between us, and that's just the way we like it.
We've been spoiled with awesome audio on our desktops for a long time with our professional studio monitors.  We needed the stars to align to create a desktop audio solution that was affordable AND sounded great.  We also needed a platform to launch Thunder UnderBass.  Indiegogo is crowd funding at its best, what more can we say?
Let's not forget this isn't just about entertainment, it's about entertaining.  When you hear THAT song you want to FEEL it, especially when you're sharing it with a friend for the first time.  The average desktop speaker or TV soundbar alone just doesn't cut it. Now if you already own a $1000 + pair of monitors or if you spent car money on a soundbar this might not be for you.  Then again, awesome bass ON the desktop and right UNDER your TV is really sweet... just saying.











We have fully functional hand-made prototypes already built, but they are just that; prototypes. We aren't a billion dollar company and we can only afford to do modest runs at best with our manufacturing and logistics partners.  
With your help we can finalize the hardware and software aspects of Thunder UnderBass and finance legitimate pre-production and pilot runs required to bring any new product to market successfully.
In a nutshell you're making it possible for us to bring Thunder UnderBass to you, our customer's.  Your contributions are also having a dramatic positive impact on the big picture.  This affords us the ability to focus on the countless details and possible challenges in the months ahead.


When does Thunder UnderBass deliver?We are shipping Thunder UnderBass in April with deliveries expected the first week of May, 2015.  We need time to process all the orders, finalize some of the hardware and software elements, refine packaging and shipping and fine-tune the fulfillment logistics with our partners and ramp up final production.  
While we have a first-class production and fulfillment chain in place and waiting on our call, the work is yet to be done.



NOVEMBER:  Spread the word and fund our dream!

DECEMBER:  Tooling 1 and 2 are already complete but we need to finalize some of the hardware specifications and assembly protocols 

JANUARY:  Software development has already taken place but we still have to finalize and test the software for the DSP tools and smart apps once we have finalized all the hardware specs.

FEBRUARY:  We begin pre-production.  This enables us to define the packaging and shipping details as well as perform final inspections and testing before actually conducting the pilot run.

MARCH:  The pilot run helps us fine-tune the production chain, fulfillment and logistics operations, and garner reviews and testimonials for future marketing efforts.

April:  April marks the beginning of full production AND shipping.  Our manufacturing partner is well equipped to handle intense volume on the order of thousands of units/ day.  Thunder UnderBass will be on the water for roughly 30 days marking our first deliveries in May.

MAY:  Deliveries begin the first week of May, 2015!





So what's inside?
When you receive your new Thunder UnderBass, open it slowly because good things come to those who wait.  Seriously though, here's whats inside:


Thunder UnderBass Nucleus or Thunder UnderBass The Works
(2) Powered satellite speakers and (1) powered center channel speaker (The Works model only)
Wireless remote control
6' USB 2.0 cable
(2) 6' optical cables
6' 4.1 HDMI cable (The Works Model)
(4) Screw in feet (metal)

(4) Screw in feet (rubber)
Owner's manual
Product registration card
Thunder UnderBass stickers






  




It’s easy to help.  Just share this page with your friends and family via email and social media. Every time one of your referrals buys Thunder UnderBass here on Indiegogo we’ll give you a campaign credit of $30 or $50 depending on which system they choose; Nucleus or The Works.  The amount of credit you can earn is unlimited!  
Once the campaign is over, we apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund on your purchase or credit toward the purchase of a new Thunder UnderBass.  If you earn more than the purchase price of Thunder UnderBass we will write you a check for the difference!



For example, when a referral purchases                  
You receive                               


Thunder UnderBass Nucleus
$30 campaign credit


Thunder UnderBass the Works
$50 campaign credit



How to use the referral program:It’s simple. Log in to your Indiegogo account. Be sure to use the same account you used when you claimed your Thunder UnderBass. Then, look below our main video at the top of this page for social media buttons to share and copy your unique URL. Start sharing!We made a webpage on our website that illustrates exactly how the referral program works in case you need more information.  Go here.

story:
UPDATE - 2 March

By popular demand, we’re excited to present matching accessories to the Bentokai wireless charger

Batteries charged? Ready to go? No, wait! Where is my pen? Where did I leave my post-it notes? Argh! Bentokai presents a complete wireless charging desktop organizer solution: Add our stackable organizer to your desk to keep things in place and your phone charged. When you’re done, simply stack them up to store your essentials tightly together with magnets.

More photos of the  Stack in the update section

 

Bentokai Wireless Charger

Are you ready to take advantage of new wireless charging technology? No more chaining your phone to a cable for charging, no more proprietary broken cables that are expensive to replace. Bentokai takes the new wireless charging experience and puts it into a warmer, more human enclosure that better fits your living space. We make a wireless charger that doesn’t look out of place, makes your life easier and is made from sustainable material.

The Bentokai wireless charger is larger than the average charge pad available on the market today, allowing two phones to charge comfortably at the same time. It’s made from strong, durable, light-weight bamboo that features a natural wooden grain. It’s nice to know that bamboo is a highly renewable resource that’s easy to recycle.
 

How is it used?

It’s simple:

  1. Plug your Bentokai wireless charger into a wall outlet or USB port
  2. Place your phone* on top of the Bentokai wireless charger
  3. Done! It’s charging now.

*Your phone should support wireless charging, like the iPhone 8, iPhone X or Galaxy S8 or have an adaptor cover (see FAQ).
 

Discover how it can work for you

Observe your everyday places and notice where you regularly put down your phone. For instance: on your desk, in the office, next to your bed, in the kitchen, near the couch. Any of these will be a perfect place to put a Bentokai wireless charger. Consider how you use your phone in these spots:

1.    As a wake-up alarm, to get the day started. Put a Bentokai wireless charger on your nightstand and your phone charges while you sleep.

2.    Perusing your Instagram feed during breakfast. Add a Bentokai wireless charger to your breakfast table and charge while you explore.

3.    As second screen to keep important information handy while you’re crunching the numbers. Have a Bentokai wireless charger on your desk to keep your phone going throughout the working day.

4.    Or to stream your favorite music to set the right creative mood. Include a Bentokai wireless charger in your creative workspace to keep the music playing.

5.    Learning from a recipe video to cook a new dish, or watching your favorite show just because. Put a Bentokai wireless charger in your kitchen (don’t mistake it for your bamboo cutting board!)

6.    As entertainment center, remote controlling video and music. Your couch area is a good place to charge while you use these heavy battery-drain apps.

All you need is a Bentokai wireless charger in these spots to keep your phone charged effortlessly.
 

Features

  • Powerful and fast wireless charging, adopting the Qi industry standard
  • Large charging area & sweet spot: No fiddly positioning of your phone
  • Charge two phones at the same time
  • Replaceable USB cable* to customize the look and match your interior
  • Made from sustainable bamboo

*USB cable not included, can be added to your order after the campaign ends.
 

Technical specs

*Technical specs based on current working prototype, subject to change
 

Why crowdfunding?

We want to develop Bentokai into a lifestyle brand that accelerates the transition of the tech world to a more human-centered industry that incorporates more renewable materials, one product at a time.

We need your support to fund our bamboo wireless charger production run, and demonstrate we can do it at scale. When successfully funded, we will extend our range to include more bamboo products (matching desktop accessories!) and further expand our exploration into other sustainable materials such as eco-leather. We invite you to become part of our community driving our vision forward!
 

Behind the scenes

Bentokai started at CIC Rotterdam where Nick, Vlad, Muhil and Martijn met at Venture Cafe. Sharing an interest in technology and design, we agreed a better job could be done designing technology in such a way that it blends in with your environment and has a warmer and more human feel to it. Present day technology often leans toward a science-fiction type design aesthetic, which we can certainly appreciate, but it isn’t necessarily something we’d welcome into our homes. It tends to feel rather cold. So we set out to develop a brand that takes contemporary technology and puts it in a more attractive package, something you’d love to have in your home.

Following the adoption of wireless charging by Apple (a company revered for design) in its new range of iPhones, we figured a wireless charger is a great first product to kickstart the Bentokai brand. Wireless charging makes life easier and is something you would put in your home. It’s likely we’re going to see it everywhere in the near future (think, Free Wifi).

After we nailed down the mission and the product we started our design exploration. Inspired by natural material we eventually selected bamboo because of its looks and physical qualities. To our delight it’s also a very sustainable material because it grows incredibly fast and absorbs more CO2 than it produces. And thus our second value was born: We want our products to be as eco-friendly as possible, employing renewable, sustainable material that’s easy to recycle.

Quick introduction of the Bentokai team

Industrial designer Vlad has extensive experience working with bamboo employing it in diverse products ranging from speakers to foldable laptop stands. He runs his own makerspace in Rotterdam where he pushes the laser cutter to the max, teaching his students the secrets of good design.

Product developer and head of technology Nick has over 20 years of experience developing tech products and bringing them successfully into manufacturing. A true globetrotter dividing his time between continents.

Sustainable process engineer and entrepreneur Muhil is on a mission to improve the planet by developing sustainable products that replace the more ones.

Product manager and head of user experience, Martijn loves to bring purposeful products to market by embedding them in contemporary culture.

 

Where are we now?

We’ve completed all design, engineering, prototyping and testing and are now working with our factory to get everything ready for production. 

All of us have experience with crowdfunding and we know the crunch is in the end. We set a reasonable delivery timeframe, but there’s always things that can go wrong. For instance technical problems with the laser cutter in the factory or delays with the electronics.

We will give regular updates here on Indiegogo and make sure we let our backers know when things change in the process.

 

FAQ

My phone doesn’t support wireless charging, can I still use Bentokai?
Yes, but you’ll need an adaptor. You can enable wireless charging on your phone by putting it into a cover (sold separately) that turns your phone into a wireless charging unit.

Can it charge my Android phone?
Yes, any device that supports standard Qi charging will work.

Will it charge my Apple watch?
No, the Apple watch uses a proprietary type of wireless charging.

Does it charge any device that supports wireless charging?
As long as your device uses the Qi wireless charging standard you can charge it with Bentokai.

Does it charge with my phone cover on?
Yes, it charges through most commercially available covers. No need to take your cover off.

Does it come with a micro USB cable?
No, we plan to make a micro USB cable available for purchase in the fulfillment phase of the campaign. Instructions will be provided after the campaign has ended.

Does it come with a wall adaptor?
No, we plan to make a wall adaptor suitable for your country available for purchase in the fulfillment phase of the campaign. Instructions will be provided after the campaign has ended.

Can I connect it to an USB slot of my laptop to charge?
Yes

When will you ship?
We’re currently in prototype phase and plan to ship the final product to our first backers in June 2018.

Do you ship worldwide?
Yes, our shipping provider ships worldwide. In some exceptional cases outside of our control (like regulatory restrictions, infrastructural obstacles) delivery cannot happen in which case you’ll be reimbursed.

Does the shipping fee include duties?
We accounted for average duties in the shipping cost, but cannot guarantee this covers everything for your specific region because regulations differ from country to country. You may be subject to your country’s GST and VAT fees which Bentokai cannot take responsibility for. In the worst case scenario you have to pay additional duties upon delivery.

 

No pandas were hurt during the design and manufacturing of Bentokai bamboo wireless chargers :-)
