story:
What Is Anima?

Anima.ey is the first-ever project designed to allow for an effective and accurate psychological analysis of children's drawings using a touch screen interface. Anima.ey will utilize algorithms that are based on extensive psychological research.

We are currently seeking contributions to help fund the final stages of this project, which will include additional research, psychological analysis of the drawings collected during the research process and finally, the development of the Anima.ey application.


Kids love to draw. Often, their drawings can reveal a lot about their inner world and about the emotional experiences that can be difficult to detect otherwise.A single drawing can provide a wealth of information about the child's current emotional state, his social skills, mental development and so much more.

As a parent, it's not always easy to know what's going through your children's mind. Many children are hesitant to verbalize their feelings, in large part due to a limited vocabulary. This is especially true when it comes to more serious issues such as depression, distress, anger or even trauma.Using the Anima.ey application, parents can gain tremendous insight into their child's development and emotional state, simply by encouraging the child to draw on a touch screen.

Anima.ey will provide a detailed, real-time analysis of the child's drawings, even while they're in day care, at school or with the babysitter.


Anima.ey is based upon psychological analysis methods that were first pioneered in the 1950s and 1960s. During this time, a researcher named Rhoda Kellogg conducted a study of one million drawings, created by children from different countries and social backgrounds. She discovered a common denominator existed between the drawings, despite the dramatic differences that existed in the subjects' cultural and social backgrounds.Kellogg's research was the first of a series of many studies involving child psychology through the analysis of their drawings and artwork.

For the past two years, the Anima.ey team has been working closely with a psychotherapist who is regarded as an expert in the field of psychological analysis based on a child's or teen's drawing. With her guidance, we will be developing a projective drawing analysis app that will analyze drawings created on a touch screen. The Anima.ey project is the first of its kind.

But to make it a reality, we need your help! That's why we've launched this crowdfunding campaign, to garner support and donations that will be used to fund the remaining research, psychological analysis and the subsequent app development process. 



Sure! Here are some basic examples of indications that can be derived from drawings:



Ben Zaneti – Founder: Ben Zaneti has a B.Sc. in Industrial Engineering from the Open University of Israel, with an emphasis in information systems analysis.In 2010, Ben started to research the meaning of children's drawings. After realizing the importance of detecting abnormal behavior through projective drawing, he came up with the concept of what's now known as the Anima.ey project.

Anna Koren - worldwide known expert in the field of graphology,​and forensic expert.The first office was established in January 1976, ​​Among her customers:​Courts, Governments ,Psychiatric Clinics, Large Banks, et​c​

Dr. Uri Gronemann - technology consultant, earned a PhD degree in engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).  Hespecialized in imaging systems and was among the founders of world-renowned Israeli high-tech pioneer, Scitex Corp., where he served as chief scientist for many years.

Tal Schweiger - senior copywriter with 6 years of experience in the leading agencies in Israel, with award-winning works on multiple international clients.

Judit Ziter - serves as a PhD in business training, Advisor to CEOs and business success, holds an MBA and PhD.

Professional Partners - The Anima.ey project will work closely with psychology and child development professionals, with extensive experience in the field of projective drawing analysis. These team members will help us as we work to test the reliability of the program and make any necessary corrections before the app is released to the public.

Once we raise funds via our Indiegogo campaign, we'll use the money to fund a large research program which involves analyzing artwork created by a group of 300 children.Each child will draw 10 paintings – 5 drawings on regular paper and 5 drawings on a touch screen. The drawings will then be passed on to our psychologists for analysis; based on this analysis, we will ask our programmers to refine the Anima.ey algorithm.The psychological analysis of the drawings will focus on the emotional state of the child. The main objective is to develop an algorithm that allows us to effectively identify signs of emotional distress that appear in drawings that were created via a touch screen.Upon completion of the software development process, we plan to test the software on a limited number of selected children (check out the perks if you'd like to participate!) and soon thereafter, we will release the project to the public.

Our desire is to finalize the fundraising, research and development phases of this project as soon as possible so we can release Anima.ey to the marketplace at some point in 2014.


Glad you liked it!

We're excited about the Anima.ey project and we're delighted to hear that you're excited as well!We invite you to help support this project by making a contribution. All contributions are greatly appreciated and will be rewarded with one of our perks.


* In order to achieve our goal, we will use your contribution in the most effective manner. For this reason, international shipping is 9$ for shirts and pajamas. If for some reason we cannot ship the shirt to your country, we will refund your money. Estimated arrival time is 21 to 30 days.

We at Anima.ey believe in togetherness, that’s why we welcome you to join us and spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or any other way that suits you.
Feel free to ask us any question that you might have or share with us your suggestions and ideas.
story_txt:
What Is Anima?
Anima.ey is the first-ever project
designed to allow for an effective and accurate psychological analysis of
children's drawings using a touch screen interface. Anima.ey will utilize
algorithms that are based on extensive psychological research.
We are currently seeking
contributions to help fund the final stages of this project, which will include
additional research, psychological analysis of the drawings collected during
the research process and finally, the development of the Anima.ey application.









Kids love to draw. Often, their
drawings can reveal a lot about their inner world and about the emotional
experiences that can be difficult to detect otherwise.A single drawing can provide a
wealth of information about the child's current emotional state, his social
skills, mental development and so much more.


As a parent, it's not always easy
to know what's going through your children's mind. Many children are hesitant
to verbalize their feelings, in large part due to a limited vocabulary. This is
especially true when it comes to more serious issues such as depression,
distress, anger or even trauma.Using the Anima.ey application,
parents can gain tremendous insight into their child's development and
emotional state, simply by encouraging the child to draw on a touch screen.
Anima.ey will provide a detailed,
real-time analysis of the child's drawings, even while they're in day care, at
school or with the babysitter.







Anima.ey is based upon
psychological analysis methods that were first pioneered in the 1950s and
1960s. During this time, a researcher named Rhoda Kellogg conducted a study of
one million drawings, created by children from different countries and social backgrounds.
She discovered a common denominator existed between the drawings, despite the
dramatic differences that existed in the subjects' cultural and social
backgrounds.Kellogg's research was the first of
a series of many studies involving child psychology through the analysis of
their drawings and artwork.
For the past two years, the
Anima.ey team has been working closely with a psychotherapist who is regarded
as an expert in the field of psychological analysis based on a child's or
teen's drawing. With her guidance, we will be developing a projective drawing
analysis app that will analyze drawings created on a touch screen. The Anima.ey
project is the first of its kind. 
But to make it a reality, we need
your help! That's why we've launched this crowdfunding campaign, to garner
support and donations that will be used to fund the remaining research,
psychological analysis and the subsequent app development process. 




Sure! Here are some basic examples of indications that can be
derived from drawings:















Ben Zaneti – Founder: Ben Zaneti has a B.Sc. in
Industrial Engineering from the Open University of Israel, with an emphasis in
information systems analysis.In 2010, Ben started to research
the meaning of children's drawings. After realizing the importance of detecting
abnormal behavior through projective drawing, he came up with the concept of
what's now known as the Anima.ey project.



Anna Koren - worldwide known expert in the field of graphology,​and forensic expert.The first office was established in January 1976, ​​Among her customers:​Courts, Governments ,Psychiatric Clinics, Large Banks, et​c​
Dr. Uri Gronemann - technology consultant, earned a
PhD degree in engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology
(MIT).  Hespecialized in
imaging systems and was among the founders of world-renowned Israeli high-tech
pioneer, Scitex Corp., where he served as chief scientist for many
years.



Tal Schweiger - senior copywriter with 6 years of experience in
the leading agencies in Israel, with award-winning works on multiple
international clients.
Judit Ziter - serves as a PhD in
business training, Advisor to CEOs and business success, holds an MBA and PhD.
Professional
Partners - The Anima.ey project
will work closely with psychology and child development professionals, with
extensive experience in the field of projective drawing analysis. These team
members will help us as we work to test the reliability of the program and make
any necessary corrections before the app is released to the public.











Once we raise funds via our Indiegogo
campaign, we'll use the money to fund a large research program which involves
analyzing artwork created by a group of 300 children.Each child will draw 10 paintings – 5 drawings on regular paper and 5 drawings on a touch
screen. The drawings will then be passed on to our psychologists for analysis;
based on this analysis, we will ask our programmers to refine the Anima.ey
algorithm.The psychological analysis of the
drawings will focus on the emotional state of the child. The main objective is
to develop an algorithm that allows us to effectively identify signs of
emotional distress that appear in drawings that were created via a touch
screen.Upon completion of the software
development process, we plan to test the software on a limited number of
selected children (check out the perks if you'd like to participate!) and soon
thereafter, we will release the project to the public.
Our desire is to finalize the
fundraising, research and development phases of this project as soon as
possible so we can release Anima.ey to the marketplace at some point in 2014.







Glad you liked it!

We're excited about the Anima.ey
project and we're delighted to hear that you're excited as well!We invite you to help support this
project by making a contribution. All contributions are greatly appreciated and
will be rewarded with one of our perks.




* In order to achieve our goal, we
will use your contribution in the most effective manner. For this reason,
international shipping is 9$ for shirts and pajamas. If for some reason we
cannot ship the shirt to your country, we will refund your money. Estimated
arrival time is 21 to 30 days.






We at Anima.ey believe in togetherness, that’s why we welcome you to join us and spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn or any other way that suits you.Feel free to ask us any question that you might have or share with us your suggestions and ideas.

story:
The first low-cost digital back for your 35mm camera. For those who always wanted to have a "hybrid" camera working with photographic films or in digital mode.

Use your old analog camera, which probably is lost somewhere inside a box or ended-up in your small "personal museum" taking a lot of dust! We're now in the digital era and are ready to give a second life to it with the only low-cost digital back available on the market!

Four years have passed since the first prototype of I'm Back®35 was realized through a simple 3D printer. Many believed in this project and supported us since the beginning. And thanks to all our backers I'm Back®35 became true. It's also thanks to the massive feedback from our supporter and together with hard work that I'm Back®35 is evolving and improved significantly since the first version.

We now are proud to present to you the new "I'm Back®35" edition, which brings with it great changes and not only a completely new design, inspired by the old "motor drivers" but a revised and modern shape. 

The main innovation nevertheless, is the software, that gives now the possibility to take photos with the MANUAL mode, leaving the user full control of the shutter speed and the diaphragm aperture of the camera. I'm Back®35 will then record the images as it was set through the analog camera! 

"The only digital back that pairs with analog cameras. In manual or automatic mode, it gives a shot to their desire for fantasy! Set photos or videos, I'm Back®35 records everything as you decide. You can also afford erroneous exposure ... or not! 

With his new "universal cover " I'm Back®35 pairs with almost all the most famous analog cameras. 

New technology. New and more ergonomic design. New battery with high performance. I'm Back®35. Because the pleasure of photography has no age."

 Available dedicated back covers: 

The dedicated back covers allow better and more hermetic fitting of your analog camera to the I'm Back®35 device. This may improve your user experience and fun.  

Dedicated back covers are available for the following brands and models:

  • a) Canon A/A1/AE1/F1/FT/FTB/EOS300,  
  • b) Contax II/RTS/G1/G2, 
  • c) Diana F/F mini, 
  • d) Leica M1/M2/M3/M4/M6/M7/Leicaflex SL/R4/R5/R6, 
  • e) Minolta Dinaxx 7000i/Maxxum 7000/SRT/XD, 
  • f) Nikon EM/F/FA/FE/FE2/FG/FM/FM2/FM3a/F2/F3 ,F4/F70/F90x/F100/S2/S3/Nikkormat FTN/EL/, 
  • g) Olympus OM1/OM2/OM3/OM4/OM10, 
  • h) Pentax ME/ME super/K1000/Spotomatic, 
  • i) Praktica b200/MTL, 
  • j) Ricoh KR10, 
  • k) Yashica JP/FX3.

 

The above camera models fit also to the Universal Cover.

If your camera is not in the above list, it should be compatible with the Universal Cover that is already included in the I'm Back®35 box, if:

1- the back of your analog camera is detachable without damaging it;

2- your camera has a standard tripod screw hole on the bottom.

Example of Universal Cover compatible models;
Leica M5, Canon FTb ,  T70, Nikon F-501, Minolta i-9000, Praktica B-100, Praktica MTL-3, Contax, Leica RE, Yashica FR. Canon t70, Canon t90, Contax 139Q, Canon EOS 1000F, Contax Aria,  Minolta XGM & X700, Yashica electro 35, NIKON F-601, Nikon NF-505, Yashica 109, Minolta XG-Ms, Nikon F-301, Voigtlander-Cosina, Bessa R, Minolta Maxxum 450si, Minolta XG 9,  Nikon F65, Minolta X300, nikon f80, Minolta X-370
And much more...

 

Is my camera compatible with I'm Back?

You can use I'm Back with most cameras.
The only ones that are not compatible are:

  • Those without a hole for the tripod, (Contax II for example - For this camera model we drawing a dedicated cover), for others not.
  • Electronic cables that prevent the removal of the back cover, (Canon Eos 5 for example),
  •  Have the film loader not like most, on the top of the camera but at the bottom 
  • Has a large battery grip on the bottom that cannot be removed (Nikon F5, F6 for example)

If your camera (or cameras) has one of the listed features, it is not compatible with the universal I'm back adapter, but you need a dedicated cover, such as the Contax II which when you remove the cover, removes the hole tripod together. On the other hand, if your camera is a normal srl or a viewfinder, then it is compatible, regardless of what brand it is.

 

Jared Polin 1.2 million subscribers

  • MANUAL setting - You frame and choose at what speed to shoot and as well the diaphragm aperture, your camera exposes and I'm Back®35 records.
  • New design - leaner and more ergonomic
  • New PCBA, exclusively designed for I'm Back®35
  • New software to control the MANUAL exposure function.
  • output files: RAW and JPEG  
  • New battery with higher performance and durability - i.e. NP F550 / F570
  • New universal cover with aluminum support - You can fit it to 99% of all 35mm analog cameras available on the market in a simple and fast way.

Dedicated back covers are also available and allow better and more hermetic fitting of your analogue camera to the I'M BACK®35 device. Detailed information of the dedicated back covers are listed in the section: "Compatible Cameras" above.

 I'm Back®35 manual mode - You choose the speed and the diaphragm aperture as you like, and enjoy your camera as if you were using an analog film roll. I'm Back®35 records the result, good or bad, it depends upon you! 

 

 i'm Back®35 - Technical Specifications 

  • Image Sensor: SONY IMX206 (16Mpixels)
  • Photo resolution: 16M/14M/10M/8M/other
  • Photo format: JPEG and COLOR RAW
  • LCD: 2.0 inch
  • WiFi - for connecting your smartphone
  • Display: 240*RGB*320 LCD
  • Memory: Micro SD / Class 10 Max 128G
  • Interface: Micro HDMI, USB C Type
  • Power: Lithium Battery Pack (Sony F550 compatible)
  • Video format: 4K 3840*2160/30FPS - 1920*1080P/60fps - 1280*720P/120fps
  • Object Size: (I'm Back 35) 24x36mm as 135 film
  • Exposure Control: Manual or Automatic Mode
  • Color Balance: Fixed or Automatic mode
  • ISO: 100 - 3600
  • Lens Multi-elements precision lens
  • Microphone/Speaker: Built-in
  • System requirements: Windows 2000/XP/Vista/Windows7, MAC OSX 10.3.6 and above

*subject to changes, quality nevertheless will be at least same or better

 

  You have full control of your camera. You can shoot now with your old analog as you always did and record the photos and videos digitally! With our new I'm Back®35 you decide the speed and aperture and you can use your machine's photometer to decide the exposition you want to have. Now it's up to you, you can even "make mistakes"as it used to happen in the past while using the manual mode.

You also can choose the "automatic mode" simply by switching your camera to B mode and selecting the diaphragm aperture, this remains possible as in the previous model. Finally you must focus the objective and click, waiting the three beeps to shoot the photo.

Remember that you can always print all photos, we suggest you to try the normal A4 format, the quality is impressive good.

Finally, I'm Back®35 uses a focusing screen, the images therefore are vintage, smooth and are not comparable to a standard digital photocamera, so the result will "resemble" something between analog and digital, or UNIQUE!

 

 

Photokina 2018

Our project has been awarded by Cinema 5D together with Fujifilm and Panasonic as one of the most innovative projects. 

I'm Back®35 awarded 2nd place at Boldbrain Startup Challenge - Switzerland 2018

 

Use you I'm Back®35 and realize beautiful vintage photos and videos.

Zenith 122 and Helios 58mm f2 with I'm Back®35

 

Ciel Rouge is a music duo produced by Michele Oliva

Directed by Gaetano Acunzo

First Assistant: Rossella Silvestri

Model: Pia Francesca Caso

 

Pentax ME super 50mm f1.8 with I'm Back®35 

music: www.bensound.com

Video by Samuel mello Medeiros

Model: Geisa Navarro

 

Olympus OM2 50mm f1.4 with I'm Back®35 

music: www.bensound.com

Video by Samuel Mello Medeiros

Model: Mia - My wife's cat. 

 

Hasselblad 500cm Planar 80mm 2.8 with. I'm Back®35 

Piano: Monica Korber

Video by Samuel Mello Medeiros

Sweden -Bar

 

Today I'm Back GmbH has its headquarter at CP-Statup in via Carlo Maderno 24 - Lugano Switzerland. After the big surprise and award at Photokina 2018, in which Cinema 5d awarded us together with great names of the photography such as Panassonic and Fujifilm, we were awarded as the second most innovative, among 200 Swiss Startups. We are now present in Europe and America and specifically in USA - New York through our distributors ADORAMA and B&H Photo. Our main costumers are from Japan, United States, Germany, Switzerland, Italy, UK and other nordic countries.

 

We are proud to say that the R&D, product development and logistic management is done in Switzerland and Italy. The industrialization and engineering of the mechanic and electronic parts, including injection molding is performed by a core-tier 1 company that has clients such as: Apple, Ford, Audi, Huawei among others. 

Switzerland team

Brazilian by birth, Portuguese by right and Italian by passion!

 

Son of a Japanese father and an Italian mother, he was born in Brazil, grown-up in Germany, and ended-up living in Switzerland.

story:
Phytography Book

Karel Doing is an artist, filmmaker and researcher. He started working with Super 8 film and black&white photography in 1986 and has developed a broad practice including experimental films, documentaries and photography. In 2016 he developed a new technique tapping into the chemistry of plants to make images directly on photographic emulsion. This technique is dubbed 'Phytography' and has traveled around the world in the capable hands of many experimental filmmakers and photographers. This campaign is aimed at the publication of an artist book, bringing together images and texts by a number of artists who have extensively used Phytography. The book will be handmade and printed in a limited edition of 100 copies.

Original Phytograms

You can support this campaign by choosing one of the 'perks'. There are a number of options to explore. You can preorder the book as a standalone item or in combination with an original phytogram (medium, large or tailor made). An overview of the medium size phytograms can be found via this link. An overview of the large framed phytograms can be found via this link. You can also choose to follow an online workshop which will include a brand new online tutorial,  a talk and Q&A with Karel Doing. There will be multiple options to schedule the 'live' session, making sure that it will be accessible for everybody.

Handmade and artist run

To publish the book the costs of paper, ink and printing need to be covered. Karel Doing will compile the book and work with an experienced book designer and printer. The printing will be done at the London Centre for Book Arts, an open access studio offering affordable and unique printing facilities. The book will consist of three sections, a black&white section, a full colour section and a duo-tone section, each printed using a different technique. The campaign aims to cover all the costs plus modest fees for the people involved. These fees will not only cover the many working hours that will be spent making this book, but also the continuation of the artistic practices of the artists involved in this project.

Contributing artists:
Ruth Hayes
Caryn Cline
Lisa Marr
Dawn George
Nazaré Soares
Terra Long
Noé Rodriguez
Milena Michalski
Kim Conway
Franci Duran
Karel Doing

London Centre for Book Arts:
Blanca Regina
Pierre Bouvier Patron
Simon Goode (advice)

The generosity of plants

Phytography is not just a technique but it is also a communication channel between people and plants. Plants provide us with oxygen, nutrition, medicines and dyes. Plants also contribute to our general well being in a way that cannot be quantified in numbers or money. Phytography offers an embodied and collaborative form of engagement with plants and people. Rebuilding our relationship with the natural world is essential in this time of ecological crisis. Resisting the prevailing narrative of hyper individualism is equally important. Phytography can make a small but inspiring contribution to these aims.

Printing and binding 100 copies

This will be a massive project involving many work hours! Preparations have been done entirely on a voluntary basis and the artists who are involved have given permission to publish their work for free. This campaign will help to develop the emerging phytography network further and make it possible to keep sharing information and ideas between artists, workshop participants and the wider community.

Spread the word

Help us to get the word out by sharing this campaign in your own network. Please use word of mouth, send personal messages, get together and talk about plants, or you can also use social media!

Acknowledgments

The book will include the names of all the backers unless you want to opt out. We will contact you to make sure that we got things right!
story_txt:
Phytography Book
Karel Doing is an artist, filmmaker and researcher. He started working with Super 8 film and black&white photography in 1986 and has developed a broad practice including experimental films, documentaries and photography. In 2016 he developed a new technique tapping into the chemistry of plants to make images directly on photographic emulsion. This technique is dubbed 'Phytography' and has traveled around the world in the capable hands of many experimental filmmakers and photographers. This campaign is aimed at the publication of an artist book, bringing together images and texts by a number of artists who have extensively used Phytography. The book will be handmade and printed in a limited edition of 100 copies.
Original Phytograms
You can support this campaign by choosing one of the 'perks'. There are a number of options to explore. You can preorder the book as a standalone item or in combination with an original phytogram (medium, large or tailor made). An overview of the medium size phytograms can be found via this link. An overview of the large framed phytograms can be found via this link. You can also choose to follow an online workshop which will include a brand new online tutorial,  a talk and Q&A with Karel Doing. There will be multiple options to schedule the 'live' session, making sure that it will be accessible for everybody.


Handmade and artist run
To publish the book the costs of paper, ink and printing need to be covered. Karel Doing will compile the book and work with an experienced book designer and printer. story:
Photon is a fully controlled Light System with constant LED lighting. 

 

 

The advanced Modular Studio allows instant Light Scenes change, controllable via Smartphone or PC. Modular easy-to-install system enables you to shoot different size objects, miniature or massive.

 

FEATURES 

  • Each module consists of 25 active light blocks 4x4 inches
     
  • Each block has 36 LED elements 
     
  • Total 2700 LED lights 
     
  • Module size: 20x20 inches
     
  • Each module has its Wi-Fi transmitter 

ADVANTAGES

Simple installation

Does not require any professional skills

Price

Much cheaper than studio equipment

Placing, space savings  

1/4 sq.m  in contrast to 3 sq.m

Speed

Instant change of lighting

Visibility

When lighting is constant on the object, you instantly see the result of lighting scene

Skills

At home, in the office or shop settings you can easily produce quality content without any dedicated photography skills.

 

 

 

 

 

1. Fully controlled Lighting System with instant change of Light Scenes

We do not relocate the light source, but we shift the light. The object is illuminated from many different angles using the optimally arranged LEDs in each module.

It's all about the control over the light!

 

2. Auto Mode

Shoot & Upload HQ visuals just in seconds. We created a sophisticated library of various light scenes. Enjoy results right away with 10-15 ready-to-use light scenes.

 

3. Saving Light Scenes

Set up your own scenes and save them for later use or just download free pre-sets. 

Take control of every flare!

 

4.

Choose various ways how to install modules: from 1 up to 20 blocks.

Don't need a cube? - Build a wall with no sides!

Want to have more light from the top? - No problem - just set it!

 

5. Ready-to-use solution

Straight out of the box. Get the set and immediately shoot. Modify your module system with add-ons to achieve spectacular output.

 

6. Shoot like a PRO

Pre-sets provide impressive results without any dedicated photography skills. 

See how the object will look on a screen & rapidly adjust the light scene to get the most out of it. Put a Pro to work for You!

 

 

Modules configuration is changed according to shooting object size, backgrounds and screens necessity. The system also allows connecting more than 3 modules:

 

1 Module

 

2 Modules

 

3 Modules

 

The module system was invented and configured to shoot objects and compositions of virtually any size. 

 

 

https://apps.apple.com/ua/app/photonlms/id1447167914?l=en

Being assembled and connected to power supply, modules run test mode (turn all on) to check serviceability and welcome command (smile) to add a photo. Each module then connects to Wi-Fi, which is indicated in the App. After that you can easily manage modules from any device that's in the same net. Modules control is managed through display of light scenes on the device screen, (Smartphone) by setting up your scenes or downloading pre-sets.

The Photon LMS App changes light scene instantly from any device: tablet, smartphone or laptop. Lightweight and easy to use an app for those who appreciate Time, Speed & Quality. The App comes with a generous introductory package of FREE pre-sets. It is simple and straightforward to use, designed to pursue top efficiency. Everything is streamlined and simplified for your convenience!

To find out more about Photon LMS products, please, visit photonlms.com 

 


 

 

1. Price

 

Costs less than a set of flashes. Literally. The whole studio will cost you way less than a set of ordinary flashes and accessories.

2. Size

 

One easy-to-use photo studio instead of loads of equipment:

when shooting small objects, the standard equipment is too large and bulky one. Moreover, the process also requires constant control and appropriate light settings adjustments.

3. Skills 

 

Take professional photos at home, in the office or shop!

You don't need to have a wide knowledge of lighting settings or any photography skills to obtain a perfect result.

4. Time

 

Imagine you have an ONLINE shoe shop with a constantly changing product line. You'd highly likely require regular influxes of new, High-Quality content. You ask a photographer to take photos, which (objects packing ->  take to the photographer ->  shoot - edit ->  get objects ->  receive content) is definitely a TIME & MONEY consuming process. 

Photon LMS is straight out of the box, ready to use solution for e-commerce entrepreneurs to create in-house product photos!

5. Portability

 

Strong & Light materials to handle!

To maintain the portable concept, we will use strong and light materials to make it easy to carry neatly.

 

 

 We know how to build a Light Box people would love to use!

Photon - is it really worth it? - Definitely!

You save Space, Time & Money. 

You get Quality, Speed & Visibility.

 

 



We do the work of photographer faster, better and more convenient by saving his Time & Money!

 

 

Gallery of Hight-Quality Photos

 

LET'S MAKE A BRIGHT FUTURE FOR PRODUCT PHOTOGRAPHERS!

 

 

New generation of LightBox!

Photon prototype basic electronics r.003 specification: 

  • LED Manufacturer - CREE; 
  • LED Package (mm) - 2835; 
  • LED Colour temperature - 5600K; 
  • LED CRI > 95%;
  • Light pulsations level < 5%, frequency - 400-800 kHz; 
  • Illuminance on the bottom of Photon box - 25000 lux; 
  • 1 Module input DC voltage - 24 V; 
  • 1 Module maximum input current - 3.4 A; 
  • Maximum Power Consumption (All cells at maximum brightness) 
  • 100 W per module & 300 W per basic kit (3 modules);
  • One cell power consumption - 3-3.3 W  

 

The MONSTER POWER lighting to draw any light scene you may need to cover objects. Energy-efficient LEDs are built-in in every module.

 

 

 

 

We have come a long way since we first came up with the idea of creating a fully controlled light system one year ago. We believed that the advanced modular studio can change the way we take photos at home.

With this in mind, our team spent countless nights designing, prototyping, testing, programming, and pitching our ideas to thousands of people, receiving feedback on Photon LMS. Six months in, our product has been verified and is ready for manufacturing. 

 

 WE MUST BEGIN:

 

"At first there was an IDEA! The birth of it was quite simple: for the umpteenth time when I faced problems of object shooting, I figured out that all currently available equipment is inconvenient, non-practical and not technological (flashes, softboxes, fixations,etc.), how bulky it is, and the main issue - how EXPENSIVE is all of that is combined!

Then I've decided to purchase standard photo boxes for detailed object shooting, however, I also found disadvantages in them: mostly made for isolated objects on the background, it was still difficult to cope with the light. That's how I got the concept of a controlled light system.

Afterward, I made 3D modeling design of the photo studio, pinned my idea in away.

Since that moment I can proudly state that it was the beginning of our StartUp! 

I have started testing: proofing my theory, I bought LED lamps and black cardboard â€” created the first prototype by myself. Using this first sample of Photon LMS I've undergone the detailed object shooting for our partners. Everything worked out just right!

Thus we decided to continue working on the first prototype. In a short while, it was ready, made of plywood & metal. The software was managed exclusively on one old tablet, nevertheless, it worked!

In August 2018 we went public with that achievement and won Concepter Acceleration program as well as CES2019 booth supported by UVCA. It was a huge success! 

Though the real complex part was only impending, we were to create a fully operating prototype and all we had was 2 months to figure all of that out. We got to work with all our strength. There were numerous tests with LED, frame details, mounting systems, electronics schemes, and software. Thankfully, we made it! 

Before our pitch at CES2019 we have already had a fully working prototype with complete Software and original electronics (only the frame details were custom made).

In January we revealed our creation on the world's largest Tech conference in the USA, where we got acquainted with Funded Today crowdfunding agency and decided that Indiegogo is the most suitable funding option for our project.

Back home we started with a pre-launching campaign:

NOW WE ARE HERE! WE ARE SUPER STOKED TO PRESENT PHOTON LIGHT MODULE SYSTEM TO ALL OF YOU!

 

 

Our team is a tight-knit tech international startup with members from the USA, Ukraine, and China.

We have many types of specialists in different fields: electronics, developers, sales and marketing managers.

We are a strong team of passionate engineers and designers who are experienced professional open-source hardware, industrial design, and photography. 

Our passion is all about creating products that help bring ideas and creativity to life.

We have been working hard to make Photon LMS a reality.  We would like to express gratitude to all friends, supporters, backers and team members!

 

 

We unveiled Photon LMS to Tech World at CES 2019 in fabulous Las Vegas. It was a great event to start a campaign!

This way or another, our product was among the projects that set the course of the industry over the year. Participating in CES was an amazing experience that left us in WOWs, opening up opportunities to meet numerous likeminded individuals.

Although there are many other reasons why you'd end up loving CES.

As of now, we are READY to HIT the market!

THANKS FOR SUPPORT! 

 

  

 

 

 

 

 


Risks and challenges

Any project might encounter unexpected obstacles, and this possibility is even more likely in the case of a hardware technology project that requires manufacturing. Keeping this in mind, we have already started to tackle some of these obstacles early on in order to minimize any delays. 
We will focus on the software that we think to be the most crucial part of the development and keep the software development progress run parallel with our hardware manufacturing. 
We are fully aware that unexpected bumps in the road may raise, but our team is dedicated to doing whatever it takes to keep our promises. We will update you on our progress; we are very much looking forward to hearing feedback from our backers, daily, we are getting more and more prepared to deliver Photon LMS on your desks.

Supply Chain Risk: Anything can happen during the production process, a machine or tool breaks, temperate factory power loss may occur. There is always a chance of getting the wrong parts or materials. All these factors can affect how long it takes place to produce our products.

Shipping Risk: Providing global shipping and warehousing logistics risks we outsource that stuff for experts. But even in this case, there may be some unforeseen circumstances like weather conditions, port congestion and etc. If all goes according to a plan, we will be shipping Photon LMS to our backers by the end of August 2020. Please NOTE that this is our target timeframe and you should keep in mind that unforeseen delays might take place. It is an estimated date but not a guarantee. Remember we will not ship products out unless we know everything is of High-Quality! 

We will keep you closely updated and communicate with our backers in a totally transparent way.

Rescued – The Furever Families Project

There are a lot of animals out there that need a home through no fault of their own. Regardless of their circumstances they need to be rescued.  There are lots of great organizations that help connect these animals to their furever homes. What most people don’t realize is that after these animals join their families, they insinuate themselves into our hearts and end up rescuing their furever families.

My name is Mark Hughes and I’m a professional pet photographer in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. I need your help for an exciting project that I’m working on as an animal lover and a volunteer for a local animal rescue.

If you love animals and support local rescues this project will be of interest to you.  If you love photographs of cute dogs and cats, this project will be of interest to you.  If you volunteer for or support rescues… this will be of interest to you.

I have been volunteering my time photographing animals for the Greater Edmonton Animal Rescue Society (GEARS), since 2014 and over that time I’ve photographed about 700 animals for them. GEARS used these images on social media and the internet to connect these animals with their forever families.

In June of 2020, I photographed a small puppy named Mocha. Although I had photographed so many cute animals over the years, I never felt like I wanted to take one home. This was not the case with Mocha and I fell hard for her.  I thought she would fit in well with our family, so I adopted her from GEARS.  She did fit in well, energized our older dog and has been a wonderful companion to me and my family particularly through the pandemic.

A few months after we adopted her, I was wondering about what had happened to all the other animals that I had photographed for GEARS over the years and who were the families that had adopted them. I reached out to connect with these families and the stories I heard back from them were incredible.

What I discovered was that while these animals needed to be rescued, when given the chance, they ended up rescuing their families as well.

What We Need & What You Get

I am going to self-publish the book and in order to make this a reality, I need your support.

My goal is to get 200 books pre-ordered and hitting our target of $10,000.  Hitting this target will allow us to make the book a reality and help us support GEARS, the rescue that made it happen.  The campaign will need as much early support as possible

Funding the project helps keep the individual cost per book down and pays for the costs of production (design, writing etc.).  GEARS, the animal rescue, will get 10% of the funds raised.  For each $1000 raised, the rescue will be able to vaccinate 1 animal or buy 5 bags of pet food.  If we hit our target, we will be able to vaccinate 10 animals and purchase 50 bags of pet food.

We also have a ton of cool and unique perks with branded collars, leashes, toques and tags.  We also have a limited quantity of signed books previously released by our writer Jane Marshall.

We are using the flexible funding program from Indiegogo and we will still be able to produce the books even if we are short of our total goal, but we are primarily using this as a means to allow people to pre-order the book so we know how many to produce.  Lower funding will mean less money that can be provided to the rescue.

Risks & Challenges

Every project has risks and challenges.  Our primary challenge is to get enough people interested in the project to make it economically worthwhile. The larger the print run, the lower the cost per book.  The biggest risk could be we don’t finish the project, but we since have most of the hard work already done that is unlikely.  All that is required it the assembly of the photos and stories into an exciting, beautiful and captivating book.

Mark is a professional photographer now but previously he was a successful businessman that allowed him to retire from engineering to pursue his passion of photography.  He works well with others and has assembled a great team to put together the families’ stories and images. Mark understands how to successfully get a project from initial concept to completion and ensure the finances work.

All the talent we need to complete the project is in place, all the photography is complete, all the interviews done, most of the stories written and the design of the book is well underway.  We intend to have he books in people’s hands by the end of November 2021, just in time for Christmas.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help directly by helping fund the project, sharing the project on social media and through personal networks will help the project succeed.

story:
Who we are and what we want to accomplish

Veritas Editions is an independent publisher of photographic art paired with narrative, presented in either book form or portfolios. Please have a look at our website here to get a feel for what we do.

We have begun two new works to honor the work of photographic artist Kenro Izu.  With the help of Angels such as yourself we will produce both a Fine Press Edition and a Trade Press Edition (aka "coffee table" book). While you are all familiar with coffee table books, the genre of Fine Press Editions is more rare and most people have never seen one - they are more elusive, typically residing in the Special Collections area of libraries and other institutions. For examples of each, have a look here at earlier Veritas Editions-produced Trade Press and Fine Press books.

 

Call to Action: Inviting Photographers to Show Your Work

Photographers are a community - providing their vision of the world for others to assess and enjoy. A primary goal of Veritas Editions is to provide avenues for the visibility of your work.

Add Your Photographic Prints

Add your print to the campaign. If you have a print already done, consider this mutually-beneficial prospect to include the print in this campaign:

  • Print added to this campaign as an available perk to supporters at a slightly reduced price (25% off gallery retail price)
  • For each print sold here, you receive 50% of the net profit and Kenro's book projects receive the remaining 50%
  • Shipping/Handling fees will be collected separately and provided to you at the end of the campaign for print fulfillment directly to the Supporter 
  • To participate, contact me with the information you see listed in the other print perks, and include a jpg 800px or more on the long side

 

Add Your Photography Books

Add your book to the campaign. If you have copies of your work published in a book, consider this mutually-beneficial prospect to include the book in this campaign:

  • Your book added to this campaign as an available perk to supporters at a slightly reduced price (25% off retail price)
  • For each book sold here, you receive 50% of the net profit and Kenro's book projects receive the remaining 50%
  • Shipping/Handling fees will be collected separately and provided to you at the end of the campaign for book fulfillment directly to the Supporter
  • To participate, contact me with the information you see listed in the other book perks, and include a jpg 800px or more on the long side

 

     

    Highlights of the Kenro Izu Trade Press Edition

    Prototypes are in the development stage, but not ready to show yet.  But we do have a mock up of design in process to share (note this may change)

    Impermanence

    Kenro Izu: The Spirit Within

    A Fifty-Year Journey

    Cloth-bound hardcover with slipcover, offset-printed in beautiful quadtone on Japanese fine-art paper

    312 pages, with over 220 plates from scanned original large-format film negatives made by Kenro Izu, represented in the aesthetic of a platinum / palladium darkroom print

    Amply sized at 12 x 13 inches

    Accompanying text from Kenro Izu, well-known photographic artist Eikoh Hosoe, and photographic art appreciator and Gallery owner Howard Greenberg

    Trilingual: English, Japanese, and Chinese

    Limited first edition print run of 1000-1500 (depending on funding)

    Thoughtfully designed by Gregory Wakabayashi, designer of other award-winning publications featuring Kenro's work

    Limited special edition of 100 signed copies housed in a custom clamshell case, each including an original collotype print made under the supervision of Kenro Izo at Benrido Atelier in Kyoto, each numbered and signed by the artist, with choice of four different prints (25 of each available). For more information on the Collotype process at Benrido Atelier see here.

     

    Four Collotype Prints from Benrido Atelier, Kyoto

    Available with Kenro Izu Limited Edition Trade Press

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

    Highlights of the Kenro Izu Fine Press Edition

    Similar to the Trade Press Edition, while we would love to show you a full mock-up, we are not prepared to show more than a few key elements of the design such as a Title Page element here.  During the course of the campaign we will be adding images of design/production as they take place.

    Impermanence

    Kenro Izu: The Spirit Within

    A handcrafted limited edition fine press book featuring original photographic prints "tipped in" and loose

    Fifteen original platinum/palladium prints tipped in and three original gum over platinum/palladium prints in loose folio

    Accompanying text from Kenro Izu, well-known photographic artist Eikoh Hosoe, and photographic art appreciator and Gallery owner Howard Greenberg

    Trilingual: English, Japanese, and Chinese

    Endsheets of native Japanese art paper, with fine cloth book and folio covers

    Large scale at 14 x 17 x 3 inches

    Housed in a custom artisan-produced traditional Japanese Lacquer Case from the region in Japan known for centuries of this art: Sabae, Fukui, Japan

    100% letterpress printing by Sherwood Press and custom binding by Marquand Editions

    Limited to an edition of twenty numbered copies, twelve lettered copies, and one Hors de Commerce copy

     

    Why this project now?

    On November 25th, 2020, Kenro Izu marked the beginning of  his 50th year of pursuing his dream while living in America. In Kenro's words "It was Thanksgiving night in 1971 when I arrived at Port Authority on a Greyhound bus. The illuminated Empire State Building on 34th Street shone through the fog. I was finally in New York, the city I had dreamed of before leaving Japan. At the time, New York was the only place where photography was taken seriously as an art form. I had studied photography at an art college in Tokyo, but in Japan photography was merely a form of media reproduced in magazines or, on selected occasions, in books. There was little interest or value in the sale and collection of original photographic prints. During my studies, I read about the Family of Man exhibition in 1955 at New York’s Museum of Modern Art. It moved me tremendously. I also read about galleries in New York that exhibited and sold photographs as art. That was where I wanted to be."

    We noticed the art of Kenro at the Alternative Process International Symposium on July 21, 2007 in Santa Fe. Kenro presented "Kenro Izu - The master of composition and platinum printing", and later that evening we saw more of his work in an exhibition at the Anahita Photography Gallery in Santa Fe. We carefully stored that experience into our memory banks. Fast forward to 2018, when that memory came alive again. Veritas Editions was just 3 years young, and we approached Kenro with the concept of these two books. We are very grateful he accepted, and he is deeply engaged in these projects as we continue in image selection, design and text.

    i

    Photo credit David Katzenstein

     

    Howard Greenberg noticed Kenro much earlier,  and writes in August 2020 "Kenro Izu is a very special person. He is an enormously gifted photographer, craftsman, and navigator of this Earth. He has willed himself to be faithful to his vision and to humanity. His accomplishments are many, and his effect on others has been profound and lasting. His body of work is monumental in its revelation of ancient spirits embodied in stone, the kind of stone that has been removed from below us and turned into form and structure over thousands of years. And his reverence for light and its visual effect on all the substances of our world achieve a spiritual quality similar to the ancient stones, and flowers, and human forms he photographs."

    Long-time friend and mentor Eikoh Hosoe writes of Kenro "My appreciation of Izu as a photographer stems not only from my admiration of the technical quality of his printing, but also from my understanding of the vision that has guided his career as an artist. It is a vision of the beauty in all things, which he often seeks out in places where it is perhaps most fragile: a flower whose fullness lasts but days, if not only hours; an ancient temple in Angkor, decaying and broken with the passage of time and half-consumed by the nature around it; the rituals of death on the banks of the Ganges River in India. But his true goal is not just what is seen through the lens of the camera or on a printed piece of paper. It is a spiritual beauty that can only be experienced in a more abstract sense."

     

    What We Need and What You Get

    The design effort for both Fine Press and Trade Press is presently around 80% completed, with plans for completion this Spring, funds willing. We have chosen our production partners based on the skill set needed as well as past performance. Every Veritas Editions book has won significant awards in the art photography book category. Projects like this are a collaborative effort, similar in concept to the African proverb "It takes a village to raise a child".  These editions are indeed like our children in many ways - we take great care in raising them and then we turn them loose into the world.

    Production for the Fine Press is planned to begin in January and finish up by April. Just 20 numbered, 12 lettered, and 1 Hors de Commerce books are planned.

    Production for the Trade Press book is planned to begin in March and be completed in May. The relative success of this fundraising will impact how many books are produced. If we meet our minimum goal of $9609, we should be able to produce 1500 books, 100 of which will be made into signed Limited Editions with print.

     

    Budget

    Projected direct cost to produce these two fine volumes is $164,000. We are seeking to fund 50% or $82,000 of these projects through a combination of crowd-sourcing and other pre-sales.  Crowd-sourcing so far has contributed about $33,000, leaving $49,000 or more needed from this campaign and other pre-sales to make these books a reality in the style they deserve.

     

    The Impact

    Let us not ignore the role art can play in our world. Art can bring joy to the soul.  We want to bring more of that joy into peoples' lives, enriching and inspiring their own creativity. Our hope is the creativity of Kenro Izu will form a virtuous cycle with all who touch it and with all who it touches.

     

    Unique Perks

    Become part of the Community: join fellow photographic artists and showcase your work here. We are fortunate to start with this group who are offering their gorgeous books/prints:

    Brigitte Carnochan

    Tillman Crane

    Fran Forman

    Craig Alan Huber

    George McClintock (added Jan 15th)

    Keron Psillas Oliveira

     

    Additional Perk Information

     

    Three Platinum/Palladium Prints

    Available with Craig Alan Huber Limited Edition Trade Press

     

     

     

    Gelatin Silver Print (uncropped)

    by Zach Weston

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
    • Use the Indiegogo and other social media share tools

     

    With our gratitude,

    Veritas Editions
story_txt:
Who we are and what we want to accomplish
Veritas Editions is an independent publisher of photographic art paired with narrative, presented in either book form or portfolios. Please have a look at our website here to get a feel for what we do.
We have begun two new works to honor the work of photographic artist Kenro Izu.  With the help of Angels such as yourself we will produce both a Fine Press Edition and a Trade Press Edition (aka "coffee table" book). While you are all familiar with coffee table books, the genre of Fine Press Editions is more rare and most people have never seen one - they are more elusive, typically residing in the Special Collections area of libraries and other institutions. For examples of each, have a look here at earlier Veritas Editions-produced Trade Press and Fine Press books.
 
Call to Action: Inviting Photographers to Show Your Work
Photographers are a community - providing their vision of the world for others to assess and enjoy. A primary goal of Veritas Editions is to provide avenues for the visibility of your work.
Add Your Photographic Prints
Add your print to the campaign. If you have a print already done, consider this mutually-beneficial prospect to include the print in this campaign:

Print added to this campaign as an available perk to supporters at a slightly reduced price (25% off gallery retail price)
For each print sold here, you receive 50% of the net profit and Kenro's book projects receive the remaining 50%
Shipping/Handling fees will be collected separately and provided to you at the end of the campaign for print fulfillment directly to the Supporter 
To participate, contact me with the information you see listed in the other print perks, and include a jpg 800px or more on the long side

 
Add Your Photography Books
Add your book to the campaign. If you have copies of your work published in a book, consider this mutually-beneficial prospect to include the book in this campaign:

Your book added to this campaign as an available perk to supporters at a slightly reduced price (25% off retail price)
For each book sold here, you receive 50% of the net profit and Kenro's book projects receive the remaining 50%
Shipping/Handling fees will be collected separately and provided to you at the end of the campaign for book fulfillment directly to the Supporter
To participate, contact me with the information you see listed in the other book perks, and include a jpg 800px or more on the long side

 
 Highlights of the Kenro Izu Trade Press Edition
Prototypes are in the development stage, but not ready to show yet.  But we do have a mock up of design in process to share (note this may change)

Impermanence
Kenro Izu: The Spirit Within
A Fifty-Year Journey
Cloth-bound hardcover with slipcover, offset-printed in beautiful quadtone on Japanese fine-art paper
312 pages, with over 220 plates from scanned original large-format film negatives made by Kenro Izu, represented in the aesthetic of a platinum / palladium darkroom print
Amply sized at 12 x 13 inches
Accompanying text from Kenro Izu, well-known photographic artist Eikoh Hosoe, and photographic art appreciator and Gallery owner Howard Greenberg
Trilingual: English, Japanese, and Chinese
Limited first edition print run of 1000-1500 (depending on funding)
Thoughtfully designed by Gregory Wakabayashi, designer of other award-winning publications featuring Kenro's work
Limited special edition of 100 signed copies housed in a custom clamshell case, each including an original collotype print made under the supervision of Kenro Izo at Benrido Atelier in Kyoto, each numbered and signed by the artist, with choice of four different prints (25 of each available). For more information on the Collotype process at Benrido Atelier see here.
 
Four Collotype Prints from Benrido Atelier, Kyoto
Available with Kenro Izu Limited Edition Trade Press
 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 
 
Highlights of the Kenro Izu Fine Press Edition
Similar to the Trade Press Edition, while we would love to show you a full mock-up, we are not prepared to show more than a few key elements of the design such as a Title Page element here.  During the course of the campaign we will be adding images of design/production as they take place.

Impermanence
Kenro Izu: The Spirit Within
A handcrafted limited edition fine press book featuring original photographic prints "tipped in" and loose
Fifteen original platinum/palladium prints tipped in and three original gum over platinum/palladium prints in loose folio
Accompanying text from Kenro Izu, well-known photographic artist Eikoh Hosoe, and photographic art appreciator and Gallery owner Howard Greenberg
Trilingual: English, Japanese, and Chinese
Endsheets of native Japanese art paper, with fine cloth book and folio covers
Large scale at 14 x 17 x 3 inches
Housed in a custom artisan-produced traditional Japanese Lacquer Case from the region in Japan known for centuries of this art: Sabae, Fukui, Japan
100% letterpress printing by Sherwood Press and custom binding by Marquand Editions
Limited to an edition of twenty numbered copies, twelve lettered copies, and one Hors de Commerce copy
 
Why this project now?
On November 25th, 2020, Kenro Izu marked the beginning of  his 50th year of pursuing his dream while living in America. In Kenro's words "It was Thanksgiving night in 1971 when I arrived at Port Authority on a Greyhound bus. The illuminated Empire State Building on 34th Street shone through the fog. I was finally in New York, the city I had dreamed of before leaving Japan. At the time, New York was the only place where photography was taken seriously as an art form. I had studied photography at an art college in Tokyo, but in Japan photography was merely a form of media reproduced in magazines or, on selected occasions, in books. There was little interest or value in the sale and collection of original photographic prints. During my studies, I read about the Family of Man exhibition in 1955 at New York’s Museum of Modern Art. It moved me tremendously. I also read about galleries in New York that exhibited and sold photographs as art. That was where I wanted to be."

We noticed the art of Kenro at the Alternative Process International Symposium on July 21, 2007 in Santa Fe. Kenro presented "Kenro Izu - The master of composition and platinum printing", and later that evening we saw more of his work in an exhibition at the Anahita Photography Gallery in Santa Fe. We carefully stored that experience into our memory banks. Fast forward to 2018, when that memory came alive again. Veritas Editions was just 3 years young, and we approached Kenro with the concept of these two books. We are very grateful he accepted, and he is deeply engaged in these projects as we continue in image selection, design and text.
i
Photo credit David Katzenstein
 
Howard Greenberg noticed Kenro much earlier,  and writes in August 2020 "Kenro Izu is a very special person. He is an enormously gifted photographer, craftsman, and navigator of this Earth. He has willed himself to be faithful to his vision and to humanity. His accomplishments are many, and his effect on others has been profound and lasting. His body of work is monumental in its revelation of ancient spirits embodied in stone, the kind of stone that has been removed from below us and turned into form and structure over thousands of years. And his reverence for light and its visual effect on all the substances of our world achieve a spiritual quality similar to the ancient stones, and flowers, and human forms he photographs."

Long-time friend and mentor Eikoh Hosoe writes of Kenro "My appreciation of Izu as a photographer stems not only from my admiration of the technical quality of his printing, but also from my understanding of the vision that has guided his career as an artist. It is a vision of the beauty in all things, which he often seeks out in places where it is perhaps most fragile: a flower whose fullness lasts but days, if not only hours; an ancient temple in Angkor, decaying and broken with the passage of time and half-consumed by the nature around it; the rituals of death on the banks of the Ganges River in India. But his true goal is not just what is seen through the lens of the camera or on a printed piece of paper. It is a spiritual beauty that can only be experienced in a more abstract sense." What We Need and What You Get
The design effort for both Fine Press and Trade Press is presently around 80% completed, with plans for completion this Spring, funds willing. We have chosen our production partners based on the skill set needed as well as past performance. Every Veritas Editions book has won significant awards in the art photography book category. Projects like this are a collaborative effort, similar in concept to the African proverb "It takes a village to raise a child".  These editions are indeed like our children in many ways - we take great care in raising them and then we turn them loose into the world.
Production for the Fine Press is planned to begin in January and finish up by April. Just 20 numbered, 12 lettered, and 1 Hors de Commerce books are planned.
Production for the Trade Press book is planned to begin in March and be completed in May. The relative success of this fundraising will impact how many books are produced. If we meet our minimum goal of $9609, we should be able to produce 1500 books, 100 of which will be made into signed Limited Editions with print.
 
BudgetProjected direct cost to produce these two fine volumes is $164,000. We are seeking to fund 50% or $82,000 of these projects through a combination of crowd-sourcing and other pre-sales.  Crowd-sourcing so far has contributed about $33,000, leaving $49,000 or more needed from this campaign and other pre-sales to make these books a reality in the style they deserve. 
The Impact
Let us not ignore the role art can play in our world. Art can bring joy to the soul.  We want to bring more of that joy into peoples' lives, enriching and inspiring their own creativity. Our hope is the creativity of Kenro Izu will form a virtuous cycle with all who touch it and with all who it touches.
 
Unique Perks
Become part of the Community: join fellow photographic artists and showcase your work here. We are fortunate to start with this group who are offering their gorgeous books/prints:
Brigitte Carnochan
Tillman Crane
Fran Forman
Craig Alan Huber
George McClintock (added Jan 15th)
Keron Psillas Oliveira
 
Additional Perk Information
 
Three Platinum/Palladium Prints
Available with Craig Alan Huber Limited Edition Trade Press

by Zach Weston

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
Use the Indiegogo and other social media share tools

 
With our gratitude,
Veritas Editions

story:
Shooting Sicily workshop combines two fundamental elements of my life, photography and Sicily. An experience that aims at the possibility of discovering the island from a different perspective from the ordinary, less stereotyped and wider. I will take you to visit some exclusive places in north-eastern Sicily and, under my guidance, we will try to get the best out of each place using every possible photographic technique.

This initiative aims to be a springboard towards a network of photographic experiences on the island. It is the first of a long series of photographic events with the aim of educating and disseminating photographic knowledge and culture.

---

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Why I need you:

I need your help to reach the 8K goal that will give sustainability and feasibility to the whole project. This sum is designed to cover the travel costs to and from the workshop locations, the cost of accomodation and all meals with traditional Sicilian dishes. My aim is to guarantee the right attention and comfort to the training and the activities.

If the first and initial goal is reached then the new goal will be 16K.

With that amount of money I want to buy new tools and offer more services to support the coursists needs.

For instance:

  • An off-road vehicle to reach secluded places
  • A supply of photographic easels available to each participant;
  • Photo filter kit to experiment with your creativity.

 

What I can give you:

A workshop is forever! The events of the last few years have showed us that travelling can sometimes be difficult or even impossible due to force majeure! All Shooting Sicily workshops are guaranteed with no time limit. If for any reason it will be impossible to attend the event, contact the responsable to program another workshop in the next available dates.

---

THE CAMPAIGN AND ITS BENEFITS

So many benefits are waiting for you!
Check the packages available and find out what is right for you.

All packages are designed for a minimum of 3 participants up to a maximum of 5.

All workshops, without including the one-day packages, cover travels to and from Catania airport (starting point of each workshop) and travels to reach the various locations.

With the exception of the standard package, all packages include meals and drinks which, in line with the spirit of the project, will be organized to enjoy Sicilian cuisine and tradition.
 A good mix between street food and gourmet meals!

---

THE LOCATIONS

Nebrodi

The Nebrodi Park is the largest protected area in Sicily, limited to the north by the Tyrrhenian Sea, to the west by the Madonie, to the east by Etna and to the south by the Simeto drainage basin.

The largest natural forests in Sicily extend over the Nebrodi. The exposure of the slopes, the altitude, the different types of soil influence the vegetation of the Park, making it amazingly rich and fascinating in every season of the year.

 

Argimusco

It is one of the most characteristic rock complexes in the southern Italy that extends in the province of Messina near the village of Montalbano Elicona and the Bosco di Malabotta Nature Reserve. Thousand-year-old stones, with anthropomorphic and zoomorphic shapes, have been modeled by the hand of man and by atmospheric agents and are arranged on a vast terrain where it is possible to observe Etna, the Aeolian islands, the sky and the uncontaminated stars for a unique and unrepeatable view.

 

Milazzo

The old village and the castle are the entrance of a path that winds along the promontory of Capo Milazzo between the two sides of west and east. The track, characterized by the typical Mediterranean scrub, rich in prickly pears and olive trees, develops through a suggestive stone climbing that ends at the lake of Venus, a natural swimming pool set in a panoramic cliff.

---

THE PROGRAM:

* This program is valid for the packages: standard, plus, advanced and individual.

The 4-day package includes the program shown above with an additional location and a night shooting session.

If the selected dates are not for you, you can write an email to the organizer to plan a workshop on the dates you prefer

---

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even though you are not able to make a financial contribution to this project, you can always help me by sharing it with your friends to make it known to as many people as possible. Moreover, Indiegogo allows us to use social media to share the project to an ever wider audience, use them to spread the campaign!

Visit my portfolio

Follow me on instagram

---

story:
A horror calendar like no other!

 

This year, our 4th, we bring you a fun calendar focusing on horror and its indie creators with a queen of the horror world who is a regular of indie films, big budgets, and everything in between.

As is now tradition, the calendar is basically ready at this point with just a few more things to get done. 

Why support?

By now you know me, Emilie, the photographer with the crazy idea that horror is a year-round thing and should be kept on proud display. I work hard to get you fun models, great photos, and a high quality product. Your support allows the project to continue and eventually become something even bigger.

Who's in it this year?

The cover lady is Our Lady of Horror herself, Eileen Dietz (The Exorcist, does more really need to be said?)! She also features on the inside as the model for a month. Joining her will be horror actor Charles Chudabala (Malvolia: The Queen of Screams, Ugly Sweater Party, Bearry, ...), immersive horror and film actress Kerry Wieder (Adventure Harbor, The Gloom, ...), Steve "Uncle Creepy" Barton (producer, actor, Dread Central founder), Sophia Cacciola and Michael J. Epstein (Clickbait, Blood of the Tribades), and a few more names coming soon! (We can't wait to tell all the names, but it's more fun if we keep some for later.)

story:
Short Summary

  Hello my name is Allan Garcia and I have been a photographer for over 6 years, mostly doing social events and photoshoots for families. I also work as a Director,  Designer and Photographer for My Wey Magazine in Louisville Ky.

  El cambio es ya is a protect that I wanted to do for quiet some time. During this pandemic time, I lost most of my regular work due to the closing of all Venues for social events. It has been difficult but at the same time, the bad situation allows us to start planing our Calendar.

This project is very important to us because if everything goes well it will allow us to keep doing what we love, do more projects that we have in mind, and also to recover from this difficult times.

 We are working hard to give you a High Quality product, something that you'll be proud to show to everyone.

What We Need & What You Get

This is what we need in order to finish our project succesfully:

  • We need to sell at least 350 calendar to cover the cost of printing, pre production,  and also to pay our team wich include models, makeup artist and hair.
  • All we ask is to select a perk that fits you and shop our calendar
  • There is also going to be a Launch Party event where the first 200 people buying the calendar will be invited. So, hurry up don't wait and get your calendar now!!

Risks & Challenges

As we said before its very important for us to at least sell 350 to get the best quality of printing and also to cover all the other expenses.

But even if we sell less we still going to print the calendar for all the people that support us.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that for some reason some people wont be able to buy the calendar, but there is always another way to help :

  • Share this on you social media and spread the word!

Y muchas gracias por todo... Son los mejores !!!
