story:
Welcome Back

Here we are! Round 4! First I have to say, thank you for all the support on my last 3 campaigns. Thanks to everyone who contributed to our project in Round 1, 2 and 3. Your contributions helped us buy some of the equipment needed for the studio. With almost reaching the projected goal, I wanted to do one more fundraiser campaign. The money raised here with hopefully furnish the studio. I want to offer a beautifully furnished space for creatives.

If you are interested in the last campaigns, click the links to read all about them!

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/your-one-sto...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/all-your-pho...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-photograph...

Please read and enjoy!

Hello! Thank you for taking the time to visit my crowdfunding campaign. My name is Jessica, and I am opening a photography rental studio in Sacramento. Photography is a keen interest for me. It is my passion, and since 2008, I have developed myself into a lifestyle photographer, photography consultant, and photography instructor. I put more of an interest in my photography, attending school, working in art galleries and well-known camera supply stores here in Sacramento. I have dedicated my time and energy for the past 13 years to learn everything I can about photography and ready to share my education and experience with others.

 

My Way Of Making A Difference

Photography, for some, can be an expensive career with gear costing $500 to $5000, and not every beginning photographer will be able to afford that.  Photographers starting will make anywhere from $25 to $75 per shoot. At that rate, You would have to do an average of 60-70 shots a month to afford the higher-end camera equipment. There is no possible way. This studio is my opportunity to give back and help develop photographers' skills, reach goals beyond imagination, create beautiful portfolios, and become successful photographers. Studio 64 will help photographers who are not financially ready to purchase the equipment and allow them to have a successful photoshoot. 

Not only are we providing a space to grow your experience and creativity, but we are providing a judgment-free, safe haven for you to explore any photography. Studio 64 will be uplifting. A studio to build your skills and a studio to feel comfortable and let the creativity run wild. I could not be more enthusiastic to give back to the photography community. I want photographers like myself to do what they love and love what they do.

 

Why Sacramento?

Sacramento offers an arts scene that rivals other cities and has exceptional cultural, artistic, and leisure opportunities that enrich life quality, contributing to a vibrant metropolitan region. Sacramento is the most thriving city with creative people everywhere. The diversity and creativity are so welcoming. It's the main reason why I want to start the studio.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Studio 64 will be a fully equipped photography rental studio. It will give the artist the possibility and properties to grasp their goals and cultivate as a better artist. My goal is to provide the tools any form of photographer or videographer would need to achieve his or her dreams. Achieving this goal will include tips, lessons, and lectures on photography, along with staying equipped with the latest technology and giving exceptional customer service.

All money raised will go to the purchasing of equipment needed. For Example:

  • Lighting
  • Background stands and backdrops
  • Computers for editing
  • Props
  • Furniture
  • Office supplies

 

How Will It Work?

Customers will make reservations on an hourly or full-day basis. The best part, there is no credit card or deposit needed! The hours are from 10 am to 5 pm Monday-Friday. Weekends are closed but will offer appointments if required. The studio will offer three departments: an all-white setup primarily used for photography, a green screen for video, and a media station for editing. The stations will provide lighting, stands, backdrops, props, etc. There will be a lounge area for creatives to relax and vibe together, a changing station with a lighted vanity for models to get ready, and a coffee bar that will nourish the hard-working minds. The media station will consist of a Mac and PC, with the current editing software installed. For example, Adobe Lightroom, Adobe Photoshop, and Adobe Final Cut Pro. All this at one low affordable price. If booking the whole day, customers will qualify for a fantastic discount. The bottom line, I want to help others reach their goals without worrying about the cost.

 

The Impact

While working in the photography field, I have noticed that there is not something like this in Sacramento. Yes, there are other studios available for rent, but they will come with limited equipment. Why limit the possibilities.  Also, there are no studios that will allow photographers to meet with clients and plan out their sessions. It's a little hard to talk about a photography session at a Starbucks. 

Fstoppers.com clarifies this reason in a short article.

https://fstoppers.com/business/5-reasons-you-should-never-meet-your-clients-starbucks-71011

Studio 64 will make it easy, fun, and stress-free! When complete, the studio will be a place for photographers and videographers to collaborate, work on personal projects, professional projects, and network with others in their industry.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is a great deal of risk opening a company that somewhat already exists, resulting in failure, lack of business, or low customer repetition. I plan to grow the studio by devoting all the time and energy to the company and providing exceptional customer service to gain repeat customers. There will be a great deal of energy put into marketing for customers to know about the studio. Social media, blogs, ads, and word of mouth will be some of the platforms.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. I ask you to get the word out and make some noise for this campaign.

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Because it works! Crowdfunding has become an accessible and practical way to raise money and successfully create projects. In today's world, it is essential for entrepreneurial artists like myself without significant funding or sponsors to rely on people like you to start my business. With your help, I have the freedom to lay the foundation for a successful business. As Indiegogo supporters, you will have access to several discounts and free enrollment to classes I teach.

I have 60 days to reach my goal, so anything you can do to spread this project will help. A simple repost on Facebook, creating a post on Instagram, or just telling your family and photography friends. I am just grateful for any help. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for sharing!

I truly believe in this project.

Jessica Falls

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Thank you for taking the time to visit my crowdfunding campaign. My name is Jessica, a small town girl residing in Sacramento, CA, and opening a photography rental studio in Midtown Sacramento. Photography is a keen interest for me. It is my passion, and since 2008, I have developed myself into a lifestyle photographer. I put more of an interest in my photography attending school, working in art galleries, and well-known camera supply stores. I have dedicated my time and energy for the past 12 years to learn everything I can about photography. I am ready to share my education and experience with others by opening a fully equipped studio that will be available for rent.

 

Sacramento And The Community

Sacramento, CA, is the most thriving city with creative people everywhere. The diversity and creativity are so welcoming. I could not be more enthusiastic to give back to the photography community. This studio is my opportunity, and I am ready to take advantage. I want photographers like myself to do what they love and love what they do. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Studio 64 will be a fully equipped photography rental studio. It will give the artist the possibility and properties to grasp their goals and cultivate as a better artist. My goal is to provide the tools any form of photographer or videographer would need to achieve his or her dreams. Achieving this goal will include tips, lessons, and lectures on photography, along with staying equipped with the latest technology and giving exceptional customer service. 

All money raised will go to the purchasing of equipment needed. For Example:

  • Lighting
  • Background stands and backdrops
  • Computers for editing
  • Props
  • Furniture
  • Office supplies

 

How Will It Work?

Customers will make reservations on an hourly or full-day basis. The best part, there is no credit card or deposit needed! The hours are from 10 am to 6 pm Monday-Friday. The studio will offer three departments: an all-white room primarily used for photography, a green room for video or photo, and a media station for editing. The rooms will provide lighting, stands, backdrops, props, etc. The media station will consist of a Mac and PC, which will have the current editing software installed. For example, Adobe Lightroom, Adobe Photoshop, and Adobe Final Cut Pro. All this at one low affordable price. If booking the whole day, customers will qualify for a fantastic discount. Bottom line, I want to help others reach their goals without worrying about the cost.

 

The Impact

While working in the photography field, I have noticed that there are not many spaces available for photographers to shoot. Not being able to have all the tools to build an awesome shoot or video can become problematic for any photographer to make. Studio 64 will make it easy, fun, and stress-free! When complete, the studio will be a place for photographers and videographers to collaborate, work on personal projects, professional projects, and network with others in their industry.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is a great deal of risk opening a company that already exists; resulting in failure, lack of business, or poor customer repetition. I plan to grow the studio by devoting all the time and energy to the company and providing exceptional customer service to gain repeat customers. There will be a great deal of energy and skills into marketing for customers to know about the studio. Social media, blogs, ads, and word of mouth will be some of the platforms.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. I ask you to get the word out and make some noise for this campaign.

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Because it works! Crowdfunding has become an accessible and practical way to raise money and successfully create projects. In today's world, it is essential for entrepreneurial artists like me without significant funding or sponsors to rely on the support of people like you to start my business. With your help, I have the freedom to lay the foundation for a successful business. As Indiegogo supporters, you will have access to several discounts offered and free enrollment to classes I teach.

I have 60 days to reach my goal, so anything you can do to spread this project will help. A simple repost on Facebook, creating a post on Instagram, or just telling your family and photography friends. I am just grateful for any help. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for sharing!

I truly believe in this project.

Jessica Falls

I truly believe in this project.

story:
DRAGONS & SNAKESTONES

Hello. I'm Jamie Dormer-Durling, a photographer and lecturer based in Weston-super-Mare in the UK.  In the spring of 2014, whilst walking on the beach at Lyme Regis, I struck up a conversation with a group of people who appeared to be looking for something amongst the debris of a recent rockfall.  They told me they were on a fossil walk, searching for ammonites, belemnites and pieces of the creatures of the distant past, following in the footsteps of a local heroine.

It was at this moment that my obsession with Mary Anning began.

Fossil Hunters, Lyme Regis, 2014

Later that day I found myself in Lyme Regis Museum, learning about her life, her discoveries and her exploitation at the hands of the scientific establishment of the early 19th Century. 

I was immediately engrossed in her story.

Trips to the Natural History Museum in London soon followed, and I was fortunate enough to gain access to some of her handwritten documents. Through her notes, drawings and doodles, a voice began to emerge from within this contested and fragmented narrative. 

Copy of Paper Transcription of the Geological Society of London 1823

Just as my research was intensifying, Mary Anning’s story was gathering momentum outside of the world of science. Institutions started to celebrate her as a collector, novelists fictionalised her romantic relationships, and small and large-screen biopics explored her personal life.

After contacting people with close connections to her story, and spending time photographing the Lyme Regis landscape, it occurred to me that the real story might lie with the fossils, now sitting in museums across the country.

As well as her hometown, I visited Oxford, Cambridge, London and spent time studying these artefacts, sitting in the space with them, trying to find a way to photograph them that might do justice to this part of her untold legacy,


Four years later, I was scanning and retouching the photographs in the lab. It was this process that revealed the heart of the story, scrutinising the intricate detail of these ancient objects - rendered perfectly by large format negatives - just as Mary Anning had all those years ago.

Detail of SM J.35189, Icthyosaurus platydon, Sedgwick Museum of Earth Sciences, Cambridge, Photographed 2017

In this moment, I felt close to her. Like we'd had an encounter in a visual space that we had both briefly occupied, brought together by a forensic fascination with these artefacts of deep time. Set against the 195 million years between us and the creatures entombed in stone, the two centuries that separated Mary and I seemed insignificant. It was this moment of revelation that led to the final stretch of the project. I returned to all of the museum sites to re-photograph these objects, moving ever-closer to their surfaces, looking for traces she left behind, for areas that would have captured and held her gaze.

Then, back to the sea and the rocks of Lyme Regis where the journey began.

-------

In this photobook “Dragons and Snakestones”, I have collected together some of the photographs I made of the fossils she found and the landscape she explored. These have been brought together with excerpts from letters to her friends and correspondence with the dealers and powerful men of the scientific establishment of the 19th century.

Detail of Letter from Mary Anning to William Buckland, concerning the sale of an Ichthyosaur, 1829, Natural History Museum Archives, London

This 102 page publication aims to tell her story, celebrate her moments of discovery, and reveal her continued struggle for recognition. 

By pre-ordering this book and supporting its publication, you too are becoming part of her journey, celebrating the achievements and contributions of this woman of scientific and political significance.

The money raised through this campaign will go towards the printing, production and distribution of the book as well as helping me to pay those that helped me with the design and layout of the texts and photographs that have been brought together in this book.  A donation will be made to Lyme Regis Museum from any profit made. 

Thank you.

story:
Humanitarian wedding photographer shifts focus to expose beauty found in the shadows of the streets.

I had achieved far more than I had dreamed.

I had an outwardly beautiful life. Faith, family, and finances. I had a 20 year career as a wedding photographer that exceeded my wildest expectations. And yet, I couldn't shake this deep knowing within me that there had to be more to this life than simply achieving the American Dream I had once put my faith in.

Midlife crisis becomes clarity

Confusion set in and I journeyed outside of my comfort zone to find answers. From missions trips to meditation to Burning Man. For seven years, the more I searched, the less interested I became in remaining a wedding photographer. As my career was unwinding, so was my 20 year marriage which ended in Dec 2013. Instead of buying the cliche midlife Corvette, I bought a motorhome and began a road trip that would take Denise (then my girlfriend - now my wife) and I through all 48 continental United States over the next seven years.

It all started with a Free Hug

Our love story began on February 14th, 2014 when we moved into our motorhome with an intention to slow down. I set a leisurely course for New Orleans to photograph Mardi Gras. Upon arrival, I was wearing a "Free Hugs" t-shirt. Surprisingly, many streets kids wanted to hug me. My heart stirred and, for the next 3 days, I wore the same t-shirt and hugged more kids. 

Days after we left NoLa, my heart whispered "Go back to New Orleans and start photographing the "dirty kids" (their self given name). After my initial resistance, I agreed to go back. The arms of the community I thought would be closed and guarded were wide open and welcoming.

Over the next few years, Denise and I would search for dirty kids in the cities we traveled too. We have sat with, traveled with, listened too, ate with, drank with, and photographed hundreds of traveling dirty kids around the country.

This first book of a planned trilogy represents the Spirit & Wisdom of a nomadic tribe that few outsiders understand. These kids have welcomed and accepted me as one of their own. I introduce them now to you. I am honored to present this collection of black & white images for your visual enjoyment/curiosity and, perhaps, deeper contemplation.

 

Birthing a book into the world

Beautiful offset book printing is expensive. I am overjoyed that I found a printer that also prints photography books for National Geographic. Self publishing has required a lot of work, research, and perseverance. I have entirely self funded this project - until now:)

Now, I am asking for your generous support to showcase the beauty found in the shadows of the streets. 

  • $8,000 for binding and printing.
  • $1,500 for freight shipping.
  • $11,111 is the minimum goal to cover all expenses. Let's go all in!
  • Books will print in May 2021 and ship in June 2021.
  • **For every book purchased, we will give a book to a homeless dirty kid.
  • Faith Perk will get you 1 freshly printed copy of DIRTY KIDS
  • Hope Perk will get you 1 signed + blessed copy of DIRTY KIDS
  • Love Perk will get your name printed in the book as an Indiegogo Angel Supporter and you'll get 1 signed + blessed copy of DIRTY KIDS
  • Kings & Priests Perk will get your name printed in the book as an Indiegogo Archangel Supporter and you'll get 11 signed + blessed copies of DIRTY KIDS

Dope Photography for a Higher Purpose

We see the sales from DIRTY KIDS used to fund 3 levels of healing

  • $11K raised will get the book printed and shipped. Level 1 will honor the kids I have photographed. **Many of the kids in the book will get as a signed copy as a gift. And it's small enough to easily fit in a back pack.  
  • $22K raised will print the book and begin a cross country tour this spring. I will be discussing modern faith and outreach, homelessness, addiction, foster care, and the wisdom of the Prodigal Journey with influential misfits - spiritual teachers, authors, activists and artists. 
  • $33k raised will cover the book, the tour, and an epic documentary film.
  • Ultimately [with images and words] we hope to change perceptions of the homeless from one of FEAR to one of LOVE. Simply acknowledging our common humanity starts by making eye contact, offering spare change, a kind word, or sharing a smile goes a long way toward a more compassionate community. I would suggest that most of these travelers are running away from deep pain that they do not have the tools or support to heal on their own. Many are trapped deep in addiction. We invite you to be a part of the solution! By giving of your time, talents, and treasures you give (& receive) healing in return. Our indifference and judgements of the homeless indicate a closed or constricted heart. By lovingly blessing others, our hearts soften and eventually expand. But be warned, once your heart is opened you may find yourself on a sidewalk or on a park bench sharing a meal with them. I wonder if this is the experience Jesus had with "the sinners, drunkards and prostitutes"? We believe these dirty kids, lost boys, and outcasts are the contemporary Prodigal Sons and Daughters of our time. They don't need to be preached too, they simply need to feel welcomed..... home.

 

WE > ME I am grateful for your loving support.

Denise and I hope to inspire new ambassadors of love among the homeless. Will you join us?

With your partnership, we can collectively create healing.  The book is the next step toward this vision.

There are many ways to help spread the good news about the Dirty Kids book. Against all sane advice, I am launching a book during a pandemic, without an email list, reaching out to friends we know! Early supporters, we need your help.

Would you get the word out and make some noise about DIRTY KIDS in any way you can?

Please purchase a book or two. For every book you purchase, we give one to a dirty kid.

Thank you. Warmest blessings, Joe + Denise

Upon arrival, I was wearing a "Free Hugs" t-shirt. Surprisingly, many streets kids wanted to hug me. My heart stirred and, for the next 3 days, I wore the same t-shirt and hugged more kids. 
Days after we left NoLa, my heart whispered "Go back to New Orleans and start photographing the "dirty kids" (their self given name). After my initial resistance, I agreed to go back. The arms of the community I thought would be closed and guarded were wide open and welcoming.
Over the next few years, Denise and I would search for dirty kids in the cities we traveled too. We have sat with, traveled with, listened too, ate with, drank with, and photographed hundreds of traveling dirty kids around the country.
This first book of a planned trilogy represents the Spirit & Wisdom of a nomadic tribe that few outsiders understand. These kids have welcomed and accepted me as one of their own. I introduce them now to you. I am honored to present this collection of black & white images for your visual enjoyment/curiosity and, perhaps, deeper contemplation.

 
Birthing a book into the world

Beautiful offset book printing is expensive. I am overjoyed that I found a printer that also prints photography books for National Geographic. Self publishing has required a lot of work, research, and perseverance. I have entirely self funded this project - until now:)
Now, I am asking for your generous support to showcase the beauty found in the shadows of the streets. 

$8,000 for binding and printing.
$1,500 for freight shipping.
$11,111 is the minimum goal to cover all expenses. Let's go all in!
Books will print in May 2021 and ship in June 2021.
**For every book purchased, we will give a book to a homeless dirty kid.
Faith Perk will get you 1 freshly printed copy of DIRTY KIDS
Hope Perk will get you 1 signed + blessed copy of DIRTY KIDS
Love Perk will get your name printed in the book as an Indiegogo Angel Supporter and you'll get 1 signed + blessed copy of DIRTY KIDS
Kings & Priests Perk will get your name printed in the book as an Indiegogo Archangel Supporter and you'll get 11 signed + blessed copies of DIRTY KIDS


Dope Photography for a Higher Purpose

We see the sales from DIRTY KIDS used to fund 3 levels of healing

$11K raised will get the book printed and shipped. Level 1 will honor the kids I have photographed. **Many of the kids in the book will get as a signed copy as a gift. And it's small enough to easily fit in a back pack.  
$22K raised will print the book and begin a cross country tour this spring. I will be discussing modern faith and outreach, homelessness, addiction, foster care, and the wisdom of the Prodigal Journey with influential misfits - spiritual teachers, authors, activists and artists. 
$33k raised will cover the book, the tour, and an epic documentary film.
Ultimately [with images and words] we hope to change perceptions of the homeless from one of FEAR to one of LOVE. Simply acknowledging our common humanity starts by making eye contact, offering spare change, a kind word, or sharing a smile goes a long way toward a more compassionate community. I would suggest that most of these travelers are running away from deep pain that they do not have the tools or support to heal on their own. Many are trapped deep in addiction. We invite you to be a part of the solution! By giving of your time, talents, and treasures you give (& receive) healing in return. Our indifference and judgements of the homeless indicate a closed or constricted heart. By lovingly blessing others, our hearts soften and eventually expand. But be warned, once your heart is opened you may find yourself on a sidewalk or on a park bench sharing a meal with them. I wonder if this is the experience Jesus had with "the sinners, drunkards and prostitutes"? We believe these dirty kids, lost boys, and outcasts are the contemporary Prodigal Sons and Daughters of our time. They don't need to be preached too, they simply need to feel welcomed..... home.

 
WE > ME I am grateful for your loving support.
Denise and I hope to inspire new ambassadors of love among the homeless. Will you join us?
With your partnership, we can collectively create healing.  The book is the next step toward this vision.
There are many ways to help spread the good news about the Dirty Kids book. Against all sane advice, I am launching a book during a pandemic, without an email list, reaching out to friends we know! Early supporters, we need your help.
Would you get the word out and make some noise about DIRTY KIDS in any way you can?
Please purchase a book or two. For every book you purchase, we give one to a dirty kid.
Thank you. Warmest blessings, Joe + Denise

story:
Who? what? why?

Those of you who already know me have witnessed my great love and obsession with books. Traces Within is about time to turn into one. Since 2006 I have been shooting images that connect with my unconscious. I have been editing, sequencing, shooting, dreaming, designing, making dummies, exhibiting, etc for many years. This is a good time for me to turn Traces Within into a book. And I believe I can do it with your support. Whether you know me personally or not, I hope my images connect with you too and you will also be excited to see them in book form.

The plan

Through various studies on the photobook I concluded that I want Traces Within to be printed on uncoated paper, short run, approximately A4 size but slightly smaller and with a long stich exposed spine which I will hand stitch. Spending time with each book will be the minimum act of 'thanking' each one of you. 

I had a reasonable quote from printers in London and I am determined to self publish even if I won't reach my funding goal. 

Why self-publish?

Traces Within has enjoyed international recognition for many years* (see further down). My decision to self-publish is linked to my ideals of being self sufficient and independent. I will distribute my book with great love and respect to bookshops I love and in person. As contributors you will always have a special place in my heart and I will dedicate a page in my website for all of you.

Risks & Challenges

Even if I don't reach my fundraising goal, I will self-publish. That's why I chose the flexible funding mode. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know we live in challenging times, so please don't worry if you can't contribute financially. Every share of this link is helpful. 

Many thanks! 

Αν κάποιος απο Ελλάδα θέλει να στηρίξει την προσπάθειά μου να αυτοεκδοθώ, αλλά δυσκολεύεται λόγω των capital controls μπορεί να μου στείλει μέιλ και να βάλει όσα χρήματα θέλει και μπορεί στο λογαριασμό μου στην Πειραιώς. Δεχτές και οι δόσεις. Επίσης, η στήριξη δεν χρειάζεται να είναι οικονομική. Κάθε μοίρασμα του συνδέσμου βοηθάει. Αγάπη πάνω απ'όλα.


*

Selected awards/exhibitions of TRACES WITHIN:

2014: F Photo-book Show in Tokyo Institute of Photography
Photoville New York, Leiden International Photography Festival

Night Contact, Multimedia and Photography Festival, part of Brighton Photo Biennial 2014. 

2013: Athens Photo Festival, Young Greek Photographers (selected among the 10 out of 790)

2012: Mnemosyne, group exhibition at Menier Gallery, London. 

2011: Traces Within, solo exhibition in Melanythros gallery, Athens. 

‘Reference Point’,  International Summer School of Latvia, Goethe Institute, Riga2010: Fotografia International Festival of Rome, Museum of Contemporary Art in Rome, curated by Marc Prust.


2009: ‘The Arts Forum Presents’, Brighton Media Centre, Brighton Photo Fringe. 
HUMBLE Arts Foundation, 33rd Juried Group Exhibition.
OPEN'09 Brighton Photo Fringe. Juried exhibition From Here, curated by Chloe Hoare, Max Houghton, Yasmina Reggad and John Gill.
Crane Kalman Gallery, Brighton.

PX3 2009 Honourably mention at the category of Fine Art student photographers

2008: MA Photography graduating show, Between the Hallucinatory and the Real. University of Brighton Foyer, Grand Parade.
Annual Foto8 Awards & Summer Show, Juried exhibition at HOST gallery, London.
Voies Off Festival evening shows, Cour de l’Archevêché, Arles FR.

story:
The Beginning

My name is Jade Brewer and I am an emerging photographer and recent grad of Montserrat College of Art in Massachusetts. I first started shooting when I was a kid, burning through camera after disposable camera until I decided that I wanted to it for the rest of my life. I became completely immersed in my art and truly established who I was as an artist and where I wanted to go with it when I did the study abroad program to Viterbo, Italy. I was bitten by the travel bug. Travel photography became my dream and passion. 
The project began as my thesis project, Five Years. I photographed all of the places I have lived through out my life. Considering that I have never lived anywhere more than five years, I managed to fill my entire senior year with nostalgic trips all over New Hampshire. They show the relationship with memory and place over time, intentionally becoming less inhabited the farther back in time I went in my memory.

Now and the Future

The pictures ended up becoming more than I could have ever expected, showing quite a few times including my first solo exhibition this past January. 
My plans for the "spinoff" series Hometown is to visit my friends that I have amassed all over the world and photograph their home towns from their perspective. The  first step of this project is going to take place in Cape Town, South Africa, photographing the childhood town of my friends Kate and Sean for fourteen days. My goal is to complete a photo book following them as they show me the most important and intimate places from their childhoods. If all goes well the project will continue into the Philippines, Slovakia, Turkey, and Romania.   

What We Need & What You Get

As an emerging professional, I work out of my house. I have a basic setup that I love and gets the job done. The purpose of the funds is to take me to Africa, and provide the ability to travel around the country. Any extra money will be put towards helping out my friends who are providing housing to me while I am there as well as food and other living expenses. This will also allow me the financial room to keep up with my expenses back home while I am out of work for the trip. Also some of the money will go towards producing the book and making copies for you! Any funding received above the amount listed of $2500 will be donated to Camfed; a charity that helps women and girls in marginalized areas of Africa receive an education.

The Impact

The funds will allow me to go on my first ever travel expedition for my work. This is step one in building a career in travel photography for myself and broadening my horizons as a person. I would like to take my work in a direction where I can use it to help and impact others in a positive way. Raising more funds than projected will directly impact children in Africa by providing money directly to charities that will help them.

Risks & Challenges

Challenges I may face through out the trip will be related to technology and making sure I have the appropriate materials and insurances for my equipment. Right now I have everything I need to make this happen except the plane ticket. Risks include making sure my finances are secure enough to make this trip happen, but with your help I will be able to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Passing the word around will be all I can ask to help. Exposure and support are priceless and my gratitude for even taking the time to read about this campaign are complete and immeasurable. 

Thank you very much for your time and consideration of my proposal.

story:
Hello!

Jacob and Miriam are two passionate individuals. You will barely ever see Jacob without a camera in front of his face  and Miriam will often disappear into her notebook, scribbling poetry.

They have both been working prolifically over the past few years, creating and coming up with projects. Unfortunately, art is seldom financially lucrative, and preparing for such projects is often costly. And so they are asking for your help with this next adventure. Please help them make it possible for the sake of art and so that they can continue bringing beautiful /moving things to life!

This next project aims show how alive Malta's Capital City is, being through events, shoppers, the citizens who live there as well as the protests. Through street photography ( Hand Prints) and poetry written for those images, Jacob and Miriam want to give you in an insight into what Valletta is today, it's life and the life of those who pass through it's gates.

Note about hand prints: You shall see this phrase a lot when it comes to the perks, and for those who do not know , I think it is only fair that I explain. A silver gelatin print is a photography printed by hand in a dark room, using a negative to create a positive. All hand prints are made in a dark room, and they take time to make. Each and every print will have subtle differences , making each print unique.


What We Need & What You Get

This is what they need:

Funding for chemicals and photo paper with which to make silver gelatin prints as well as the cost to mount both pictures and poems : 450 euros

Funding for advertising and posters : 150 euros

Funding to organise the exhibition launch on the 16th of September 2015:  This is still to be determined (we are also looking for sponsors for food and drink) : 100 euros

The Perks that you get for your generosity:


 5 euros -Gratitude and smiles! 

Even if you cannot afford to give a lot, it means the world to us. THANK YOU!

  10 euros - a handwritten original poem by Miriam Calleja

30 euros - a 6x9 original Hand print signed by Jacob Sammut
40 euros - A professionally mounted handwritten poem By Miriam Callejja

70 euros - an 8x10 original Hand print signed by Jacob Sammut

160 euros - a 14 x 10 original Hand Print signed by Jacob Sammut

225 euros - a 14 x 10 original Hand Print, mounted , numbered and signed by Jacob Sammut 


Even if you feel that you cannot help right now (and we can assure you that we will be grateful for every little amount) please spread the word about this event and do come to visit the exhibition. Let the artists know what you think, how the prints and poems make you feel. Reach out and connect! That is the purpose of art :)


If the goal is not reached whatever funds we shall receive shall still be helping us with the burden, and every little helps.

The Impact

We believe that a lot of people may have heard of Valletta and Malta but very few people have had the possibility to experience it. Valletta as the capital has been changing a lot, but what has really changed is the way people react to it. Before Valletta belonged to the native citizens, but it is now very multicultural. This series in the coming future shall be part of history as within the coming years more changes shall take place. 
With the previous project for Birgu being successful, getting very good reviews, we believe that the one of Valletta will be just as grand.

story:
My name is Michael, and I am the founder and Chief Visionary Officer (CVO) of Lightchaser Photography Adventures. Based primarily out of Jackson Wyoming, we operate our professional workshops exclusively in the 22+ million acre Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem, often considered "one of the last remaining intact ecosystems" in the northern temperate zone.

Federally managed ( public land that belongs to all of us) areas that are within the GYE include:

  • National Park Service: Yellowstone National Park, Grand Teton National Park, and Glacier National Park in Montana, as well as various other surrounding public lands.
  • US National Forest Service : Gallatin, Custer, Caribou-Targhee, Bridger-Teton and Shoshone National Forests.
  • United States Fish & Wildlife Service (USFWS) includes the famous 22,000 acre National Elk Refuge
  • Ten distinct National Wilderness Areas have been established within the GYE's National Forests since 1966, mandating the highest level of habitat protection that the USFS uses.
  • The GYE also encompasses a great deal of privately held lands surrounding those managed by the U.S. Government. 

This is the area where many of our professional instructors have gained their great depth of knowledge and years through operating and having usually lived here for many years, including myself (bio to follow). It is this level of intimacy and familiarity with the area that enables us to create a unique niche amongst photography workshops nationwide, many that offer workshops here in the GYE but otherwise do not actually live here.

 

    We bring you the most up to date information on wildlife: the latest sighting of well known and beloved  grizzly bears (such as Raspberry and Blondie), where the wolves of Yellowstone were last seen, and so much more--and of course we also know the deep complexities, challenges, and politics of the region topped off with local lore, natural history and colorful stories that just cant be  known by non-regional photographers. More than just a photography workshop, Lightchaser Photo Adventures are a truly intimate and diversified look at the deep nuances and incredible variety that this vast and wild area offers. 

   There are countless opportunities for intriguing excursions, safaris, and adventures to not only the famous and iconic scenes, such as Old Faithful or Going to the Sun Highway in Glacier NP, to many lesser known-and less crowded- places.

Here is a sample of potential workshops:

1:  The Living Landscapes of Grand Teton National Park

2: Some Like it Hot: Geothermal Wonders of Yellowstone

3: Take Your Best Shots: Composition That Rocks

4: The Amazing Critters of Yellowstone

5: Wild about Wildflowers of The Tetons

6: Falling for the Fall Colors of Glacier

…and many more…

 

Lets go on a short little photography adventure first, though

So: picture this:

   You’re standing in an open expanse of sagebrush meadows and colorful wildflowers with a stunning backdrop of rugged, snow-capped mountains reflected in the still waters of a small pond just in front of you and your group of fellow photographers. It’s quintessential scenery, and you’re ready with your camera. Yet the light has been very all-over-the-map since you got up at 7 am, and you have been chasing it all day. As you were setting up just here a few minutes ago, the sun went behind the clouds again blanketing the scene with less contrast and a flat sky.  Of course, you know that all outdoor photographers will come to face this type of situation, so you stand patiently waiting for that optimal moment.

   And then it happens: A big beautiful bull moose walks into the scene and begins to wade across the small pond. The challenge is quickly apparent as you fire off a few funky test shots as he wades across the pond: You know your camera is going to not quite pull this off without some kind of intervention: The moose is happening but the light is not!

   Not for long, though: Your Lightchaser photography instructor is standing right next to you and says: "Ok everyone this is what we are going to do-given that we don't have much time or good light let’s aim those lenses and start shooting."

~Let your light-chasing adventure begin~

 

   Lightchasers Photography Adventures, though based in Jackson Wyoming, reaches out to the photographers that are a significant part of the always growing multi-billion dollar travel and adventure tourism industry. From Jackson and Cody, Wyoming to Bozeman, Montana and Banff in Canada, we have the region covered with a wide variety of workshops ranging from 1/2 day excursions into the Tetons to multi-day wildlife adventures in Yellowstone, or we can be found chasing the light of the beautiful turquoise lakes ad skies of Glacier National Park.

     Your photography guide also has relevant and unbiased knowledge of the current politics and complex ecological and stewardship challenges surrounding the vast flora and fauna, as well as the natural resources of the multi-state region of Montana, Idaho, and Wyoming (and to a lesser extent, Utah and Canada).

    A great deal of this ecosystem centers around the 11,000 cubic miles of 4000+ degree lava underneath Yellowstone, one of the 7 super-volcanoes in the world, and also crazily embraces the highest elevations of the United States: the 3000+ mile long Continental Divide runs right through it all.  Snows and rains that fall on the east end west sides of the CD are the primary source of 4 of the 5 major rivers in the US, creating an incredibly unique and diverse ecosystem. The Continental divide is also  where the highest snowfalls in the US occur, all the way up to 1100 inches in record years. Countless streams, rivers, and lakes are the direct result of all this precipitation, and naturally all species of the region need this water -and the cleanest air in the US, usually-to survive. Thus, there is no other place on our planet that is both relatively easily accessible by humans (for the most part) and is yet so sparsely populated by us and still blessed with often untouched wildlands.  Its an amazing, soul changing place-and I never get tired of it...

    This, then, is what Lightchasers knows and loves so well, and we endeavor with sharp passion and cutting edge professionalism to share and explore it with our students.

 

Now lets get to why Lightchaser is seeking funding:

Initial startup costs include the following:

 

Phase 1:  Immersion of the Chief Visionary Officer (thats me) in the dynamic, challenging and rewarding business Startup Intensive right here in Jackson, Wyoming. It ends on December 14th, so I am already more than halfway done-and I simply need your help with additional funding. 

Having already self funded nearly half of this $5000 class, this leaves me with the remaining $2500 that the Intensive costs, minus the funds already raised through Indiegogo.

 

The 10 week Startup Intensive  is offered through the accredited Central Wyoming College (CWC) and was co-created by members of an entrepreneurial business group based in Jackson known as the "Silicon Couloir...Here is a link to the Startup Institute itself:

http://www.siliconcouloir.com/start-up-institute/

And following is The Intensive website description:

     "An intensive entrepreneurship program designed to provide you with proven tools, frameworks and skills that winning companies utilize to launch successful business ideas. Get business expertise and support to build your toolkit and drive your action plan. This is a hands-on, experiential, practical course dedicated to working on and launching your business idea.

In only 10 weeks you will:

  1. Determine key need and benefit of your idea, and hone your motivations behind it.
  2. Define your target audience
  3. Understand the competitive landscape
  4. Conduct qualitative and quantitative research
  5. Identify core competencies and business value proposition
  6. Build a detailed financial model and cash flow projections
  7. Develop a strategic plan and timeline for implementation

And walk away with:

  • Creative brief/look and feel
  • Elevator pitch
  • Competitive analysis and pricing matrix
  • Marketing strategy
  • Budget and financial overviews
  • Staffing and operational plans
  • Legal and accounting frameworks
  • Convincing investor presentation
  • 2-page corporate overview and power letter
  • Ten follow-on consulting hours with experts   

      And finally, a key component of the Startup Intensive that makes it all come together:

   At the end of the class in early December, we present our now polished business vision and plan to members of the Silicon Couloir group here in Jackson, a well funded and connected group of dynamic fellow entrepreneurs and venture capitalists that have an excellent track record of providing critical additional seed funding for various endeavors coming out of the Startup over the past 6 years. This is an amazing opportunity and I can assure you i will be seeking additional support from this Pitch Day.

   I am trying to avoid a good deal of the normal anywhere in the world and any business you can think of startup uncertainty by getting a jump start with this intensive, and this is why your financial backing is so welcome!

     Otherwise its often a pass-fail scenario with 95% of most small business's failing in their first two years without at least some capital to get going. Thats why I am so grateful for your help.

 

 Phase 2 of where your assistance will help immediately begins upon completion of the Startup Intensive and will include:

  • Funding for the design and development of a robust e-commerce enabled professional website completed with a wide variety of exciting offerings in both photography and film. My 2-3 year plan includes a big push into video production such as teaching how to make a documentary film and then expanding into workshops worldwide.
  • Office and group workshop space in communities where our instructors are based throughout the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem.
  • 1-4 (or more)  Macbook laptops for administrative use and classroom photo and later video editing. Cost: $3-5,000-or more.
  • A variety of necessary equipment, both photo and video: tripods, filters, camera bags and cases, camera bodies and lenses, etc.  Cost: $4000-6000 and up.  
  • SEO expansion, business marketing and all that is entailed there: Will include hiring a (temporary but critical) marketing person. Quite possibly in the neighborhood of 2-$6k.
  • The procurement of safe and efficient vehicles for transporting our students: 5 vans or SUVS (used) from $4-$20,000 and up. Per vehicle.  This is, of course the largest single cost associated with this venture, and will likely spark another search for funding in the near future.
  • A professional Jackson based marketing company will be hired to implement a successful launch.  Minimum $2500, easily more.
  • All other development costs that it will take to launch the JHSFP by the spring of 2017.

 

Finally we get to: Who I am in the world of photography and film: 

Following is a brief synopsis of my multifaceted experiences in the world of photography and film/multimedia spanning over 25 years since I graduated from Humboldt State University:

  • 3 semesters in college that included several photography courses. Photography was already a passion of mine by the time I entered college, and I blended classes in photography into my final BS in Natural Resources and Environmental Communications degree.
  • 20+ seasons teaching over 560+ students in Colorado through the Crested Butte Wildflower Festival, private workshops, and other venues
  • 3 art gallery representations in Crested Butte, CO
  • Several regional publications credits via printed scenic galleries
  • Co-founder of the successful Crested Butte Land Trust scenic calendar, raising funds for critical land conservation since 1998. Still a force in their continuing fundraising efforts
  • 7+ seasons/years as a professional wedding photographer, videographer and editor 
  • 5+ seasons as a race and sporting event photographer all over Colorado and beyond
  • Professional Certification in Multimedia in 2002 (Photoshop, film editing, and beyond)
  • Travel Channel/Ghost Adventures and Hollywood stills photographer credits
  • The Outdoor Channel credits as a video editor and photographer, 2011-2012
  • World Fishing Network videography for an 13 in a series made for TV adventure fishing show in the 2014 season
  • Spring through fall 2016: History Channel/PBS/pending approval documentary credits as a photographer and cameraman
  • And a whole lot more!

 

Quick personal bio:

  •     I was born in Great Falls, Montana and grew up in the mid-size town of Idaho Falls, Idaho, less than 100 miles from Jackson.
  •     I grew up fascinated with photography through an uncle in Montana, bought a Pentax film camera in my freshman year of college, and loaded it up with film. This was literally the beginning of a life long fascination, passion, and involvement in the world of photography that led to my current photography business, michaelgphotoandvideo.com

http://www.michaelgphotoandvideo.com

 

  •     I therefore have deep roots recreating (skiing, backpacking, fly-fishing, hiking, and beyond ) in the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem in an unusually active in the outdoors oriented family and therefore my connection to this area is quite deep and an important component of the ‘why’  of the founding of Lightchaser. All of us love it here, and know it very well thought a multitude of paths travelled.

 

  • While living in Crested Butte, CO from 1993 to 2000, I discovered the Crested Butte Wildflower Festival (CBWF).  20 seasons later, I have taught over 500 students basic and many more advanced techniques of photography. Many repeat customers over the 20 seasons came back more than once in July every year and took additional classes from me, which was part of how I came to realize that I had a 'gift' in teaching it. Still I always remained humbled by the beauty I saw and was able to share while teaching innovative, cutting edge and diverse photography workshops and techniques.

 

  • Moving to Boulder, CO in 2002, I took a 6 month multimedia intensive called "Accelerated Multimedia Program" (AMP) and received a certificate.

 

  • Certificate in hand, I started working as a digital imaging technician for a professional photography lab in Boulder

 

  • To jump start an entry into the newly emerging world of digital 35 mm in 2002, I  worked as a race and event photographer, shooting over 30+ sporting events around the Denver/Boulder area over several seasons: Mtn biking, marathons, and beyond.

 

  • A pivotal event in my life as a photographer and later video editor and cameraman came through volunteering for Mountain Film Festival in Telluride, CO, in 2002 as a field technician and projectionists. This I continued for the next 5 seasons of the festival. This is where the film/video/tv component of my life came alive.

 

  • Much more detail about my interesting and never boring journey into the world of film, editing and camera work that has now resulted in three different national broadcast opportunities :The Outdoor Channel, The World Fishing Network and a pending 2017 PBS show which can be found here:

 http://www.media-match.com/usa/media/cv/www.michaelgphotoandvideo.com

 

Most recently:

  • I currently live and work as a professional tour guide into Grand Teton and Yellowstone National Parks through Grizzly Country Wildlife Adventures, based out of Jackson, Wyoming where I have guided well over 1000 people and photographers into these amazing places and beyond over the past 4 years.

 

  • I also worked at a guest ranch up high on the Continental divide for 2 years, where I was a professional bartender, part time photography tour guide, taught and guided fly-fishing, a hiking guide, sous chef, and all around ranch hand. Fun stuff.

 

  • Theres a lot more, but you are not  here to learn about me as you are here to learn about Lightchasers Photography Adventures. 

 

Finally: Lightchaser Photography Adventures comes alive

    The idea of a School of Film and Photography has been with me for several years, and in a place like Jackson, Wyoming, with so much to offer outdoor-wise with nearly 22 millions acres of wild and public lands within a 2 minute to a 10 hour drive, plus a town that is surprisingly dynamic for its size, and a respectable airport nearby, Jackson is the ultimate place for the launching of Lightchaser Photography Adventures.

    The unique focus of LPA is the intimacy that our seasoned instructors have within the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem, many of whom have-like myself-been here for a multitude of years, photographing guiding and exploring all over the GYE.

    These workshops, seminars, and even multiday safaris are more than just excursions into the wilds with a camera: they are also a deeper connection with  the natural and human history of the area, the continuing successes and challenges that species such as the grizzly bears and wolves of the GYE face with their amazing comeback stories, mixed in with local lore and exciting visits to out of the way places that few other photo workshop companies even know about.

 

   And finally: All who donate over the $50 level will be listed as Founding Members in perpetuity. Pretty cool, huh?

Thank You!!

 

(And please dont hesitate to ask questions, provide suggestions at how I can make this campaign and Lightchaser Photo Adventures even better!)

 

~Let’s get out there and get our passion for photography into focus~

 

 

Any and all donations will be met with exceptional and heartfelt gratitude, and there is no doubt your role in the beginning of something like this is essential to getting it launched and successful!
story_txt:
My name is Michael, and I am the founder and Chief Visionary Officer (CVO) of Lightchaser Photography Adventures. Based primarily out of Jackson Wyoming, we operate our professional workshops exclusively in the 22+ million acre Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem, often considered "one of the last remaining intact ecosystems" in the northern temperate zone.Federally managed ( public land that belongs to all of us) areas that are within the GYE include:
National Park Service: Yellowstone National Park, Grand Teton National Park, and Glacier National Park in Montana, as well as various other surrounding public lands.
US National Forest Service : Gallatin, Custer, Caribou-Targhee, Bridger-Teton and Shoshone National Forests.
United States Fish & Wildlife Service (USFWS) includes the famous 22,000 acre National Elk Refuge
Ten distinct National Wilderness Areas have been established within the GYE's National Forests since 1966, mandating the highest level of habitat protection that the USFS uses.
The GYE also encompasses a great deal of privately held lands surrounding those managed by the U.S. Government. 
This is the area where many of our professional instructors have gained their great depth of knowledge and years through operating and having usually lived here for many years, including myself (bio to follow). It is this level of intimacy and familiarity with the area that enables us to create a unique niche amongst photography workshops nationwide, many that offer workshops here in the GYE but otherwise do not actually live here.     We bring you the most up to date information on wildlife: the latest sighting of well known and beloved  grizzly bears (such as Raspberry and Blondie), where the wolves of Yellowstone were last seen, and so much more--and of course we also know the deep complexities, challenges, and politics of the region topped off with local lore, natural history and colorful stories that just cant be  known by non-regional photographers. More than just a photography workshop, Lightchaser Photo Adventures are a truly intimate and diversified look at the deep nuances and incredible variety that this vast and wild area offers.    There are countless opportunities for intriguing excursions, safaris, and adventures to not only the famous and iconic scenes, such as Old Faithful or Going to the Sun Highway in Glacier NP, to many lesser known-and less crowded- places.Here is a sample of potential workshops:1:  The Living Landscapes of Grand Teton National Park2: Some Like it Hot: Geothermal Wonders of Yellowstone3: Take Your Best Shots: Composition That Rocks4: The Amazing Critters of Yellowstone5: Wild about Wildflowers of The Tetons6: Falling for the Fall Colors of Glacier…and many more… Lets go on a short little photography adventure first, thoughSo: picture this:   You’re standing in an open expanse of sagebrush meadows and colorful wildflowers with a stunning backdrop of rugged, snow-capped mountains reflected in the still waters of a small pond just in front of you and your group of fellow photographers. It’s quintessential scenery, and you’re ready with your camera. Yet the light has been very all-over-the-map since you got up at 7 am, and you have been chasing it all day. As you were setting up just here a few minutes ago, the sun went behind the clouds again blanketing the scene with less contrast and a flat sky.  Of course, you know that all outdoor photographers will come to face this type of situation, so you stand patiently waiting for that optimal moment.   And then it happens: A big beautiful bull moose walks into the scene and begins to wade across the small pond. The challenge is quickly apparent as you fire off a few funky test shots as he wades across the pond: You know your camera is going to not quite pull this off without some kind of intervention: The moose is happening but the light is not!   Not for long, though: Your Lightchaser photography instructor is standing right next to you and says: "Ok everyone this is what we are going to do-given that we don't have much time or good light let’s aim those lenses and start shooting."~Let your light-chasing adventure begin~    Lightchasers Photography Adventures, though based in Jackson Wyoming, reaches out to the photographers that are a significant part of the always growing multi-billion dollar travel and adventure tourism industry. From Jackson and Cody, Wyoming to Bozeman, Montana and Banff in Canada, we have the region covered with a wide variety of workshops ranging from 1/2 day excursions into the Tetons to multi-day wildlife adventures in Yellowstone, or we can be found chasing the light of the beautiful turquoise lakes ad skies of Glacier National Park.     Your photography guide also has relevant and unbiased knowledge of the current politics and complex ecological and stewardship challenges surrounding the vast flora and fauna, as well as the natural resources of the multi-state region of Montana, Idaho, and Wyoming (and to a lesser extent, Utah and Canada).    A great deal of this ecosystem centers around the 11,000 cubic miles of 4000+ degree lava underneath Yellowstone, one of the 7 super-volcanoes in the world, and also crazily embraces the highest elevations of the United States: the 3000+ mile long Continental Divide runs right through it all.  Snows and rains that fall on the east end west sides of the CD are the primary source of 4 of the 5 major rivers in the US, creating an incredibly unique and diverse ecosystem. The Continental divide is also  where the highest snowfalls in the US occur, all the way up to 1100 inches in record years. Countless streams, rivers, and lakes are the direct result of all this precipitation, and naturally all species of the region need this water -and the cleanest air in the US, usually-to survive. Thus, there is no other place on our planet that is both relatively easily accessible by humans (for the most part) and is yet so sparsely populated by us and still blessed with often untouched wildlands.  Its an amazing, soul changing place-and I never get tired of it...    This, then, is what Lightchasers knows and loves so well, and we endeavor with sharp passion and cutting edge professionalism to share and explore it with our students. Now lets get to why Lightchaser is seeking funding:Initial startup costs include the following: Phase 1:  Immersion of the Chief Visionary Officer (thats me) in the dynamic, challenging and rewarding business Startup Intensive right here in Jackson, Wyoming. story:
I moved to Boston for love.

At the time, it was love for a person - one who left my life. I tried to shift that energy over into my work, but I hated my job. Away from home, detached from the world around me, I looked up one day and realized that I'd been living in the city for almost two years, and did not know anything about the place, beyond where I worked and where I slept. Whether it be situations or interactions that caused the sensation, I felt limited, in life.

I could do one of two things: build in that direction, or change my life. I chose the latter. I began to focus on growing to know and love myself. I chose (and actively choose) to let go of the things that didn't help me find peace.

I quit my job. I bought a camera. I began to write.

Large shift, right?

When I thought back to the happiest moments in my recent past, those were the passions that lit a flame in my soul. I took to the streets. Beginning with a desire to explore the place where I lived, I became entranced by what I learned about myself from observing moments in the lives of those around me. So many of the answers I'd searched my brain for, for years, came to me in the shortest interaction or crossing of paths with a complete stranger. I began to open my heart to the world around me.

And now I am here.

I write about & take photographs of real stories everyday. & I have so many to tell.  & I’m so excited. It's my dream to travel the world and tell stories of experiences beyond my own, sharing these narratives both digitally and in print. I want to create a platform for others to have the ability to make a living for themselves doing the same thing: telling stories that inspire people.

I'm raising money for prints and other pieces needed to host an exhibit show.

Selections from my Strangers in Boston street photography series have been presented in chronological order in my social media, but I would like to open the door for the entire series to be curated & made available to be viewed in a night that brings together people from all across the city to experience art both through my photography as well as live music and poetry.

I’ve been wanting to push the button on this initiative for a while now, but have been working as one & have had to push back the timeline again & again. 

What I'm asking for:

I’m working to raise $1500, which will fund:

  • Location for my exhibition show (between $300-$500)
  • Printing & Framing of selected photos of Strangers in Boston series ($500)
  • Stationary & mobile display components - tent, paneling, signage, lighting, etc. ($500)

I'll be selling prints at my showcase. The remaining prints will be used at a number of arts markets and gallery shows throughout the New England region & beyond. Your seed money will grow into a part of the next level of my entrepreneurship and of my artistry.

This is the next step. Take it with me.

I began to open my heart to the world around me.And now I am here.I write about & take photographs of real stories everyday. & I have so many to tell.  & I’m so excited. It's my dream to travel the world and tell stories of experiences beyond my own, sharing these narratives both digitally and in print. I want to create a platform for others to have the ability to make a living for themselves doing the same thing: telling stories that inspire people.I'm raising money for prints and other pieces needed to host an exhibit show.Selections from my Strangers in Boston street photography series have been presented in chronological order in my social media, but I would like to open the door for the entire series to be curated & made available to be viewed in a night that brings together people from all across the city to experience art both through my photography as well as live music and poetry.I’ve been wanting to push the button on this initiative for a while now, but have been working as one & have had to push back the timeline again & again. What I'm asking for:I’m working to raise $1500, which will fund:

Location for my exhibition show (between $300-$500)

Printing & Framing of selected photos of Strangers in Boston series ($500)

Stationary & mobile display components - tent, paneling, signage, lighting, etc. ($500)
I'll be selling prints at my showcase. The remaining prints will be used at a number of arts markets and gallery shows throughout the New England region & beyond. Your seed money will grow into a part of the next level of my entrepreneurship and of my artistry.This is the next step. Take it with me.

story:
Short Summary

ABOUT

Shades of Color is a book that reflects the diversity of the world we live in capturing the beauty, spirit, complexions, and complexities of men. A book of empowerment, exposure, entertainment a response to what we don’t see in our everyday lives… images  of Asian, Black, Latino, and White men.

  Man was created by God and photographed by Steven Williams


Your support will help me raise money to fund a 216-page photography book that I began creating five years ago. In a world that has debated race, culture, religion, and gender through my camera lens I hope to give you a glimpse of God's beauty in Shades of Color. I celebrate the subtle complexions and complexities of men.

 During my travels across the United States, Europe, Africa, South America and Asia, I always study popular images on magazine covers, billboard advertisements, fashion layouts and the like. I look for images that resemble myself and communities of color … I rarely find them. This book is, in part, a response to what I have not seen. I want this book to be a reflection of the world we all inhabit. With the election of America's first African American President, Barack Obama, I hope everyone will look more carefully so as to move beyond racism, sexism and homophobia. I pray that the children of today will experience a world where power and beauty are not exclusively perceived as Caucasian, African, Asian or Latin, but rather as a glorious celebration of all of God's Shades of Color. After all, love is colorblind, so too is respect, admiration, kindness and beauty.



Steven Williams:

I am a Los Angeles-based professional photographer/ publicist that has traveled the far corners of the world in a devoted career that extends itself to the worlds of entertainment, art, charitable foundations, religion, philanthropy, as well as covering social and economic issues in Africa and America. My portfolio holds some of the world’s most celebrated luminaries from Destiny’s Child, Michael Jackson, Usher, Janet Jackson, Regina King, Jessica Alba, Rihanna, Marcus Patrick, Steve Harvey to Rodney Jerkins. I began as a child taking polaroid’s of family and friends. I soon found myself shooting weddings, headshots, and editorial. One day I met a young actress name Regina King at an event to promote peace between the notorious Crips and Bloods. She would ask me to shoot her wedding, at a time of my life were I was searching for a career. Regina King’s guest list included the who’s who of Hollywood. I would later be taken by Jon-John Robinson a music producer to meet BabyFace and his wife Tracey Edmonds. I soon began shooting their artist, Jon-B, Usher, Az-yet. Then one day Jamie Foster Brown the CEO of Sister 2 Sister magazine was at one of Clive Davis Grammy parties and asked me take a photo of supermodel Tyson Bedford tattoo. She would later post the image and offer me work and asked George Pitts photo Editor of Vibe magazine to give me an opportunity. Over the years I have shot for Ebony, Jet, People, Source, BRE, Q-magazine, Rollingout, and Vibe. God has taken me from an abused kid who loved taking pictures to having my work seen internationally. I still feel a desire to show our planet a more diverse image. 

I worked as a publicist for Roz Stevenson Public Relations our vendors were Universal Pictures, Paramount, Sony and Weinstein Corp. Some of the films were American Gangster, Last Holiday, Inside Man, The break-up, Pursuit of Happyness. I worked as director of historical archivist for the Ray Charles Foundation until 2015.

Ten years ago I felt the need to give back to my community and help save the children. I started the Steven Williams Foundation to help disadvantage youth and created panels entitled: “peace through education.” With the help of celebrities and professionals like Edward J. Olmos, Regina King, Tichina Arnold, Ray Santiago, Scrunchoos, Museum Director Charmaine Jefferson and Carlos Barbosa. We have inspired our kids to continue their education and reduce racial tension.

Your generous contribution will pay for a portion of design costs, high quality scans, independent publishing, Typesetting, proof reading, graphics, video, travel, video editing, printing, cover designs, packaging and everything that goes into creating and publishing a full color glossy 216-page photography book. The book is slated for release in April of 2016. I have launched this campaign to raise money to defray the costs of a book. I am excited to be using an American printing company that has been around since 1897. This project will help bring healing, empowerment, entertainment, and opportunities of employment to those men who have been ignored or slated not good enough. There are many perks involved and gifts that will be given from our heart. Much much appreciation to each one of you who took the time to contribute, share and sacrifice to make Shades of Color come to fruition. God bless you all!



Spread the Good Word

You have more influence than you think. It's in your power to significantly improve thechances of this project reaching its goal by spreading the news among your friends and colleagues.


Follow us on Social Media

We'll be posting updates on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr. Rewriting, reposting and subscribing will increase the chances this project's chances. Stay tuned!

story:
My life's work: photographing the fans of the World Cup

My name is Douglas Zimmerman, and I’m a photojournalist and soccer fanatic who has spent the past sixteen years documenting football fans at the FIFA World Cup.

The  World Cup is the most amazing happening in the world. No other event has the ability to bring together people from diverse backgrounds and different nationalities to celebrate their common passion.

My photo essay of the fans has become my life's work.

As the 2018 event approaches, I plan to travel to Russia to complete my fan photography essay and self-publish a photo book of my images from the 2002 World Cup through this year.

To successfully finish my project, I need your assistance and support.

Why Photograph Football (Soccer) Fans?

Football (Soccer) fans are often negatively profiled in the media. Sure there is hooliganism, violence, and intolerance associated with the sport, but the reality for the vast majority of fans is different.

I've discovered through fans mutual affection for 'the beautiful game,' their devotion to the sport has the ability to break down the walls that separate us helping us develop a greater understanding and awareness of one another.

For example, during the 2010 World Cup, I photographed a game between Serbia and Ghana. The Ghanaian fans could not be more different in how they supported their team than the Serbians. During one point of the game, security believed that one Serbian fan was causing trouble and tried to remove him from the stadium. The Ghanaian fans rushed to his aid and convinced security to let him stay. They were all there for the same reason, and they connected in their shared passion for their teams.

Soccer can bring us all together. And that is what I show in my photographs.

Why I need your assistance

I've primarily self-funded my photography project traveling to three World Cups across Asia, Europe, and Africa. In 2014, thanks to crowdfunding, I was able to continue my project covering the diversity of the soccer fans in America, as they experienced the FIFA World Cup from the United States.

For the 2018 World Cup in Russia, I have secured a media credential but will have to pay my own way. I need a community of soccer fans to help me complete my work, and I ask for your support.

Here is a breakdown of my costs:

I hope to cover the costs involved with finishing my photography project.

Roughly half of the funds raised will help cover the cost to edit, design, publish, and distribute the photo book to the campaign's donors. The other half will go to my travel expenses to Russia which includes airfares, accommodations, and transportation.

My goal of $7,500 will cover my expenses.

For the Book:

To design, publish and distribute an initial printing of my 8x10 and 11x13 photo books will be $3000.

For my travel expenses for Russia (I will be traveling from June 10th - July 2nd):

Travel (Airfare to/from Russia; transportation around Russia) : $2300; Lodging : $1200, Meals and Incidental Expenses: $1000

I'm excited to finally finish my photography project and share it with all my supporters and the world. Thank you for helping me finish my project, and I appreciate any assistance that you can give.

Also if you can not contribute, please also share this campaign with any fellow soccer fanatics that you know.

Enjoy this summer’s World Cup!!!

story:
If you are reading this, I've probably spoken to you in person, but if not I'd love to meet you sometime. I will be hosting a "Meet The Artist" event at Guncotton in downtown Hopewell on November 23, 2019 from 9am-12pm. My parents will be visiting my exhibit from Texas and they'd love to meet you too. =)

I funded this project myself so this page is for those of y'all who want to have a book or print in your home or to give as a gift to others in the Hopewell community, family included. Hopewell has always been my intended audience and I'd love to have these photos in many Hopewell homes.

Book: $75

Signed Photo Prints

20x30: $125 

11x14: $65

(Please specify which print you want by going to:

https://www.pedroledesmaiii.com/Portfolio/Proje... 

and putting the corresponding number(s) in your order. )

All orders received by November 30 (11:59pm EST) will be delivered by December 14 in person in Hopewell.

________________________________________________________________________________________

PROJECT STATEMENT

After living in major cities throughout the world, I am compelled to revisit the small town Texas roots of my childhood by way of visits to other small towns in America. The hope is to better understand both myself in my adulthood and America in its current state. 

________________________________________________________________________________________

HOPEWELL

One year ago, in the early hours of the morning, I found myself in need of a nice sunrise. A quick study of a map led me to the confluence of the James and Appomattox Rivers, only 30 mins from the place I was staying in Richmond. So I jumped on my motorcycle and headed toward a quiet morning of self-reflection. I didn't know it at the time, but that trip to see the sunrise on November 2, 2018 at City Point would be the first of countless trips I'd make to Hopewell, VA, which quickly became the first town in my project. 

Though the sunrise on the river brought me to Hopewell, the history and the people and places that make up the community spurred me to learn more and keeps me coming back. I’m grateful to the community of Hopewell for welcoming me to be an addition to the community. 

Here’s one particular moment I’d like to share: After spending a couple months here, Guncotton celebrated it’s one-year anniversary and I felt like I was celebrating my own community. My heart was full on that joyful day and the people of Hopewell gave that to me. I’ll never forget that. 

________________________________________________________________________________________

ARTIST STATEMENT

Pedro Ledesma III’s photography depicts moments that transcend time, inviting self-reflection beyond the instant captured to a place in time. These moments reflect his own evolving journey of self-understanding of childhood, identity, belonging, and community, evoking moods of nostalgia, empathy, loneliness, and hope.

Photography gives Pedro a tool of engagement into new communities and a new perspective on old ones. Like his studies in economics and engineering, it provides a language to both make sense of the world and share his understanding with others. Unlike these studies, photography has largely been self-taught, slowly unfolding with organic maturation.

Like many before him, his exploration of the world to better understand his place beckons him back home. The excited anticipation in his youth of setting sail across the seas has given way to a nervous curiosity in adulthood of turning over previously unturned stones in his backyard.
