story:
About

Le Monde Analogue is a community that welcomes analogue photography enthusiasts and features the high-quality analogue photography. We are dedicated to promoting the medium of analogue photography and the love for anticipation of the captured moments that arise from a developed photographic film. Our Facebook page serves as a platform for further development of the project described below.

We are two photographers who teamed up in order to build a project that would open the process of art creation to the streets, to people, in cities around the world. By this project, we promote a concept where installations of urban analog photographs are decorated with graphical art inspired by graffiti during a public performance.

The series of photos we aim to present is praise to everyday life in the street and to passion for rituals and small satisfactions. Photos are situated in different cities around Europe  – shrines for action, emotion and human drama. It is our intent to represent vibrancy, not in a single image, but in series of images, moments that never come alone but are blended together in a dramatic series. Main actors are everyday people revealed through trivial activities that create life in the constantly changing time frame and their dialogue with the city.

Why are we doing this?

We are highly motivated to achieve several goals:

-To encourage artists to join our group and to fulfill their potential working as strong individuals within a group moving towards a common goal;

-To bring creation of art to the streets, to make it accessible to people in the form of public performance;

-Artists will be inspired to join together in dynamic collaborations, rather than working on their own in isolation;

-Through exhibiting the graffiti decorated photographs via collaboration with a local artist, to display the local atmosphere, problems and dreams.

Event and Exhibition

After selection of photos, series of photos, printed in different sizes, will be put together into an installation of 3m x 2m rectangles, thereby creating a large canvas for the graffiti artist.

The graffiti artist will draw sketches across the photographic installations in a live performance. We aim to collaborate with local artists who are perfect candidates to communicate the atmosphere in the local society, especially among the young people.

The installation will then be dismantled and photos will be exhibited separately, each as a unique artwork.

The images will function well together as parts of a single installation, as well as separated – like the artists that produced them. We aim to install the first performance and exhibition in Berlin, the city that is a home for many artists and where art is alive and present in the streets.

What will we do with the raised money?

This first performance is what we are collecting the funding for:

  • printing of the images,
  • purchasing of the materials,
  • necessary preparations like framing and installing the images,
  • material required for exhibiting the artwork,
  • advertising the event via social media,
  • transport of printed images to Berlin,
  • gallery fee.

Links: https://www.facebook.com/lemondeanalogue/

The Impact

Taking it further

Our long-term goal is not only to move this event around Europe, but also to spread such concept all over Europe. One of the things we dream about is having such performance in several cities at the same time with live streaming. Images will be for sale in order to accomplish the self-sustainability of the project.

Risks & Challenges

One potential risk is that we are not able to find sufficient interest among local artists around Europe. The challenge we will face is to find local galleries interested in exhibiting the artwork.

However, we hope to mitigate both these risks by first gaining visibility for the project through social media during the fund raising stage, as well as by promoting the concept through our Facebook page Le Monde Analogue. In this way we hope to be able to inform and attract artists from other European cities to join us in this adventure immediately or during the later stages of the project.

Authors

Jadranka Kljajic is a photographer and multimedia artist based in Split, Croatia. She is mainly focused on people and places, choosing local surroundings as inspiration. She prefers the emotion analogue photography brings, but at the same time she is not limited to technique types. Her work has been exhibited in various solo and group exhibitions in Croatia and abroad.

Anita Krisko lives between Split (Croatia) and Goettingen (Germany). With her photos, she won the Silver Award (Artists Wanted) for emerging artists in Fine Art Competition. So far, she has exhibited her work in solo and group exhibitions in Paris, California and Croatia. She is fascinated by street photography, street art and in general by the atmosphere and moments observed in everyday life.

So far, she has exhibited her work in solo and group exhibitions in Paris, California and Croatia. She is fascinated by street photography, street art and in general by the atmosphere and moments observed in everyday life.

story:
My name is Kristen. I have recently returned from a year long stay in Cairo, Egypt. While living in Cairo, I was carrying out anthropological research for my recently completed master's thesis and working hard to understand the ins and outs of different social spaces. By contributing to this campaign, you will help me to create a photo exhibition and events that will facilitate a space for learning, art, discussion, and awareness related to Cairo and drawn from my experiences doing fieldwork.

Cairo has offered me a new sense of place and inspiration to attend to the relationships easily absorbed in the mass of urban life. These photographs and the stories that accompany them, illustrate the difficult to define relationships that Egyptians have to the streets, each other, and the rest of the world. They also illustrate my experience and the lens through which I was seeing and understanding all that was happening around me. 

Each photo will be accompanied by a story that will help to produce a visual anthropology and an opportunity to learn. Not only will this project build an artistic space around my experiences and visual imagery of Cairo's current situation, it would also give me the opportunity to host events involving lectures, fundraisers, and storytelling.

Currently, there are multiple spaces interested in hosting the project! Chicago and Normal, Illinois and Geneva, Switzerland are a few. 

What I Need to Make it Happen: 

I'd love for you to help me make this happen. Unfortunately, printing and framing photos is not cheap. Neither is creating or using an exhibition space or hosting an event. For example, to use a gallery space in Chicago for one month, the cost is 1,200 US dollars! To professionally print and frame one large photo costs between 50-100 US dollars. With the money that is raised, I will print and frame a selection of photographs that I took and that I feel best represents some of the current social issues, cultural spaces, and local experiences, unique to my time working with a community of Egyptians who live under harsh and unjust conditions. 

Major costs include: the use of a gallery space, event space and time, printing of photos, framing photos, and transportation. 

As a result of your support for the exhibition, your contribution would also play a role in a greater project. All of the profits raised from the exhibition will go towards a project or the support of an existing organization in Egypt. By contributing to this event, you will also be contributing to a greater opportunity support Egyptians from the communities where these photographs are drawn from. 

The Impact

Art serves as a way to teach and inspire - the impact of this project would be just that. This exhibition would give people the opportunity to understand a place in the world that is seldom talked about and often misunderstood. Perhaps now more than ever, it is important for us to create spaces that tell a human story and that foster a sense of empathy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's understandable that making a monetary contribution isn't always easy. If you're not able to, no worries. Perhaps you can help in other ways! Please, spread the word. Post this campaign on your social media site and ask others to make a contribution. 

If you know of any space that would be willing to host this project as an exhibition and event, please get in touch! 

Since this project is about much more than my photos and the stories I have to accompany them (it's about experiential learning, an understanding of people and the world, growing a sense of empathy and compassion, having a sense of wonder, appreciating art and culture, and building a sense of global citizenship), I ask that you take some time to learn about the current situation in Egypt, the events that have unfolded since the 2011 revolution, the people, the culture, the challenges and the beauty of living in a space like Cairo.

story:
Short Summary

I’m Allen Crooks and I’m a film photographer based in Nova Scotia, Canada.

In Spring of 2016, I’ll be opening the only independent darkroom currently operating in the city of Halifax. 

I’ve decided that the time has come for analog photographers to have an affordable and accessible darkroom RIGHT HERE IN HALIFAX!!!! Photographers will be able to develop black and white film and make darkroom prints while connecting with others fuelled by the same passion.

One of the most enjoyable experiences for me over the past 10 years in a shared darkroom space has been the collaboration and camaraderie that flourishes in this type of environment. This is my hope for this space and its members.

My love of film photography is driving me to do this.  My passion for film photography will help to create a community within this facility.  At the darkroom, we’ll be teaching workshops on film processing, darkroom printing for beginners, as well as intermediate and advanced printing and toning techniques. The building where the darkroom will be located will have a shared event space.  We will use this space regularly for pop-up events such as Instant Film Workshops, Large Format Polaroid Portraits, Tintype Portraits, Print Sales and so on.  

Also we will have a strong outreach to youth in the community with programs geared to engaging them in film photography as a means of creative expressive and engaging with others.

Why Do I Need Your Support?

To build a fully functional membership-based darkroom, in many ways, is a costly and risky endeavor. However, I am more than happy to take on the risks for the sake of bringing together an amazing group of photographers in Halifax.  Items such as ventilation, plumbing, construction of work spaces and enlarging equipment represent the major costs.  Additionally, a good inventory of chemistry for startup is another cost.  Furthermore, your contribution will help us to establish and sustain this facility in its formative years, helping us to ensure a long and sustainable future for the darkroom.

Whats In It for You?

Check out the variety of darkroom printed perks you can choose from as a thank you for your contribution. These include a wide range of items from a picturesque post card of Peggy’s Cove to a 20x24 framed darkroom print. 

The heart of analog photography is beating strong in Halifax, Nova Scotia, and I look forward to providing members with film processing and printing capabilities second; to none in Canada!

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Here are some other ways you can still show us some love:

  • Share the campaign as much as possible with friends and colleagues in your social media network.
  • Don't forget you can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the love! Or just copy and paste the link to share.
  • And last but not least; shoot lots of film!!!!

And that's all there is to it. 

My level of gratitude is off the chart; THANK YOU!!!!

story:
THE IDEA

"Female" is a book about transgender women, four years in the making. It is based on the fundamental concept that all women -- transgender women included -- are fascinating, diverse, and wonderful. Transgender women face a tremendous risk of discrimination, and all-too-frequent violence. The recent murders of transgender women in Louisiana are a tragic case in point. For the last four years, I have worked on capturing their diversity and spirit with my camera, and I have come to know them as uniquely special people.

ABOUT THE PUBLISHER

"Female" will be published by Daylight Books with a targeted release of Spring 2018.

From the publisher's website: Daylight is a non-profit organization dedicated to publishing art and photography books. By exploring the documentary mode along with the more conceptual concerns of fine-art, Daylight’s uniquely collectible publications work to revitalize the relationship between art, photography, and the world-at-large. 

ABOUT THE PHOTOGRAPHER

Pilar Vergara is an award-winning documentary photographer who has freelanced extensively for the Washington Blade, Washington City Paper, Washington Post, and other publications. She is now based in New York City, where she has focused on this book almost exclusively.

Vergara's interest in human rights photography dates to her early career as a photographer in the anti-Pinochet movement in Chile. Throughout her career, she has focused on those who are marginalized, misunderstood, and in need of support, love, and respect in our society.

A BLACK AND WHITE APPROACH

Vergara typically works in black and white, and you can see some of her other work here: www.pilarvergara.com. She approaches those she photographs in personal ways, always with an eye toward their humanity. To that end, shoots in natural lighting, without flash, for a more natural and intimate approach. For "Female," Vergara photographed these women in places where they felt most comfortable, whether in their homes, parks, or elsewhere. The select few images here reflect that approach.

ESSAYS/TEXT

The book will contain several essays, written professionally. The topics are in development. Stay tuned for an update on this campaign once that has been finalized.

THE BOOK

"Female" will be published to the exacting standards of any fine art photography book. The will have a slight coffee tone, in keeping with the intimate and warm approach. When published, the book will be hardcover with a wraparound laminated image. The photographs will be printed on 160gsm MAGNO MATT paper or an equivalent, ensuring tremendous production quality.

WHY THE CROWDFUNDING?

Producing a work of this caliber costs a lot of money. Even while a publisher is involved, there are costs far exceeding the actual publication. Vergara's funding goal of $30,000 will go directly toward her meeting that obligation. Please contribute. For as little as $5, you can make a real difference in funding an important book. "Female" will increase awareness of transgender women, the way they enrich our world, and their human rights.

Also, don't forget to "share" this campaign on Twitter and Facebook. Your help and support are so much appreciated!

story:
Hello!

My name is Ashley. I'm a single mother and a starving artist. The moment I heard the sound of the shutter on my first camera, I fell in love with photography. I had always wondered how someone could capture so much raw emotion and passion in a simple photo. Then I got my own camera, and I knew. I started up Five Elements Photography in 2015. My business immediately jumped off the ground and started growing. Shortly after moving to the Seattle area, I had all of my photography equipment stolen. After that, I contemplated just giving it up because of how much it was going to cost me to replace it all. However, instead of giving up something I loved so much, I chose to just start over. So here I am, starting back at the bottom with just a camera and a lens and one hell of an imagination. 

This campaign will serve more than one purpose for me. It's my first actual professional project. The plan is to create something that can be shared easily and enjoyed by many. I'm taking an artistic approach to the collection, not just doing traditional pose and shoot portraits. It will include the beautiful, the simple, and the downright ugly and weird. This is my opportunity to show who I am and what I can do. This is my chance to be noticed in the art scene. 

Any and all contributions will go towards making this whole project work, down to the very lens and lighting I use. Like I mentioned earlier, I've completely started over and seriously lack the tools that would make this happen anytime soon. Studio lights, a lens, costumes, makeup, etc. Once the photos have been taken and edited, I will assemble a high resolution, hardback book of the best shots. Once those are ready, and depending on funds, I anticipate on doing a gallery showing of the shots for the public. 

What I Need

  • Studio/Portrait lighting & Backdrop - $200
  • Canon EF 85mm f/1.2L II USM Lens - $350
  • Costumes - $100
  • Makeup - $100
  • Photobooks - $150
  • Gallery Prints - $100 (Or whatever is left)

What You Get

  • Printed & signed copy of 5 photos
  • Access to digital collection
  • Updates along the way (If you want them!)

If the goal is not met, all will still be okay! It just might take a tad longer...All funds are going to supplies. This project WILL happen! :)

The Impact

I can't promise my photography will be life changing and so influential that my name is remembered throughout history. However, I can promise that passion, energy, excitement, and soul will go into every photo taken. I'm always talking about what I wish I COULD do...this is me reaching out, ready to finally say this is what I am doing. I can't express enough how much this means to me. 

Risks & Challenges

If the goal is met, I don't foresee too many risks. I feel like my biggest challenge is going to be scheduling enough time with models due to my busy day to day routines. If the goal is not met, then this process will be slowed down tremendously, and I'll have to do what I can with what I have until it's finished, hopefully without having to stop and start back up again. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please please pleeeease share this with anyone and everyone! Spread the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools and support the arts.

 

Thank you!!!

story:
Conservation snapshots in the intuitive footsteps of gentle African giants

This isn't a 'normal' wildlife book. It’s a photo book about elephants, and more! I explore, with my camera, how elephants live in modern day (South) Africa. It will be, I hope, a fabulous mixture of photography book; personal travel novel and informal guide book. I also want it to be an important document about South Africa in line with serious journalistic ethics.

For example, there will be great elephant pictures (don’t we all love them?), with anecdotes about interesting (and sometimes peculiar) elephant habits and behavior. I also explore several reserves in South Africa, different schools of thought on elephant management and conservation models.   

In a personal way, I explore history and the human heart, as it relates to the relationship between humans and elephants. South Africa, with its complex history, I have often found is an interesting place to think about the human condition and to explore our connection as humans to the land. 

And to top this off, I do all this from, and with the help of, my tangerine Nissan Micra! :) 

Who is this book for?

This book is for elephant lovers, photography lovers, (South) Africa lovers - and other curious people.

How did you set the funding goal?

Producing a photo book is something I have done from start to finish before, including photography, writing, layout and design of my book on mine pollution in South Africa:  ‘An Acid River Runs through It.’

However, printing photo books is hugely expensive (on top of all the other costs involved in this adventure). So, I've designed this crowd-funding offer to first focus on raising a minimum amount of money - a tipping point - at which stage I will be able to offer pre-orders of the book as perks for helping fund this campaign.

(I have chosen a flexible funding model instead of a fixed one. That means I keep any much-needed funds raised here, to help me to keep advancing on the work on the book. However, I won't be able to start offering individual book copies as perks until I have raised at least $2,500).

At that point, I’ll know that I can afford to start putting together the book dummy ready to print. The next order of business is then to make the book available for purchase. By largely exceeding the goal of this campaign, I would be able to print more books up front, bringing down the cost of printing each copy. 

What you can do to help?  

I need your help to crack on with this – and fast. First, I need to raise the minimum goal AND then ‘pre-sell’ copies of the book, all within a 30-day period. This will help me get copies of the books into your hands.

You want a copy of the book, don’t you? Then help me by rewarding yourself with an early copy. Helping me to get the news out will also be a great help for me and the elephants. LETS GO! … Thank you!  

What are perks?

Perks are rewards you get for funding this campaign. (If reading this on a computer, you'll see them to the right of this text). There are many different perks to chose from at different prices. For example, you can reward yourself with limited edition prints, a family photo session, or social media thanks. 

*If you want a certain perk, you must click on that particular perk 'window' and 'buy' it - along with shipping to your location. (General contributions are very appreciated too! But the platform doesn't associate them with a certain perk).

For example, if you get the Tusker Supporter Pack, I'll come to your Johannesburg office and show you elephant pictures over coffee and animal crackers. And, have you seen the Elephant Dung Supporter Pack? ;-)

Where can I see more elephant stories from the road?

CreativeExperiencesSA.com

Creative Experiences(SA) is dedicated to my elephant-book-in-progress:

Creative Experiences on YouTube:

 

Instagram:

 

Creative Experiences FB page:

 
Who are you again? Tell me more.
 

I'm a photojournalist based in Johannesburg, South Africa. Here, I do assignment work for both media and NGOs, shooting both photos and video, often travelling in surrounding Africa. I have lived here for more than 10 years now. I was born in Sweden and studied and worked as a journalist in both the United States and the United Kingdom. You can see more of my work at Lottaimage.com

If you have any questions or suggestions, I'd love to hear from you. Click the 'ask a question' link above. Thanks for your support!

 

Some bean-counter and Ghandi (a lawyer) tidbits:

I will pay fees on contributions you make here (about 10 %, including platform and financial fees) and possibly some taxes too.

***

*Shipping charges are added to perks that need to be sent. You will be able to see how much shipping costs for each perk, calculated per region.  (If you don't see yours, I'm happy to add it for you).

The shipping charges will count toward the total amount raised by the campaign. (But this money, and other costs involved in producing perks, won't fund my reportage work, or other parts of the book-making process.)

***

I'm very thankful for your assistance and love hearing any suggestions. However, it's important to note that supporting this project doesn't 'buy' backers editorial influence or control over the book. Maintaining my editorial independence and safeguarding the editorial integrity of this project is crucial.

***

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

PS. If you are looking for details on my 'Mud Bathers' Prints, you'll find them here

This will help me get copies of the books into your hands.You want a copy of the book, don’t you? Then help me by rewarding yourself with an early copy. Helping me to get the news out will also be a great help for me and the elephants. LETS GO! … Thank you!  What are perks? Perks are rewards you get for funding this campaign. (If reading this on a computer, you'll see them to the right of this text). There are many different perks to chose from at different prices. For example, you can reward yourself with limited edition prints, a family photo session, or social media thanks. *If you want a certain perk, you must click on that particular perk 'window' and 'buy' it - along with shipping to your location. (General contributions are very appreciated too! But the platform doesn't associate them with a certain perk).For example, if you get the Tusker Supporter Pack, I'll come to your Johannesburg office and show you elephant pictures over coffee and animal crackers. And, have you seen the Elephant Dung Supporter Pack? ;-)Where can I see more elephant stories from the road?CreativeExperiencesSA.com Creative Experiences(SA) is dedicated to my elephant-book-in-progress:Creative Experiences on YouTube:

 
Instagram:


 
Creative Experiences FB page:


 Who are you again? Tell me more. I'm a photojournalist based in Johannesburg, South Africa. Here, I do assignment work for both media and NGOs, shooting both photos and video, often travelling in surrounding Africa. I have lived here for more than 10 years now. I was born in Sweden and studied and worked as a journalist in both the United States and the United Kingdom. You can see more of my work at Lottaimage.com If you have any questions or suggestions, I'd love to hear from you. Click the 'ask a question' link above. Thanks for your support! Some bean-counter and Ghandi (a lawyer) tidbits:I will pay fees on contributions you make here (about 10 %, including platform and financial fees) and possibly some taxes too.****Shipping charges are added to perks that need to be sent. You will be able to see how much shipping costs for each perk, calculated per region.  (If you don't see yours, I'm happy to add it for you).The shipping charges will count toward the total amount raised by the campaign. (But this money, and other costs involved in producing perks, won't fund my reportage work, or other parts of the book-making process.)***I'm very thankful for your assistance and love hearing any suggestions. However, it's important to note that supporting this project doesn't 'buy' backers editorial influence or control over the book. Maintaining my editorial independence and safeguarding the editorial integrity of this project is crucial.***THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!PS. If you are looking for details on my 'Mud Bathers' Prints, you'll find them here

story:
Why Poetic Portraits in the Mile High City? 

Hi there! My name is Khalisa Rae. I'm a author, poet, and an educator form North Carolina. I am also the co-founded of Athenian Press and Workshops in Wilmington, NC- a nonprofit & publishing company for female writers. I have been hosting, competing, and volunteering for local, regional, and national level poetry slam competitions for over 7 years.  By far, my favorite competition is the National Poetry Slam- the largest & most prestigious annual poetry slam festival in the U.S. This year, my partner Eric and I will be traveling to Denver, CO to compete and witness the awe-inspiring stories of hundreds- but we need your help. 

Imagine thousands of poets from all walks of life, races, gender identities and beliefs gathering in a different city every year, sharing stories, rants, exhortations, and monologues about issues that thrill, excite, move, and engage an audience of hundreds of random people. Their only job is to convince 5 random judges from the audience that their piece was well-written and well performed.The awesome thing about slam is poet only have a microphone and their words. 

The National Poetry Slam is not just a competition, but it is a well-organization festival orchestrated by a team of experts at National Poetry Slam Incorporated. The festival includes workshops that cover range from cultural identity, gender politics, to the craft of poetry. 

The hosts of the workshops and many of the competing poets poets on the national scene have awe- inspiring stories, but also have reached a huge level of success- and I want to get the inside scoop. What sets the slam poetry apart is: the issues matter, the talent is at a higher caliber, and the achievements are great! 

I got an idea to capture the commentary/ testimonies, and behind the scenes of competing poets and those participating in the festival this year. The National Poetry Slam is the Olympics of poetry slam and I plan to  capture the special moments of it. Some of my poetry heroes are attending, and I do not want to miss the opportunity to learn, to grow, and to be changed by them. 

 

 How Can You Help? 

Here's where you come in! Denver is EXPENSIVE. Here is what will help me and Eric get there: 

 

My portion of the hotel/airbnb for 7 days : $450

My plane ticket: $250

Public transportation: $20

Food: $180

What Do You Get in Return?

I don't want to ask for this money without giving you something awesome in return, so I have some pretty great (in my humble opinion) perks available! If you donate, I will :

1) give you a copy of my poetry book, Real Girls Have Real Problems

2)  give you a Real Girls Real Problems glossy poster 

3) poetic postcards- poems I've already written on cool post cards= broad sides. 

4) I will send you Real Girls Real Problems or Poetic Portraits in the Mile High City buttons

5) I will name my first born after you

 

(I probably can't do that last thing, but I'll send you a homemade card in the mail too if you want.) 

Going to NPS this year means a lot to me. It's a chance for me to be mentally, and emotionally stimulated, to connect with like-minded individuals, to connect with peers and mentors, but also to learn from educational workshop leaders and organizers. As someone who is starting their own non-profit and aspires to host a festival, this experience is invaluable. Even besides all of that: I love poetry. It's one of, if not the most important thing in my life. The community I've found through slam has greatly shaped who I am today. 

Thank you a million times in advance for your generosity! If you're not in a place to donate, sharing on social media is also incredibly helpful. <3 <3

story:
Introduction

Hi. My name is Matt Roberts and I am an Englishman who packed up his life and moved across the big pond to the United States of America ten years ago. An Englishman who considers himself very fortunate to have landed and settled in Long Beach, California, without doubt one the US's most diverse cities.

For the last six of those years, inspired by Brandon Stanton's Humans of New York I have been running a blog called Humans of Long Beach. This entails me jumping on my bicycle, cycling to all corners of the city, photographing the people I happen upon and, from our ensuing conversations getting them to hopefully reveal things about themselves to the world they otherwise wouldn't.

When I first started Humans of Long Beach people would say to me that a book would be a good idea but it wasn't really a suggestion I took with any seriousness until about three years ago when I met a young man named Chris whilst out and about doing my thing. Chris convinced me he could be the person to help me put it all together and now three years down the line I'm very proud and pleased to say Humans of Long Beach, the book is finally here.

We all love people watching, we've all said at one time or another 'I'm just watching the world go by.' Well for me Humans of Long Beach is people watching of the highest order because not only do you get to watch in the form of the hundreds of photographs that adorn the pages of the book, you also get to listen to the voices behind those faces in the anecdotes and stories that accompany them. 

What I Need & What You Get

Humans of Long Beach, the book will be a strictly limited edition. Once they're gone they're gone, and this is your chance to guarantee ownership of this remarkable tribute to the people of a remarkable city. 

If there is one thing I didn't know that I sure know now when I set out on my journey to create this book it is this. That producing a book of this nature costs a lot of money and with my outlay for design, printing and proofing currently approaching $9,000 this crowdraiser is not only an opportunity for you guys to pre-order thus ensuring you get a copy delivered to your door before Christmas but also a thinly veiled attempt to claw my bank balance out of the red.

  • The perks (for that is what they call them) associated with this fundraiser are naturally centered around the the city of Long Beach, California. From a postcard expressing your love for the city to the opportunity to provide each of the cities 12 libraries with a permanent tribute to the people who frequent them. Your very own gift to the people.

The Impact

In the six years I've been photographing and talking to the people of Long Beach I have come across people from all walks of life, from millionaire's to those living on the breadline and below and it is those people, the cities homeless population whose plight I have often attempted to expose. With that in mind I am going to be donating $5 of every book sale to a Long Beach charity associated with helping the cities less fortunate residents. The charity will be decided via the Humans of Long Beach Facebook page.

The Book

Humans of Long Beach, the book, will be a 312 paged hardback book containing over 450 photographs accompanied by 400 anecdotes and stories from the residents of the city with a foreword penned by the cities Mayor, Robert Garcia, and a preface provided by another Long Beach luminary, Community Action Team leader Justin Rudd.

The perks related to the book show postage and packing as extras but that will only apply to purchases outside of California and I apologize in advance to friends and family in England and elsewhere for the excessive freight costs. Everything possible has been done to seek cheaper alternatives. All purchases made within the boundaries of the city of Long Beach will be hand delivered for free by yours truly.

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally get it if you cannot support this project financially but please do not think your contribution must end there! I am eternally grateful for every social media share, every conversation in which you introduce HOLB to someone new and every LIKE or virtual high five of support along the way! So please share this campaign on your social media and tell someone about it at work, the pub, the gym or anywhere else for that matter.

This book does not signify the end of Humans of Long Beach, I'm having too much fun for that. It is merely the beginning so please follow us on Instagram @humansoflong and go to and 'Like' our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/humansoflb/

Thank you for reading to the end!  I hope you can come along on this journey, be a part of this intended tribute to the people of a remarkable city and help me to get this celebration out there.

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you all and have a great Christmas,

Matt

story:
Sections

  •     Why I'm doing the campaign
  •     What we need to create the book
  •     Descriptions & visuals of what you get (perks) for your contribution
  •     Other (non-cash) ways to help the campaign
  •     Background on the project

Why I'm doing this campaign:

Welcome to my campaign to create a book of portraits to help fund future temple constructions at Burning Man...you may not know it, but BM Org almost always come up short on the construction expenses and have to take money from other projects.  

My minimum goal is to print 1,000 books for distribution to burners and book stores.  My ideal goal is to print 2,000 books.  All profits, less production costs and tax considerations will be donated to Burning Man for future temple construction costs.

I'm doing this project in remembrance of my late wife, Ilene Kouzel, who never got to go to Burning Man and all those who have lost loved ones.  You can read more about that in the background section toward the end of the story.  

What your contribution will do:

Your contribution to "Burners" will enable me to publish the book and donate as much of the profits as the IRS will allow to the construction of the Temple.  The book will reveal our diversity as a creative cross section of global society.

What We Need:   $20,000 to $50,000

$20,000 is the minimum needed to print 1,000 books of 100 pages in length.  For every $5,000 raised above $20,000 I can add 16 pages and If we reach $50,000, I can print 2,000  144 page books.  My Burning Man contribution goal through the sale of books is $30,000 or more.

What You Get: Books, Cards, Portraits, & Portfolios  

I’ve created 16 different contribution levels (one for every year of the Temple from 2000 to 2015) from $15 to $10,000.  I’m  especially excited to offer you an opportunity to receive very unique, custom and personalized products in return for your contribution. 

The Temple of Stars offer is a beautiful trade edition hardback book of 144 pages with a dust jacket.  Below is an example of the current draft design for the dust jacket cover of the book using my photograph of the 2007 Temple of Forgiveness burn.    However, I am going to take a survey of you contributors to give you an opportunity to participate in the selection by giving me your thoughts as to the best image for the cover.  

WANT SOMETHING SPECIAL?  CHECK OUT THE

                         TEMPLE OF HOPE: 

Uniquely Personalized Collector's Edition  

For Burners I have photographed (or photograph in 2016), the Temple of Hope offer is truly unique.  You will not only receive a signed (to you personally if desired) book, you can receive a book that has a "chocolate" image of your choice from our session “tipped in” (printing trade lingo for impressed) on the cover of the cloth covered, hardbound book with slipcase.  

If I have not photographed you and you come to the 2016 Burn, I will schedule a session with you and you can pick the image you want from that session to have impressed on the cover of the book.  If an image from 2016 is used, this will delay your receiving the book until November.

Below is an example using the 2007 Temple Burn Photo:

Here is an example of what the book and slipcase would look like with a photograph from a session with me:

Alternatively, you may choose your own favorite portrait from the book or my color photograph of the 2007 Temple Burn and Temple Guardian tipped in on the cover. 

Below are additional examples of what a personalized book could look like:


Additional Perks

The Temple of the Mind offer is a set of 12 "Chocolate" postcards.  Below are possible images for the set I will create.  There will be at least one image from each of the book's divisions: Adventure, Creativity, Community, Discovery, Play & Joy, Sensuality & Sexuality, and Spirituality. 

Some of these images may not be in the book but, so far at least, this is the pool from which I will select the ones for the postcard set.

These and other images from the book--or your portrait session with me--are also available as individual prints as described below.

The Temples of Tears, Joy, & Honor offers are: 

Your Choice of Individual prints (color or chocolate)  in three different sizes (8x10, 11x14, & 13x19) mounted on archival board & suitable for framing.  Example below.


The Temple of Dreams combines a book, postcards and a 9x12 print.



For Collectors wanting something even more special

I am also offering several opportunities for you to have individual fine art prints or a portfolio of images from the book and mounted on archival matt board. 

The Temple of Flux offer is a custom, hand made cloth covered clamshell box holding both the book and ten fine art prints of your choice (Temple Burn in color; Chocolate image from the book, or from your session).  The pocket on the left holds the 9"x12" or 8"x10" print.

Another individual offer is the Basura Sagrada Temple portfolio.  This is a set of 10 individual 9X12 prints from the book mounted on 14x18 archival matt board suitable for viewing or framing and contained in a folio similar to the example below (color may vary a bit).   Once you receive your book, you can order the prints you want from the book so they will be unique to your collection.


My final individual offer is the  Fire of Fires Temple  which is a combination of a custom book and a portfolio of five 9x12 mounted prints in a custom portfolio. 

 


Multiples for better prices:

In addition to the individual offers above, there are several multiple sets that can be purchased which will result in additional savings.  So...consider getting a group of burners together to order the baker's dozen or other multiples.  These are:

Temple of Forgiveness:  13 books for the price of 12.

Temple of Transition:  13 books, sets of postcards & prints for the price of 12.

Temple of Juno:  3 custom books & portfolios of 5 prints

Temple of Wholyness:  5 custom books & portfolios of 5 prints

Temple of Grace:  13 custom books & prints

Temple of Promise:  13 custom books & portfolios of 10 prints


Other Ways You Can Help the Campaign

Here are some additional—non-cash—ways to help with the project:

1. Spread the word.  Use your social media contacts and regional burner contacts to let others know about the campaign, book and its purpose.

2.  Post your experiences with me or your support for the project in the studio on the comments page of this campaign.  

3.  Send me one sentence or one paragraph descriptions of what Burning Man means/meant to you.  I am looking for possible "one liners" or stories that exemplify your experience of Burning Man that can be included in the book.

3.  Once the campaign is funded, contact bookstores (especially independent bookstores) in your area to see if they would be interested in ordering the book when it is ready.  To help with this I will provide images of the cover and sample portraits as well as a description of the book.

4.  Are there burner events in your area where the book can be publicized and/or sold?  Let me know and I will support those efforts.

5.  If you have any other idea you think will help the project in any way, let me know and we can explore the possibility.

Background information:

2007 was my first burn, the year after my wife died from ALS.  I had no expectations other than a week of adventure.  Then I discovered the Temple of Forgiveness.  

The image I made of it burning—as a Temple Guardian raised his arms in a triumphant release of energy—stimulated me to figure out a way to contribute to the costs of construction of this important ritual at Burning Man.  This book project is the result of that desire, and of those whom I photographed for the project since 2008.

Some of you Burners may have seen or been in my studio at Center Camp:

If you haven't been in the studio, this minute long clip followed by a couple of resulting portraits will give you an idea as to how I co-create the images with participants.


This campaign is designed to raise funds for the creation, printing and distribution of a book of portraits of Burners all made at Center Camp.  

The book is dedicated to my late wife and all who come to Burning Man for whatever reason—many of which the book will reveal visually and in words.  I am planning for seven divisions of photographs:  Adventure, Creativity, Community, Discovery, Play, Sensuality & Sexuality, and Spirituality with essays and comments from Burners appropriate to each section.

How the portraits are made

When I am co-creating a portrait with a participant I try to establish a bubble of security and acceptance in which the person feels safe enough to reveal something of their character, and possibly their soul, to me, the camera, and by extension, a viewer.  I am totally absorbed in the relationship we are creating.  Most of the images in the book are the result of this fluid dance in which we move together and apart to tease out something from within the person that may reveal an aspect of their soul.  

All of the portraits will be printed as "Chocolate" images.  I have created a filter that emulates the Polaroid "cross process" which results in a rich shades of dark chocolate tones to subtle pinkish highlights.

Thanks for reading and helping the project.

Additional Perks
The Temple of the Mind offer is a set of 12 "Chocolate" postcards.  Below are possible images for the set I will create.  There will be at least one image from each of the book's divisions: Adventure, Creativity, Community, Discovery, Play & Joy, Sensuality & Sexuality, and Spirituality. 

Some of these images may not be in the book but, so far at least, this is the pool from which I will select the ones for the postcard set.

These and other images from the book--or your portrait session with me--are also available as individual prints as described below.
The Temples of Tears, Joy, & Honor offers are: 
Your Choice of Individual prints (color or chocolate)  in three different sizes (8x10, 11x14, & 13x19) mounted on archival board & suitable for framing.  Example below.


The Temple of Dreams combines a book, postcards and a 9x12 print.



For Collectors wanting something even more special
I am also offering several opportunities for you to have individual fine art prints or a portfolio of images from the book and mounted on archival matt board. 
The Temple of Flux offer is a custom, hand made cloth covered clamshell box holding both the book and ten fine art prints of your choice (Temple Burn in color; Chocolate image from the book, or from your session).  The pocket on the left holds the 9"x12" or 8"x10" print.

Another individual offer is the Basura Sagrada Temple portfolio.  This is a set of 10 individual 9X12 prints from the book mounted on 14x18 archival matt board suitable for viewing or framing and contained in a folio similar to the example below (color may vary a bit).   Once you receive your book, you can order the prints you want from the book so they will be unique to your collection.

My final individual offer is the  Fire of Fires Temple  which is a combination of a custom book and a portfolio of five 9x12 mounted prints in a custom portfolio. 

 



Multiples for better prices:

In addition to the individual offers above, there are several multiple sets that can be purchased which will result in additional savings.  So...consider getting a group of burners together to order the baker's dozen or other multiples.  These are:
Temple of Forgiveness:  13 books for the price of 12.



Temple of Transition:  13 books, sets of postcards & prints for the price of 12.



Temple of Juno:  3 custom books & portfolios of 5 prints



Temple of Wholyness:  5 custom books & portfolios of 5 prints



Temple of Grace:  13 custom books & prints
Temple of Promise:  13 custom books & portfolios of 10 prints




Other Ways You Can Help the Campaign

Here are some additional—non-cash—ways to help with the project:
1. Spread the word.  Use your social media contacts and regional burner contacts to let others know about the campaign, book and its purpose.
2.  Post your experiences with me or your support for the project in the studio on the comments page of this campaign.  
3.  Send me one sentence or one paragraph descriptions of what Burning Man means/meant to you.  I am looking for possible "one liners" or stories that exemplify your experience of Burning Man that can be included in the book.
3.  Once the campaign is funded, contact bookstores (especially independent bookstores) in your area to see if they would be interested in ordering the book when it is ready.  To help with this I will provide images of the cover and sample portraits as well as a description of the book.
4.  Are there burner events in your area where the book can be publicized and/or sold?  Let me know and I will support those efforts.
5.  If you have any other idea you think will help the project in any way, let me know and we can explore the possibility.


Background information:
2007 was my first burn, the year after my
wife died from ALS.  I had no expectations other than a week of adventure.
 Then I discovered the Temple of Forgiveness.  
The image I made of it
burning—as a Temple Guardian raised his arms in a triumphant release of energy—stimulated
me to figure out a way to contribute to the costs of construction of this
important ritual at Burning Man.  This book project is the result of
that desire, and of those whom I photographed for the project since 2008.
Some of you Burners may have seen or been in my studio at Center Camp:


If you haven't been in the studio, this minute long clip followed by a couple of resulting portraits will give you an idea as to how I co-create the images with participants.

This campaign is designed to raise
funds for the creation, printing and distribution of a book of portraits of Burners all made at Center Camp.  
The book is dedicated to my late wife and all who come to Burning Man for whatever reason—many of which the book will reveal visually and in words.  I am planning for seven divisions of photographs:  Adventure, Creativity, Community, Discovery, Play, Sensuality & Sexuality, and Spirituality with essays and comments from Burners appropriate to each section.
How the portraits are made
When I am co-creating a portrait with a participant I try to establish a bubble of security and acceptance in which the person feels safe enough to reveal something of their character, and possibly their soul, to me, the camera, and by extension, a viewer.  I am totally absorbed in the relationship we are creating.  Most of the images in the book are the result of this fluid dance in which we move together and apart to tease out something from within the person that may reveal an aspect of their soul.  
All of the portraits will be printed as "Chocolate" images.  I have created a filter that emulates the Polaroid "cross process" which results in a rich shades of dark chocolate tones to subtle pinkish highlights.
Thanks for reading and helping the project.

story:
Short Summary
Some say it's the greatest rock and roll band in the world: The Rolling Stones.
Gijsbert Hanekroot photographed The Rolling Stones extensively in the 1970s capturing the most expressive performances on stage and close, almost intimate moments in hotel rooms during the tours…

With an array of photographs published through various media there was still plenty of images that hadn't seen the light of day, until now!

Publisher Irina Popova and photographer Gijsbert Hanekroot, together with graphic designer Julian Deleij, are developing a unique photography book with previously unpublished photographs of The Rolling Stones in the 1970s.

Gijsbert Hanekroot
Dutch photographer Gijsbert Hanekroot (Brussels, 1945) began his career in 1969 and spent the ’70s working for magazines and newspapers. His career as a photojournalist perfectly aligned with the explosion of the rock scene, and he masterfully documented this golden age of music history—photographing many of the era’s greatest icons.

Gijsbert strove to capture images that revealed the human being behind the musician. Trying to express a deeper truth about his subjects resulted in portraits that are natural and intimate, relaxed and sincere. He retired from music photography in 1983 and became an entrepreneur.

Twenty years later, he began to digitize his image archives. This led to the publication of Abba…Zappa: Seventies Rock Photography (Rotterdam, 2008)—uniquely designed to recall a stack of photos—and exhibitions in Paris, London, Moscow, Tokyo, Bologna and Amsterdam. While working on his book and exhibitions, Gijsbert felt a desire to return to photography. He began again by traveling and shooting his way through India, China, Eastern Europe and the USA.

Gijsbert Hanekroot photographed The Rolling Stones extensively in the 1970s. This band is a big part of rock-n-roll history, the expressive moments on stage, and close, almost intimate moments in hotel rooms during the tours… 

What We Need
Books cost money to make. Next to our own investment we're asking for your support.
In order to cover the production costs of the book, we'll have to gather a total of € 10.000.
This budget is for the high-resolution scanning, graphic design, pre-press, printing & binding, transportation and distribution of the book; and yes it will be made one way or another, so don't worry.

What You Get
However you will support us, you will get something in return. We're offering an array of perks to you for every budget. The book will be offered at a 16% discount price (€42 instead of €50), you can support us either by a small amount because you like us so much and get a postcard or even get a book with a diner with the core team: Gijsbert, Irina & Julian!

Go check out our perks and see if there's anything to your liking!

The Book Design
Even though the final design still needs some honing and the number of pages keeps growing, we've put together a list of specifications defining the book design:

Size: 170x275mm (approx. 6,7x10.8in) - Narrow portrait
Cover: Black leather w/ embossed title
Paper: 200grs Munken Arctic
Print: Offset: Double sided, Rich-black and Full-colour
Pages: 1 (it's a leporello, fold-out design ;) )
Photographs: ±50, of which the majority is previously unpublished

The Impact
Both Dostoevsky Publishing and Gijsbert Hanekroot have published multiple photography books which became successful in the photobook world. Most of these books become collectible items and their price is growing with the time. 

By creating this photobook, we’ll add a valuable piece both to the rock-n-roll and photography history. As a supporter of this campaign, you become not just a part of the audience, but an investor and a co-publisher.

Apart from holding this special object in your hands, thanks to the generous contributors support, the copies of the book will also be donated to the public libraries and renowned photobook collections, and therefore reach an even bigger audience.

story:
What's it all about?

I'm a photographer, artist, author, teacher, wildlife biologist, explorer, questioner. I've always loved, read, and collected books. An early career goal was to become an author. I'm curious and like to try new things to expand my experiences and knowledge. 

As a wildlife biologist interested in the Big Picture - ecology, the human/nature/culture relationship, physics, climate, open spaces, and the psychology and biology of it all - I'm fascinated by the interrelationships of everything, tied together as John Muir eloquently pointed out. As an artist I'm compelled to interpret the world as I interact with it, from the basis of my own education, experiences, and emotions, and to communicate that as best I can to others. As an instructor, my goal is to inspire others to train their awareness and be open to all opportunities for learning, experiencing, experimenting. The connectivity between science, art, experience, interpretation, and education is obvious to me. The Big Picture is right in front of me every day. But, I also understand not everyone sees the world the same way I do. That's the driving force behind my art; to describe in images and text how I experience the world, to reveal the Big Picture in a beautiful and informed way that might inspire others to explore in their own way.  

Artistically, it's tough to interpret the variety of experiences in a single representative medium. I've spent most of my artistic life experimenting with ways to best show and communicate my experiences in a meaningful way, and will continue to experiment with artistic expression for the rest of my life. 

This project is born of my love of books and being creative. In 2016 I self-published my first book, The Ecology of Photography, about the "why" of photography. It was a challenging and rewarding experience that was made possible through crowdfunding and I plan to write more books. However, the mechanized, digital process of publishing that book made me feel a little distant from my work. I also make alternative process prints of my photographs, primarily cyanotypes, as a means to get my hands on more aspects of the art I create. So, I decided to pursue bookbinding to create my own limited edition photo books and books of my writings; to return to making stuff by hand instead of typing on a keyboard and shuffling a mouse or digital pen around. The book as a handmade book, and as an art form in and of itself, allows for a more personal expression and interpretation of the world than something made by a machine. 

To that end, I plan to attend a week long bookbinding workshop at the San Francisco Center for the Book, opened in 1996 as the first center of its kind on the west coast and now hosts over 400 workshops about bookbinding, letterpress, papermaking, and other book-oriented topics. I've been practicing bookbinding, learning on my own as I have time, but recognize that learning from more skilled sources and getting practical hands-on experience in a dedicated, intensive environment, is invaluable for improving at a more rapid pace. During the workshop I'll learn 4 types of binding methods (I've been practicing with one, coptic binding), including 2 case bound (hard back) bindings, flat-back and rounded back. I have several books I've been learning from that describe other binding methods that will be easier to accomplish following this workshop.

 

San Francisco Center for the Book

 

After the workshop, while I'm in the area, I will visit one of my favorite locations: Point Lobos  State Natural Reserve, south of San Francisco at Carmel-By-The-Sea where the landscape and seascape speaks for itself and where Edward Weston and Ansel Adams photographed some of their iconic works. I'll spend several days photographing and writing. From that visit (and previous visits), I will create for you a limited edition, hand bound book of the photographs I make and writings inspired by Point Lobos and the Big Sur region of central California, snugged comfortably in a slipcase or clamshell box. I will include thoughts on our  treatment of, perception of, and relationships to landscapes, on the critical importance of clean water and its various properties of beauty, life, alteration and destruction, and thoughts on photography, curiosity, creativity, and experiences at Point Lobos and the surrounding area of Monterey and Big Sur. The book and case will be designed, printed, signed and numbered, and hand bound by me in my home studio. The book is titled Point Lobos Dreaming. I'm only making 20 in this very limited edition, so stake your claim early!

Another book perk level is a chapbook of poems, thoughts, short essays I write during my time in California, maybe a sketch or two or a cyanotype or woodcut print, you never know. Yeah, I had to look it up, too. A chapbook is a small paper-covered book or pamphlet containing poetry, essays, stories (mainly children's stories) and other ephemera. Coming into being in Europe in the 16th Century, the name "chapbook" didn't get coined until the 19th Century and was named after the men who sold them on the street, called chapmen. An offshoot of the chapbook, often sold for a penny and containing stories of crime, the supernatural, adventure, & romance were called Penny Dreadfuls. The western Dime Novel in the 19th Century in America is also an offshoot of the chapbook. The chapbook is typically saddle stitched or stapled. Yours will be sewn. 

A third book option is a blank sketch/notebook, coptic sewn so it will lay flat, with blank heavyweight paper and a kraft cover so you can embellish it however you wish.

I've included some samples of photographs I've made in that amazing place, and a haiku or two, just to wet your appetite. 

 

Point Lobos

 

I've turned part of my garage into a small bookbinding studio, alongside my matting and framing and general makin' stuff workspace. I want to put more of the artist (me) into the things I make and the handmade book lends itself to a more personal approach to the subject matter I have in mind for the book in this project and future books.

 

 

Impact of this project

The follow on effect of this project is me learning new skills, techniques, and methods to express my interpretations of the world in my art. There will be future limited edition handmade, hand bound books that are an entire artistic work, not just photos and words between a front and back cover. I have a couple pages of subjects/subject matter already in line for future book projects.

I've been a photography instructor and workshop leader for 20 years and fully expect to incorporate bookbinding in my classes when my skill reaches that level because I love passing on knowledge to others. I'm also an advisory board member for 2 high school commercial technical education photography programs in Boise and Nampa and active with those classes. I'm an Idaho Commission on the Arts Teaching Artist and conduct artist residencies in Idaho schools. This continuing education not only helps me grow but also the students who I interact with regularly. Your investment goes much further than you imagine. 

Artists are (or should be, anyway) always learning, experimenting, exploring, always interpreting what they see and experience, communicating through their art. I'm no different. My wildlife biology/science background, along with the experiences I've had traveling, give me a different perspective on the world. Not unique, but different. My hope is my art inspires, challenges, looks good and provides some enjoyment or maybe even a bit of enlightenment. I don't know if you collect art, simply enjoy viewing it, or like to support art, artists, and art making (which I thank you for, regardless of your preference). I don't know if this book will have any monetary value in the future or if you care if it does or not. But it's my gift to you, if you'll have it.

 

Point Lobos

 

411: My need, Your loot

Your support covers the workshop fee, my travel from Idaho to San Francisco and Carmel-By-The-Sea (I'm driving), the materials to create the chapbook, sketch/notebook, and the book and case for Point Lobos Dreaming (paper, book board, book cloth, end papers). This need totals $3000; $1800 for the workshop and travel, $1200 for the books. Shipping will be added when you stake your claim. Additional funds raised will be used to create stretch goals or add-on perks.

* Everyone receives a unique handmade thank you card. It could be something I sketched, a small cyanotype print, a woodcut print, a 4x6 photo, a bit of writing, or whatever I'm in the mood to create.

* Depending on your support level, you may also receive an 8x10 Point Lobos print, or the chapbook of artwork, writings, poems, & short essays, or the 8x10 handbound, blank, 120+ page, lay-flat (coptic sewn), sketch/notebook with a blank kraft cover for you to embellish for yourself, or the limited edition Point Lobos Dreaming book and case. Remember, I'm only making 20 of Point Lobos Dreaming, which will be 8x10, at least 80 pages, though probably closer to 120, made with heavyweight paper (still testing, but will be at least 50 lb or 229 gsm), likely with a flat-back binding versus coptic sewn.  And I wouldn't be surprised to see one or more handwritten pages in this book.

* Supporters will receive 1 or 2 updates on this project page per week until I leave for the workshop. While I'm at the workshop and Point Lobos, I will make daily updates on my progress and what's going on. When I return, the updates will likely return to 1 -2 per week as I'm getting everything organized and into production mode. I'll post less frequent public updates as well, to keep everyone on the same page, as it were. 

 

 

oops! But it's OK

What happens if the Fates decree I don't reach my goal? I'm committed to attending the workshop, and this project is set up with Flexible Funding, so whatever funding I receive will go to offset costs and/or purchase materials for prints and books. I will honor whatever support I receive. A couple previous projects on another platform were hampered because it was an all-or-nothing set up. Everybody lost. With Flexible Funding, I get something and you get something, even if it's not everything. Everyone who supports this project gets a personal thank you. Support me at any book level and you will receive a handmade book; a chapbook, a sketch/notebook, or the limited edition Point Lobos Dreaming. If you support me at the print level, you'll receive an 8x10 Point Lobos print. If it all goes south, I guess none of us gets anything, which would be a bum deal because I want to create these books and you probably want one, or two.

 

Point Lobos

 

I haven't done much crowdfunding for projects. As I mentioned, the last one I did was in 2016 for my book, The Ecology of Photography, which included a gallery of photos from a trip to the Isle of Skye in Scotland (now available on Amazon). It was a project I thoroughly enjoyed and I'm looking forward to the opportunity to do another.

I'm a full time photographer/artist. Projects like this inspire me, perhaps inspire others, and maybe makes some small impact in the world. But it's art, and art must be made and sent out into the wild to be its own thing. I hope you're inspired to support me in this project. I am grateful and appreciative of your support.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

What stands in my way? Every time I venture out to do something there are potential blocks and hazards: Weather, mechanical failure, economics, accident, theft, and other unforeseen emergencies. Lack of preparation and equipment/tools to complete the task is also a challenge. Everything is possible; it just takes money, right? That, and commitment, dedication, and persistence. I have the equipment needed to complete the project, and I will have improved skills following the workshop. I'm all set.

For the photography at Point Lobos, the weather is always a primary player in determining the level of challenge. I've photographed in all sorts of conditions at high elevation and north and south latitudes, in rain, snow, cold, heat, wind, insects. Comparatively, the central California coast in summer is a walk in the park. Weather creates mood, interest, drama, story. Clear blue skies are nice now and then, but for a photographer too much nice weather is difficult to handle. However it turns out to be, I will make the most of it.

Handmade books do take a little time to make. With my current experience level, it will take me roughly 20-25 hours to make each Point Lobos Dreaming book once the design work, image editing, and layout is completed, which I will do during the month of September. Making the book includes printing the pages, making the covers, stitching the signatures, finishing the book construction, building the book box (clam shell or slip case, not sure yet), and shipping prep. I estimate I will begin layout and design, along with image editing and processing, in early September. I will have the paper selected and tested by then, and ordered, along with other materials such as book board, book cloth, end papers, etc. for the number of books I'll need to make. The sketch/notebooks take about 1/3 the time, and I can work on those while parts of the Point Lobos book are drying or pressing. Chapbooks are the easiest and I can turn those out fairly quickly once the design work is done. What will take a little time with the chapbooks is if there is any "manual entry", like handwritten pages or drawing/sketching or cyanotype printing that needs to be done. 

 

Point Lobos

 

Those that know me know how persistent I am (some might even say bull-headed). I've encountered enough challenges in my travels and life in general that I know if some barrier is thrown up, just to power through or find another way around. So, I'm not worried about missing this opportunity or failing to perform.

 

 

Other stuff related to your support

If you love the idea of this project but can't support it now, that's ok. I appreciate your vicarious participation. It would really help if you could share the project link to your social media platforms and anyone you think might be interested. Greater success in numbers! Let me know where you've posted and I'll send a personal thank you for your assistance.

  • By claiming a perk, or making a contribution of support, you enable me to attend the bookbinding workshop, make photographs and writings for the book, design, print, bind, and ship the sketch/notebook and limited edition Point Lobos Dreaming book.
  • You don't need to claim a perk to make a contribution of support.
  • You can contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim.
  • The Money: $1800 is needed to attend the workshop and make photographs at Point Lobos. $1200 is needed for materials for the perks; photo prints, chapbook, sketch/notebook, Point Lobos Dreaming book and book box.
  • Don't forget you can use the share tools to share this project directly to Facebook, Twitter, or copy the project link to add to any email or post on a blog, etc. Click on the heart icon to follow the project and receive public email updates.

Thank you for your support
